351.flavor: A sword is but one of many tools at a ruler's disposal.

352.name: Nature's Gift
352.keywordsHTML: Symbiosis: Whenever you play a Nature card, Spawn a Wandering Treant in a random allied row and set its power equal to the number of units with Symbiosis you control. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Vitality: Status that boosts this unit by 1 on its turn end. Note: Vitality turns can accumulate; 1 turn of Vitality cancels out 1 turn of Bleeding. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges.
352.ability:
Symbiosis.
Order: Give an allied unit Vitality (2). Charge: 3.

This ability adds 15 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
352.abilityHTML: Symbiosis. Order: Give an allied unit Vitality (2). Charge: 3. This ability adds 15 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
352.flavor: To live in peace, we first must kill. This is human oppression's cruel finale.

353.name: Precision Strike
353.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
353.ability:
Order: Damage a unit by 1. Charges: 3
Once all Charges are used up, Spawn and play Brokilon Sentinel.

This ability adds 14 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
353.abilityHTML: Order: Damage a unit by 1. Charges: 3 Once all Charges are used up, Spawn and play Brokilon Sentinel. This ability adds 14 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
353.flavor: The dryad queen has eyes of molten silver, and a heart of cold–forged steel.

354.name: Guerilla Tactics
354.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges.
354.ability:
Order: Move a unit to the other row. If it's an enemy, damage it by 2; if it's an ally, boost it by 2. Charge: 3

This ability adds 16 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
354.abilityHTML: Order: Move a unit to the other row. If it's an enemy, damage it by 2; if it's an ally, boost it by 2. Charge: 3 This ability adds 16 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
354.flavor: That doddery dolt? Ye cannae even tell if he's alive or stuffed!

355.name: Inspired Zeal
355.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges.
355.ability:
Order: Boost an allied Northern Realms unit by 2 and give it Zeal. Charge: 3

This ability adds 15 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
355.abilityHTML: Order: Boost an allied Northern Realms unit by 2 and give it Zeal. Charge: 3 This ability adds 15 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
355.flavor: Don't need advisors and their schemes. I place my trust in my soldiers' blades.

356.name: Mobilization
356.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
356.ability:
Order: Spawn a base copy of a bronze allied Soldier on its row and boost it by 3.

This ability adds 16 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
356.abilityHTML: Order: Spawn a base copy of a bronze allied Soldier on its row and boost it by 3. This ability adds 16 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
356.flavor: King Henselt did not look like a thief, but, with all due respect, that's really what he was.

357.name: Tridam Infantry
357.ability: Whenever this unit receives a boost, damage a random enemy unit by 1.
357.abilityHTML: Whenever this unit receives a boost, damage a random enemy unit by 1.
357.flavor: Soldiers loyal to the old baron of Tridam left the city with Falibor, thus becoming renegades wanted by the law.

358.name: Cerys an Craite
358.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
358.ability:
Deploy (Melee): Spawn a Drummond Shieldmaiden in this row.
Deploy (Ranged): Spawn a Drummond Queensguard in this row.
358.abilityHTML: Deploy (Melee): Spawn a Drummond Shieldmaiden in this row. Deploy (Ranged): Spawn a Drummond Queensguard in this row.
358.flavor: They call me Sparrowhawk. Know why? Because I eat rats like you for breakfast.

359.name: Saskia
359.keywordsHTML: Harmony: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a Scoia'tael unit, whose primary category is unique among all of your units. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power. Vitality: Status that boosts this unit by 1 on its turn end. Note: Vitality turns can accumulate; 1 turn of Vitality cancels out 1 turn of Bleeding.
359.ability:
Harmony.
Deploy: Spawn an Elven Deadeye, Rowdy Dwarf or Young Dryad in this row.
Gain an additional effect based on the unit you Spawned.
Elven Deadeye - Damage a random enemy unit by 2.
Rowdy Dwarf - Boost it by 3 and give it 1 Armor.
Young Dryad - Give it Vitality 3.
359.abilityHTML: Harmony. Deploy: Spawn an Elven Deadeye, Rowdy Dwarf or Young Dryad in this row. Gain an additional effect based on the unit you Spawned. Elven Deadeye - Damage a random enemy unit by 2. Rowdy Dwarf - Boost it by 3 and give it 1 Armor. Young Dryad - Give it Vitality 3.
359.flavor: I care not for kings and their titles. In the east lives one who truly deserves a crown.

360.name: Skjall
360.keywordsHTML: Berserk: Trigger this ability whenever power is equal to or lower than the specified amount.
360.flavor: Strike his name from the Saga of Elders! No one dare grant him shelter or sustenance!

361.name: Jotunn
361.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
361.ability: Deploy (Melee): Boost self by 2 for every unit more your opponent has on the battlefield.
361.abilityHTML: Deploy (Melee): Boost self by 2 for every unit more your opponent has on the battlefield.
361.flavor: Skellige legend claims the mighty and terrible Jotunn, King of Giants, reigned over the isles in ancient times. He was slain by Hemdall, but with his dying breath he vowed to return for Ragh nar Roog.

362.name: Whispess: Tribute
362.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
362.ability: Deploy (Ranged): Play an Organic card from your deck.
362.abilityHTML: Deploy (Ranged): Play an Organic card from your deck.
362.flavor: I'd be your best – and last.

363.name: Ritual Sacrifice
363.keywordsHTML: Deathwish: Trigger this ability when destroyed and moved from the battlefield to the graveyard. Note: Banished units are not sent to the graveyard.
363.ability: Trigger all allied units' Deathwish abilities.
363.abilityHTML: Trigger all allied units' Deathwish abilities.
363.flavor: We'll cut you up, boy. A fine broth you'll make.

364.name: Weavess: Incantation
364.keywordsHTML: Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Deathwish: Trigger this ability when destroyed and moved from the battlefield to the graveyard. Note: Banished units are not sent to the graveyard.
364.ability: Ranged: Whenever you play a unit with Deathwish, trigger its Deathwish ability.
364.abilityHTML: Ranged: Whenever you play a unit with Deathwish, trigger its Deathwish ability.
364.flavor: I sense your pain. I see your fear.

365.name: Mandrake
365.flavor: There you all stand! With wonderment awake, doubting the plan and high-discovery. Some, as if grappled by the fell mandrake, some, by the black dog's devilry.

366.name: Crow's Eye
366.ability: Purify an allied unit and boost it by 3.
366.abilityHTML: Purify an allied unit and boost it by 3.
366.flavor: A certain famous pirate once so loved this intoxicating herb, he earned the nickname 'Crow's Eye.' The theatrical version of his legend omits this, however, to the great consternation of pirate lore sticklers.

367.name: Vigo's Muzzle
367.keywordsHTML: Lock: Status that disables a unit's abilities. Seize: Move an enemy unit to the opposite row and give it Spying. If it already had Spying, remove Spying instead.
367.ability: Lock an enemy unit with 5 or less power and Seize it.
367.abilityHTML: Lock an enemy unit with 5 or less power and Seize it.
367.flavor: Never has there been a beast Fringilla Vigo could not tame.

368.name: Wolfsbane
368.ability: Damage all units with even power by 2, or damage all units with odd power by 2.
368.abilityHTML: Damage all units with even power by 2, or damage all units with odd power by 2.
368.flavor: Also known as 'the queen of poisons,' wolfsbane is used in many witcher Potions and alchemic brews.

369.name: Pitfall Trap
369.keywordsHTML: Ambush: Played face down, then flips over when the ability's condition is met.
369.ability:
Ambush: After your opponent plays a card face-up, split damage equal to its provision cost between all enemy units.
Spring: Randomly split 6 damage between all enemy units.
369.abilityHTML: Ambush: After your opponent plays a card face-up, split damage equal to its provision cost between all enemy units. Spring: Randomly split 6 damage between all enemy units.
369.flavor: Simple, cheap and deadly efficient - no wonder it's one of the Scoia'tael's favorite traps.

370.name: Cockatrice
370.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
370.ability: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 1 for each adjacent Beast.
370.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 1 for each adjacent Beast.
370.flavor: Always strikes between the vertebrae, under your left kidney or straight into your aorta. That way, it only needs to strike once.

371.name: Poor Fucking Infantry
371.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Bonded: Trigger this ability if you control a copy of this card.
371.ability:
Deploy: Spawn Left Fucking Flank and Right Fucking Flank on both sides of this unit.
Bonded: Boost self by 3.
371.abilityHTML: Deploy: Spawn Left Fucking Flank and Right Fucking Flank on both sides of this unit. Bonded: Boost self by 3.
371.flavor: I's a war veteran! Spare me a crown?

372.name: Lambert: Swordmaster
372.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
372.ability: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit and all its copies by 2.
372.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit and all its copies by 2.
372.flavor: Go teach your grandma to suck eggs.

373.name: Eskel: Pathfinder
373.keywordsHTML: Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
373.ability: Melee: Every allied turn, on turn end, boost self by 1.
373.abilityHTML: Melee: Every allied turn, on turn end, boost self by 1.
373.flavor: Heard you panting from three miles away. Just didn't wanna give up that vantage point.

374.name: Vesemir: Mentor
374.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger.
374.ability:
Deploy: Boost all your witchers on the board by 1.
Adrenaline 4: Also boost witchers in your hand and deck.
374.abilityHTML: Deploy: Boost all your witchers on the board by 1. Adrenaline 4: Also boost witchers in your hand and deck.
374.flavor: Killing monsters is not something to be taken lightly. Ciri must understand that if she's to become one of us.

375.name: Dwarven Agitator
375.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
375.ability: Deploy (Ranged): Boost a Dwarf in your hand by 2.
375.abilityHTML: Deploy (Ranged): Boost a Dwarf in your hand by 2.
375.flavor: Mark me words, if ye dinnae get up off yer arses, humans're gonnae come here an' steal our wenches!

376.name: Standard Bearer
376.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
376.ability: Deploy: Boost self by 1 for each boosted enemy unit.
376.abilityHTML: Deploy: Boost self by 1 for each boosted enemy unit.
376.flavor: You shall defend this standard if it costs you your lives! Gloir aen Ard Feainn!

377.name: Rotfiend
377.keywordsHTML: Deathwish: Trigger this ability when destroyed and moved from the battlefield to the graveyard. Note: Banished units are not sent to the graveyard.
377.ability: Deathwish: Damage a random enemy unit by 5.
377.abilityHTML: Deathwish: Damage a random enemy unit by 5.
377.flavor: You'll smell them long before you see them.

378.name: Alba Armored Cavalry
378.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Lock: Status that disables a unit's abilities.
378.abilityHTML: Deploy (Melee): Lock an enemy unit.
378.flavor: The wedge of riders thundered into the phalanx with crushing momentum. Like a dagger thrust into an exposed belly, the Alba Division swept unhindered through everything between it and the vital organs of the Temerian Infantry.

379.name: Temerian Drummer
379.ability: At the end of your turn, boost a unit to the right by 1.
379.abilityHTML: At the end of your turn, boost a unit to the right by 1.
379.flavor: Not the career he had in mind when he told mummy he wanted to be a musician.

380.name: Whale Harpooner
380.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
380.ability: Deploy: Move an enemy unit to the other row, then damage it by the number of units on that row.
380.abilityHTML: Deploy: Move an enemy unit to the other row, then damage it by the number of units on that row.
380.flavor: Skelligers have long known that harpoons are effective against more than mere whales...

381.name: Naglfar
381.ability: Look at 2 random gold cards from your deck, then play one and place the other on top.
381.abilityHTML: Look at 2 random gold cards from your deck, then play one and place the other on top.
381.flavor: Waves pummel the shore, waves pushed by the prow of the spectral Naglfar. Hemdall's horn rings in the air, and Hemdall stands facing his enemies atop Bifrost, the burning rainbow. The White Frost is nigh, nigh is the time of gale and storm…

382.name: Chort
382.flavor: A member of the Bovine Defense Force. Semper fi!

383.name: Ice Troll
383.ability: Every allied turn, on turn end, if you control fewer units than your opponent, boost self by 1.
383.abilityHTML: Every allied turn, on turn end, if you control fewer units than your opponent, boost self by 1.
383.flavor: Trolls come in many varieties, with differing shapes, sizes and predilections, though always with about as much brains as a bucket of rusty nails.

384.name: Venendal Elite
384.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
384.ability: Deploy: Boost self by 1 for each Tactic in your hand.
384.abilityHTML: Deploy: Boost self by 1 for each Tactic in your hand.
384.flavor: Ebbing is famed for its top-notch mercenaries and light cavalry.

385.name: Mahakam Ale
385.keywordsHTML: Lock: Status that disables a unit's abilities.
385.ability: Boost a unit by 5 and remove its Lock.
385.abilityHTML: Boost a unit by 5 and remove its Lock.
385.flavor: Considered to be the dwarves' greatest contribution to world culture.

386.name: Éibhear Hattori
386.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Create: Spawn one of three randomly selected cards from the specified source.
386.ability: Deploy: Create and play a Trap card from your starting deck.
386.abilityHTML: Deploy: Create and play a Trap card from your starting deck.
386.flavor: Only thing that can rival his swords? His dumplings.

387.name: Germain Piquant
387.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
387.ability:
Deploy: Spawn 2 Cows to the right, then Spawn 2 Cows to the left of this unit.
Order: Spawn a Cow on this row.
Cooldown: 3.
387.abilityHTML: Deploy: Spawn 2 Cows to the right, then Spawn 2 Cows to the left of this unit. Order: Spawn a Cow on this row. Cooldown: 3.
387.flavor: The hero Toussaint needs, but not the one it deserves.

388.name: Heymaey Spearmaiden
388.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
388.ability: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2, then damage self by 2.
388.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2, then damage self by 2.
388.flavor: Skellige women are wild and unpredictable. All units are to treat them as serious threats and never underestimate their capabilities. - General Directive to the Invading Forces of the Imperial Armada

389.name: Ronvid the Incessant
389.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).
389.ability:
Deploy: Boost self by 5.
Whenever you play a Soldier, Summon this unit from your graveyard to a random allied row.
389.abilityHTML: Deploy: Boost self by 5. Whenever you play a Soldier, Summon this unit from your graveyard to a random allied row.
389.flavor: This self-dubbed knight roams the world defending the honor of his beloved Maid Bilberry - though none are certain where she lives, if she lives still or if she ever lived at all.

390.name: Tainted Ale
390.keywordsHTML: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges.
390.ability:
Zeal.
Order: Damage a unit by 2. 
Charge: 3.
390.abilityHTML: Zeal. Order: Damage a unit by 2. Charge: 3.
390.flavor: That beer supposed to be green…?

391.name: Ale of the Ancestors
391.keywordsHTML: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
391.ability:
Zeal.
Order: Boost a unit by 3. 
Cooldown: 2.
391.abilityHTML: Zeal. Order: Boost a unit by 3. Cooldown: 2.
391.flavor: Boros, the legendary founder of Clan Fuchs, died after overindulging in this beverage - he passed out while reaching for his golden ring, which had fallen into a brook.

392.name: She-Troll of Vergen
392.keywordsHTML: Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
392.ability: Melee: Whenever a unit is destroyed during your turn, boost self by 2.
392.abilityHTML: Melee: Whenever a unit is destroyed during your turn, boost self by 2.
392.flavor: Lover of elf and onion soup.

393.name: Elven Swordmaster
393.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
393.ability:
Order (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 1.
Cooldown: 2.
Whenever you play an Elf, decrease Cooldown by 1.
393.abilityHTML: Order (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 1. Cooldown: 2. Whenever you play an Elf, decrease Cooldown by 1.
393.flavor: Combat is a dance, and you must never allow your opponent to lead.

394.name: Slyzard
394.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Consume: Destroy a unit and boost self by its power. If target is in the graveyard, Banish it instead. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
394.ability:
Order: Consume an allied unit on this row.
Cooldown: 1.
394.abilityHTML: Order: Consume an allied unit on this row. Cooldown: 1.
394.flavor: No man alive, no matter his brawn, no matter his skill, can parry a blow dealt by the tail of a slyzard, the pincers of a giant scorpion or the claws of a griffin.

395.name: Aedirnian Mauler
395.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
395.ability: Order (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 2.
395.abilityHTML: Order (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 2.
395.flavor: Ugh, these guys can be a real headache.

396.name: Geralt: Yrden
396.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
396.ability: Deploy: Reset the power of all units in a row.
396.abilityHTML: Deploy: Reset the power of all units in a row.
396.flavor: He lay down next to Adda's mummified remains, drawing the Yrden Sign on the inner side of her sarcophagus' lid.

397.name: Mahakam Volunteers
397.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).
397.ability: Deploy: If you control a Dwarf, Summon all copies of this unit from your deck to this row.
397.abilityHTML: Deploy: If you control a Dwarf, Summon all copies of this unit from your deck to this row.
397.flavor: Hoooahhh! Hoooaahhh! Hooo! Prepare yer hineys, clowns! Soon we'll be comin' 'round! Tae kick 'em till ye've feet for frowns!

398.name: Harald's Pal
398.keywordsHTML: Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield. Deathwish: Trigger this ability when destroyed and moved from the battlefield to the graveyard. Note: Banished units are not sent to the graveyard.
398.ability:
Doomed.
Deathwish: Damage a random enemy unit by 2.
398.abilityHTML: Doomed. Deathwish: Damage a random enemy unit by 2.
398.flavor: Tall one's Wilmar. Wilfred's to his right. And the lad with the stutter's Wilhelm.

399.name: Cow
399.keywordsHTML: Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield.
399.flavor: In Beauclair, everything is better: the wine is sweeter, the cows are bigger and all the ladies are above average.

400.name: An Craite Marauder
400.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
400.ability: Deploy (Melee): Split 3 damage randomly between all enemy units.
400.abilityHTML: Deploy (Melee): Split 3 damage randomly between all enemy units.
400.flavor: You daft? You mean to sail to Skellige? Those barbarians'll tear you to shreds!

401.name: Phoenix
401.keywordsHTML: Banish: Remove from the game. Note: Does not count as being destroyed. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).
401.ability: On round start, if Phoenix is in your graveyard, Banish it, then Spawn Phoenix Hatchling and Summon it to a random allied row.
401.abilityHTML: On round start, if Phoenix is in your graveyard, Banish it, then Spawn Phoenix Hatchling and Summon it to a random allied row.
401.flavor: What came first, the chicken or the egg? Compared to the conundrum that is the phoenix, that question seems downright trivial.

402.name: Lockdown
402.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
402.ability:
Order: Disable opponent's leader ability for the duration of this round. If your opponent's leader has no Charges left or is on Cooldown, Spawn 2 Operatives on your Melee row instead.

This ability adds 14 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
402.abilityHTML: Order: Disable opponent's leader ability for the duration of this round. If your opponent's leader has no Charges left or is on Cooldown, Spawn 2 Operatives on your Melee row instead. This ability adds 14 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
402.flavor: Why should something as trivial as birth decide who rules over us?

403.name: Stribog Runestone
403.keywordsHTML: Create: Spawn one of three randomly selected cards from the specified source.
403.ability: Create and play a bronze Skellige faction card.
403.abilityHTML: Create and play a bronze Skellige faction card.
403.flavor: Ofieri runemasters can combine these into runewords of incredible power.

404.name: Zoria Runestone
404.keywordsHTML: Create: Spawn one of three randomly selected cards from the specified source.
404.ability: Create and play a bronze Northern Realms faction card.
404.abilityHTML: Create and play a bronze Northern Realms faction card.
404.flavor: I'm getting a palpable chill from this runestone… did I do something to hurt its feelings?

405.name: Dazhbog Runestone
405.keywordsHTML: Create: Spawn one of three randomly selected cards from the specified source.
405.ability: Create and play a bronze Nilfgaard faction card.
405.abilityHTML: Create and play a bronze Nilfgaard faction card.

406.name: Devana Runestone
406.keywordsHTML: Create: Spawn one of three randomly selected cards from the specified source.
406.ability: Create and play a bronze Monster faction card.
406.abilityHTML: Create and play a bronze Monster faction card.
406.flavor: My blades're so sharp, they can cut paper!

407.name: Morana Runestone
407.keywordsHTML: Create: Spawn one of three randomly selected cards from the specified source.
407.ability: Create and play a bronze Scoia'tael faction card.
407.abilityHTML: Create and play a bronze Scoia'tael faction card.
407.flavor: I grow faint at the very sight of it…

408.name: Whispering Hillock
408.keywordsHTML: Deathwish: Trigger this ability when destroyed and moved from the battlefield to the graveyard. Note: Banished units are not sent to the graveyard.
408.ability: Play a Deathwish unit from your deck.
408.abilityHTML: Play a Deathwish unit from your deck.
408.flavor: It will rise again. Elsewhere, beyond our reach. Blood will flow once more.

409.name: Invigorate
409.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges.
409.ability:
Order: Boost 5 units in your hand by 1.
Charges: 2.

This ability adds 16 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
409.abilityHTML: Order: Boost 5 units in your hand by 1. Charges: 2. This ability adds 16 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
409.flavor: Though we are now few and scattered, our hearts burn brighter than ever.

410.name: Shieldwall
410.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges.
410.ability:
Order: Boost an allied unit by 2 and give it Shield.
Charge: 3.

This ability adds 14 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
410.abilityHTML: Order: Boost an allied unit by 2 and give it Shield. Charge: 3. This ability adds 14 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
410.flavor: Her curse was lifted… but her appetite for raw meat remained.

411.name: Rage of the Sea
411.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Rain: At the start of the owner's turn, damage 2 random units in this row by 1. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges.
411.ability:
Order: Spawn Rain on an enemy row for 2 turns and a Deafening Siren on the opposite row. Charge: 2.

This ability adds 15 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
411.abilityHTML: Order: Spawn Rain on an enemy row for 2 turns and a Deafening Siren on the opposite row. Charge: 2. This ability adds 15 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
411.flavor: Eist came to Cintra to help Crach an Craite win the hand of Princess Pavetta, yet wound up winning her mother's heart for himself.

412.name: Bone Talisman
412.flavor: The simplest of objects sometimes possess the greatest power.

413.name: Werecat
413.keywordsHTML: Thrive: Boost this unit by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a unit with higher power. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Deathwish: Trigger this ability when destroyed and moved from the battlefield to the graveyard. Note: Banished units are not sent to the graveyard.
413.ability:
Thrive.
Deploy: Damage all enemy units on the opposite row by 1.
Deathwish: Repeat the Deploy ability.
413.abilityHTML: Thrive. Deploy: Damage all enemy units on the opposite row by 1. Deathwish: Repeat the Deploy ability.
413.flavor: He hates it when you scratch his belly.

414.name: Werewolf
414.keywordsHTML: Immunity: Status whereby this card cannot be manually targeted.
414.flavor: Some say lycanthropy's contagious - get bit by a werewolf, you turn into one yourself. Witchers know that's nonsense, of course - only a powerful curse can bring on this condition.

415.name: Yennefer's Invocation
415.ability: Place an enemy unit at the top of your deck.
415.abilityHTML: Place an enemy unit at the top of your deck.
415.flavor: It's best not to get in Yennefer's way. Especially when she's in a hurry.

416.name: Letho: Kingslayer
416.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
416.ability: Deploy: Transform into a base copy of a unit without changing power.
416.abilityHTML: Deploy: Transform into a base copy of a unit without changing power.
416.flavor: Why does this monk wear studded gloves…?

417.name: Forktail
417.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
417.ability: Deploy: Damage all other units by 1.
417.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage all other units by 1.
417.flavor: As for forktails, bait them thusly: pound a stake in the soil, bind a goat to it, then hide ye in nearto shrubbery posthaste.

418.name: Slave Hunter
418.keywordsHTML: Assimilate: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a card that is not from your starting deck. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
418.ability:
Assimilate.
Order: Damage an enemy unit by 2.
418.abilityHTML: Assimilate. Order: Damage an enemy unit by 2.
418.flavor: The trick is to break their wills - but not their bodies.

419.name: Slave Infantry
419.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
419.ability: Deploy: Transform an allied unit into Slave Infantry.
419.abilityHTML: Deploy: Transform an allied unit into Slave Infantry.
419.flavor: A free man's got a choice. A slave's choices are made for him.

420.name: Iorveth's Gambit
420.ability: If you have 4 or more Traps in your starting deck, play 2 of them at random.
420.abilityHTML: If you have 4 or more Traps in your starting deck, play 2 of them at random.
420.flavor: Iorveth may have only one eye, but his inner vision is unmatched.

421.name: Slave Driver
421.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Lock: Status that disables a unit's abilities.
421.ability: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2. Increase damage by 1 for each Locked unit.
421.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2. Increase damage by 1 for each Locked unit.
421.flavor: What drives a slave driver? A solitary purpose: to see his orders carried out to the letter.

422.name: Saesenthessis: Blaze
422.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges.
422.ability:
Order: Damage an enemy unit by 1. 
Charge: 5.
422.abilityHTML: Order: Damage an enemy unit by 1. Charge: 5.
422.flavor: I inherited my father's ability to assume other forms - well, one other form, in my case.

423.name: Isengrim's Council
423.ability: Look at a random Dwarf, Dryad and Elf from your deck, then play one and boost it by 2.
423.abilityHTML: Look at a random Dwarf, Dryad and Elf from your deck, then play one and boost it by 2.
423.flavor: Before us lies Elskerdeg Pass, and beyond that, Zerrikania and Hakland. Before us lies a long and dangerous road. If we are to walk it together… let us put aside our mistrust.

424.name: Master of Disguise
424.keywordsHTML: Lock: Status that disables a unit's abilities.
424.ability: At the end of every allied turn, boost self by 1 if there is a Locked enemy.
424.abilityHTML: At the end of every allied turn, boost self by 1 if there is a Locked enemy.
424.flavor: O Great Sun which dost in Heavens fly, save us from the lice which do so stubbornly infest our bloomers.

425.name: Recruit
425.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
425.ability: Deploy: Boost an allied Soldier by 3.
425.abilityHTML: Deploy: Boost an allied Soldier by 3.
425.flavor: His is not to reason why, his is but… to peel one damned spud after another.

426.name: Seltkirk of Gulet
426.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Duel: Units take turns dealing damage equal to their power until one of them is destroyed.
426.abilityHTML: Order (Melee): Duel an enemy unit.
426.flavor: Though famed for his many virtues, his indomitable courage first and foremost, Seltkirk was not spared the fate which met all those killed in the Battle of Upper Aedirn.

427.name: Ointment
427.keywordsHTML: Heal: If a unit's current power is lower than its base power, restore it either to base power or by the amount specified.
427.ability:
Boost a unit by 5.
If it's a Soldier, Heal it first.
427.abilityHTML: Boost a unit by 5. If it's a Soldier, Heal it first.
427.flavor: Will it help? Who knows. Shouldn't do any harm, though. Probably.

428.name: Vandergrift
428.keywordsHTML: Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit. Resilience: Status that allows a unit to remain on the battlefield at the end of the round, then disappears.\nNote: Boost and Armor are not carried over to the next round.
428.flavor: The general thought the war for the Lormark would end quickly, with minimal losses… yet wound up fighting it for all eternity.

429.name: Mad Kiyan
429.keywordsHTML: Formation: If played on the melee row, gain Zeal. If played on the ranged row, boost self by 1. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit.
429.ability:
Formation.
Order: Damage an enemy unit by the amount Mad Kiyan is boosted.
Deathblow: Reset own power.
429.abilityHTML: Formation. Order: Damage an enemy unit by the amount Mad Kiyan is boosted. Deathblow: Reset own power.
429.flavor: We live on a placid island of ignorance in the midst of black seas of infinity, and it was not meant that we should voyage far.

430.name: Kaedweni Knight
430.keywordsHTML: Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).
430.ability: When played or Summoned from the deck, boost self by 3.
430.abilityHTML: When played or Summoned from the deck, boost self by 3.
430.flavor: Not every man in the Kaedweni Army supports his king's politics. Yet not a single one would dare say that out loud.

431.name: Giant Boar
431.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
431.ability:
Deploy (Melee): Boost self by 1 for each damaged unit.
Deploy (Ranged): Boost self by the amount a unit is damaged.
431.abilityHTML: Deploy (Melee): Boost self by 1 for each damaged unit. Deploy (Ranged): Boost self by the amount a unit is damaged.
431.flavor: Most men, seeing a massive boar in the woods, mess their trousers and scurry up the nearest tree. A Skelliger, though - he just drools.

432.name: Kaedweni Revenant
432.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).
432.ability:
Order: Damage a unit by 1.
Deathblow: Spawn a base copy of Kaedweni Revenant and Summon it to this row.
432.abilityHTML: Order: Damage a unit by 1. Deathblow: Spawn a base copy of Kaedweni Revenant and Summon it to this row.
432.flavor: Doomed to repeat the same day over and over again, just like the employees of Cianfanelli Bank.

433.name: Cursed Knight
433.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
433.ability: Deploy: Transform an allied unit that is not a Cursed Knight into a Cursed Knight without changing its power.
433.abilityHTML: Deploy: Transform an allied unit that is not a Cursed Knight into a Cursed Knight without changing its power.
433.flavor: He fights an endless war whose beginning he no longer remembers.

434.name: Ciri: Nova
434.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Resilience: Status that allows a unit to remain on the battlefield at the end of the round, then disappears.\nNote: Boost and Armor are not carried over to the next round. Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit. Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses.
434.ability: Deploy: If your starting deck does not have cards with provision cost 10 or more, gain Resilience, Shield and Veil.
434.abilityHTML: Deploy: If your starting deck does not have cards with provision cost 10 or more, gain Resilience, Shield and Veil.
434.flavor: Zireael possesses a great power she cannot control. She is a danger - to herself, to others. Until she learns to control it, she should remain isolated.

435.name: Shupe's Day Off
435.ability: If your starting deck has no duplicates, send Shupe on an adventure.
435.abilityHTML: If your starting deck has no duplicates, send Shupe on an adventure.
435.flavor: Other trolls always considered him a bit odd - after all, who in their right mind would prefer colorful scraps of paper to rocks?

436.name: Forbidden Magic
436.keywordsHTML: Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).
436.ability:
Damage an enemy unit by 2. 
Deathblow: Spawn a Kaedweni Revenant and Summon it to a random allied row.
436.abilityHTML: Damage an enemy unit by 2. Deathblow: Spawn a Kaedweni Revenant and Summon it to a random allied row.
436.flavor: Prohibited? Yes. Eliminated? Far from it.

437.name: Damned Sorceress
437.keywordsHTML: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
437.ability:
Zeal. Order: Destroy a unit's Shield then boost self by 2. 
Cooldown: 1.
437.abilityHTML: Zeal. Order: Destroy a unit's Shield then boost self by 2. Cooldown: 1.
437.flavor: Sabrina's curse spared no one, not even her fellow practitioners.

438.name: Doppler
438.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
438.ability: Deploy: Choose a unit in your hand, then boost self by the total number of units in your hand which have the same primary category as that unit.
438.abilityHTML: Deploy: Choose a unit in your hand, then boost self by the total number of units in your hand which have the same primary category as that unit.
438.flavor: Humans despise dopplers so much, they feel mere execution does not suffice - so they tie any they catch to a stake, cover them in thick clay and bake them in a fire.

439.name: Sihil
439.keywordsHTML: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
439.ability:
Zeal.
Order: Damage an enemy unit by 1.
Deathblow: Increase Sihil's Order damage by 1 until moved from the battlefield.
Cooldown: 2.
439.abilityHTML: Zeal. Order: Damage an enemy unit by 1. Deathblow: Increase Sihil's Order damage by 1 until moved from the battlefield. Cooldown: 2.
439.flavor: What's written on this blade? That a curse? No. An insult.

440.name: Bloody Flail
440.keywordsHTML: Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor.
440.ability:
Give an enemy unit Bleeding for 8 turns.
For each Soldier you control, decrease the Bleeding duration by 1 and damage that unit by 1 instead.
440.abilityHTML: Give an enemy unit Bleeding for 8 turns. For each Soldier you control, decrease the Bleeding duration by 1 and damage that unit by 1 instead.
440.flavor: There are weapons banned in all the Northern Realms, for the wounds they deal are horrible beyond all imagining.

441.name: Bekker's Rockslide
441.flavor: All it takes is one pebble and we're all done for.

442.name: Glorious Hunt
442.ability: Destroy the unit with the highest base power.
442.abilityHTML: Destroy the unit with the highest base power.
442.flavor: By the gods' gonads, witcher, why'd you bring me this filth?! I want that beast's head! - that was a ploughin' figure of ploughin' speech!

443.name: Half-Elf Hunter
443.keywordsHTML: Harmony: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a Scoia'tael unit, whose primary category is unique among all of your units. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
443.ability:
Harmony.
Deploy: Spawn an Elven Deadeye into this row.
443.abilityHTML: Harmony. Deploy: Spawn an Elven Deadeye into this row.
443.flavor: Hated by men, reviled by elves and always picked last during schoolyard games. No wonder half-elves tend to have a chip on their shoulder.

444.name: Dragon's Dream
444.keywordsHTML: Spawn: Add a card to the game. Dragon's Dream: At the start of the owner's turn, when timer expires, damage all units in this row by 3.
444.ability: Spawn Dragon's Dream on an enemy row for 3 turns.
444.abilityHTML: Spawn Dragon's Dream on an enemy row for 3 turns.
444.flavor: In Zerrikania, dragon worship dominates every aspect of daily life. Thus it comes as no surprise they name weapons in their honor.

445.name: Elven Scout
445.ability: Whenever an allied Trap is triggered, boost self by 2.
445.abilityHTML: Whenever an allied Trap is triggered, boost self by 2.
445.flavor: They say elves leave no tracks in the snow, but if you ask me, they are just a pack of village idiots, babbling nonsense.

447.name: Yoana
447.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Heal: If a unit's current power is lower than its base power, restore it either to base power or by the amount specified. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges.
447.ability:
Order: Heal an allied unit by 2.
Charge: 1.
Gain 1 Charge whenever an adjacent unit takes damage.
447.abilityHTML: Order: Heal an allied unit by 2. Charge: 1. Gain 1 Charge whenever an adjacent unit takes damage.
447.flavor: No one'd ever think I could be a skilled armorer - a human, and a woman to boot. A dwarven blacksmith - that's another story…

448.name: Crushing Trap
448.keywordsHTML: Ambush: Played face down, then flips over when the ability's condition is met.
448.ability:
Spring: Damage all units on a row by 1.
Ambush: After 2 turns, at the end of your turn, damage all enemy units on the row with the most units by 2.
448.abilityHTML: Spring: Damage all units on a row by 1. Ambush: After 2 turns, at the end of your turn, damage all enemy units on the row with the most units by 2.
448.flavor: When this knocks you down, you don't get up again.

449.name: Derran
449.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
449.ability: Deploy (Ranged): Damage self by 3, then move a card from your deck to your graveyard.
449.abilityHTML: Deploy (Ranged): Damage self by 3, then move a card from your deck to your graveyard.
449.flavor: Whatever caused this madness must have been terrifying…

450.name: Rock Barrage
450.ability: Damage an enemy unit by 4 and move it to the other row.
450.abilityHTML: Damage an enemy unit by 4 and move it to the other row.
450.flavor: Someday, when you are older, you could get hit by a boulder.

451.name: Vandergrift's Blade
451.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
451.ability:
Deploy: Boost an allied unit by 6. 
Whenever you play a Knight, boost it by 1.
451.abilityHTML: Deploy: Boost an allied unit by 6. Whenever you play a Knight, boost it by 1.
451.flavor: Seltkirk shattered Vandergrift's sword during a knights' tourney in Ard Carraigh. Afterwards Vandergrift, enraged at his weapon's failure, ordered a new one forged, this time with powerful runestones enchanted into it.

452.name: Sabrina's Inferno
452.ability: Damage each non-Specter unit by 1. If any were destroyed, repeat this ability once.
452.abilityHTML: Damage each non-Specter unit by 1. If any were destroyed, repeat this ability once.
452.flavor: With her dying breath, Sabrina Glevissig cast a powerful curse that struck not only her executioners, but all who stood nearby.

453.name: Mahakam Horn
453.keywordsHTML: Ambush: Played face down, then flips over when the ability's condition is met.
453.ability:
Spring: Boost adjacent units by 3.
Ambush: When your opponent passes, boost adjacent units by 4.
453.abilityHTML: Spring: Boost adjacent units by 3. Ambush: When your opponent passes, boost adjacent units by 4.
453.flavor: Once upon a time, Mahakam held a horn-blowing contest. That day the dwarves made an important discovery: loud noises and snow-capped peaks do not play well together.

454.name: Mastercrafted Spear
454.keywordsHTML: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges.
454.ability:
Zeal.
Order: Damage an enemy unit by 1.
Charge: 4.
Limit 1 Charge per turn.
454.abilityHTML: Zeal. Order: Damage an enemy unit by 1. Charge: 4. Limit 1 Charge per turn.
454.flavor: Hold that spear up, weakling! Not a single horse shall pass!

455.name: Parasite
455.ability: Damage an enemy unit by 6, or boost an allied unit by 6.
455.abilityHTML: Damage an enemy unit by 6, or boost an allied unit by 6.

456.name: Winch
456.keywordsHTML: Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
456.ability: Boost an allied unit by 5 and reduce its Cooldown by 3.
456.abilityHTML: Boost an allied unit by 5 and reduce its Cooldown by 3.
456.flavor: It's a winch. Not much to flap your jaw about.

457.name: Ruehin
457.keywordsHTML: Deathwish: Trigger this ability when destroyed and moved from the battlefield to the graveyard. Note: Banished units are not sent to the graveyard. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).
457.ability: Deathwish: On allied turn end, Summon this unit from your graveyard to a random allied row.
457.abilityHTML: Deathwish: On allied turn end, Summon this unit from your graveyard to a random allied row.
457.flavor: No one has ever entered that forest and lived to tell the tale…

458.name: Watchman
458.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit.
458.ability: Order: Give an adjacent unit a Shield.
458.abilityHTML: Order: Give an adjacent unit a Shield.
458.flavor: I can't even see over this bloody thing.

459.name: Cadaverine
459.keywordsHTML: Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
459.ability: Poison an enemy unit, then Spawn a base copy of it on the opposite row.
459.abilityHTML: Poison an enemy unit, then Spawn a base copy of it on the opposite row.
459.flavor: I don't trust my life to chance. I trust it to a thick coating of Cadaverine on my blade.

460.name: Vrygheff
460.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
460.ability: Deploy: Trigger the Deploy abilities of adjacent bronze Soldiers.
460.abilityHTML: Deploy: Trigger the Deploy abilities of adjacent bronze Soldiers.
460.flavor: An eye for an eye only ends when the whole world's blind.

461.name: Pavko Gale
461.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
461.ability:
Order (Ranged): Damage a unit by 1. Cooldown: 1.
If you control only Scoia'tael units, damage a unit by 2 instead.
461.abilityHTML: Order (Ranged): Damage a unit by 1. Cooldown: 1. If you control only Scoia'tael units, damage a unit by 2 instead.
461.flavor: No one smuggled as much food to the elves of the Blue Mountains as Gale. He'd bring them sacks of turnips and, prized most of all, leeks.

462.name: Paulie Dahlberg
462.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
462.ability:
Deploy: Move a unit to the other row.
Order: Give an allied unit 2 Armor.
462.abilityHTML: Deploy: Move a unit to the other row. Order: Give an allied unit 2 Armor.
462.flavor: Move yer arses! It's a ploughin' trap!

463.name: Black Blood
463.ability: The next time an enemy receives a boost, destroy that unit and self.
463.abilityHTML: The next time an enemy receives a boost, destroy that unit and self.
463.flavor: Vampires all agree: use of this potion is bad sportsmanship.

464.name: Ozzrel
464.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Consume: Destroy a unit and boost self by its power. If target is in the graveyard, Banish it instead. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
464.ability:
Deploy (Melee): Consume a unit from your opponent's graveyard.
Deploy (Ranged): Consume a unit from your graveyard.
464.abilityHTML: Deploy (Melee): Consume a unit from your opponent's graveyard. Deploy (Ranged): Consume a unit from your graveyard.
464.flavor: Some necrophages have taken such a liking to human flesh, they no longer are content to merely dig up corpses...

465.name: Bridge Troll
465.keywordsHTML: Deathwish: Trigger this ability when destroyed and moved from the battlefield to the graveyard. Note: Banished units are not sent to the graveyard.
465.ability: Deathwish: Boost the highest allied unit by 4.
465.abilityHTML: Deathwish: Boost the highest allied unit by 4.
465.flavor: This here bridge? Trolls built it a long time ago. Sat under it, made folk pay 'em a hefty copper to pass. Thing is, not many folk pass this way. So they all packed up, went their way. Not the bridge, though. It stayed.

466.name: Barbegazi
466.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Consume: Destroy a unit and boost self by its power. If target is in the graveyard, Banish it instead. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges.
466.ability:
Order: Consume an allied unit.
Charge: 2.
466.abilityHTML: Order: Consume an allied unit. Charge: 2.
466.flavor: What moments before looked like round rocks among the stalagmites now stared at him with enormous, bright, menacing eyes.

467.name: Scout
467.keywordsHTML: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses.
467.flavor: If our scouts don't come back, we turn around. The yokels claim these woods are full o' squirrels - and I don't mean the nut-gatherin' kind.

468.name: Equalize
468.ability: Damage all units with odd power by 2.
468.abilityHTML: Damage all units with odd power by 2.
468.flavor: What's written on this blade? That a curse? No. An insult.

469.name: Disrupt
469.ability: Damage all units with even power by 2.
469.abilityHTML: Damage all units with even power by 2.
469.flavor: What's written on this blade? That a curse? No. An insult.

470.name: Shupe: Mage
470.ability: Send Shupe to the Ban Ard Academy for Boys.
470.abilityHTML: Send Shupe to the Ban Ard Academy for Boys.
470.flavor: Other trolls always considered him a bit odd - after all, who in their right mind would prefer colorful scraps of paper to rocks?

471.name: Shupe: Mage
471.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
471.ability: Deploy: Transform the rightmost card in each player's hand into a random special card.
471.abilityHTML: Deploy: Transform the rightmost card in each player's hand into a random special card.
471.flavor: Other trolls always considered him a bit odd - after all, who in their right mind would prefer colorful scraps of paper to rocks?

472.name: Shupe: Mage
472.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
472.ability: Deploy: Move a random unit to the opposite row.
472.abilityHTML: Deploy: Move a random unit to the opposite row.
472.flavor: Other trolls always considered him a bit odd - after all, who in their right mind would prefer colorful scraps of paper to rocks?

473.name: Shupe: Mage
473.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
473.ability: Deploy: Spawn random row effects on all rows for 3 turns.
473.abilityHTML: Deploy: Spawn random row effects on all rows for 3 turns.
473.flavor: Other trolls always considered him a bit odd - after all, who in their right mind would prefer colorful scraps of paper to rocks?

474.name: Shupe: Mage
474.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
474.ability: Deploy: Split 13 damage randomly between all other units on the battlefield.
474.abilityHTML: Deploy: Split 13 damage randomly between all other units on the battlefield.
474.flavor: Other trolls always considered him a bit odd - after all, who in their right mind would prefer colorful scraps of paper to rocks?

475.name: Shupe: Mage
475.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).
475.ability: Deploy: Spawn and Summon a random unit to a random row on each side.
475.abilityHTML: Deploy: Spawn and Summon a random unit to a random row on each side.
475.flavor: Other trolls always considered him a bit odd - after all, who in their right mind would prefer colorful scraps of paper to rocks?

476.name: Shupe: Hunter
476.ability: Send Shupe to the forests of Dol Blathanna.
476.abilityHTML: Send Shupe to the forests of Dol Blathanna.
476.flavor: Other trolls always considered him a bit odd - after all, who in their right mind would prefer colorful scraps of paper to rocks?

477.name: Shupe: Hunter
477.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
477.ability: Deploy: Play a random card from your deck.
477.abilityHTML: Deploy: Play a random card from your deck.
477.flavor: Other trolls always considered him a bit odd - after all, who in their right mind would prefer colorful scraps of paper to rocks?

478.name: Shupe: Hunter
478.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
478.ability: Deploy: Damage 3 random enemy units by 3.
478.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage 3 random enemy units by 3.
478.flavor: Other trolls always considered him a bit odd - after all, who in their right mind would prefer colorful scraps of paper to rocks?

479.name: Shupe: Hunter
479.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
479.abilityHTML: Deploy: Destroy an enemy artifact.
479.flavor: Other trolls always considered him a bit odd - after all, who in their right mind would prefer colorful scraps of paper to rocks?

480.name: Shupe: Hunter
480.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
480.abilityHTML: Deploy: Destroy a random enemy.
480.flavor: Other trolls always considered him a bit odd - after all, who in their right mind would prefer colorful scraps of paper to rocks?

481.name: Shupe: Hunter
481.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
481.ability: Deploy: Spawn a random row effect on an enemy row for 3 turns.
481.abilityHTML: Deploy: Spawn a random row effect on an enemy row for 3 turns.
481.flavor: Other trolls always considered him a bit odd - after all, who in their right mind would prefer colorful scraps of paper to rocks?

482.name: Shupe: Knight
482.ability: Send Shupe to the Imperial Court Military Academy.
482.abilityHTML: Send Shupe to the Imperial Court Military Academy.
482.flavor: Other trolls always considered him a bit odd - after all, who in their right mind would prefer colorful scraps of paper to rocks?

483.name: Shupe: Knight
483.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
483.ability: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 4.
483.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 4.
483.flavor: Other trolls always considered him a bit odd - after all, who in their right mind would prefer colorful scraps of paper to rocks?

484.name: Shupe: Knight
484.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Lock: Status that disables a unit's abilities.
484.abilityHTML: Deploy: Lock a unit.
484.flavor: Other trolls always considered him a bit odd - after all, who in their right mind would prefer colorful scraps of paper to rocks?

485.name: Shupe: Knight
485.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
485.ability: Deploy: Boost a random unit in your hand by 2.
485.abilityHTML: Deploy: Boost a random unit in your hand by 2.
485.flavor: Other trolls always considered him a bit odd - after all, who in their right mind would prefer colorful scraps of paper to rocks?

486.name: Shupe: Knight
486.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Resilience: Status that allows a unit to remain on the battlefield at the end of the round, then disappears.\nNote: Boost and Armor are not carried over to the next round.
486.flavor: Other trolls always considered him a bit odd - after all, who in their right mind would prefer colorful scraps of paper to rocks?

487.name: Shupe: Knight
487.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
487.ability: Deploy: Boost an allied unit by 4.
487.abilityHTML: Deploy: Boost an allied unit by 4.
487.flavor: Other trolls always considered him a bit odd - after all, who in their right mind would prefer colorful scraps of paper to rocks?

488.name: Arachas Swarm
488.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges.
488.ability:
Order: Spawn a Drone on an allied row. Charge: 5. 
Whenever you play an Organic card, Spawn Drone on a random allied row.

This ability adds 15 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
488.abilityHTML: Order: Spawn a Drone on an allied row. Charge: 5. Whenever you play an Organic card, Spawn Drone on a random allied row. This ability adds 15 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.

489.name: Spores
489.ability: Reset the power of a unit.
489.abilityHTML: Reset the power of a unit.
489.flavor: Carried by the wind across the Continent... Sowing madness and blight where they fall.

490.name: Foltest's Pride
490.keywordsHTML: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused. Crew: Trigger this ability if this unit is between two Soldiers.
490.ability:
Zeal.
Order: Damage an enemy unit by 2 and units adjacent to it by 1.
Cooldown: 4.
Crew: Set Cooldown to 2.
490.abilityHTML: Zeal. Order: Damage an enemy unit by 2 and units adjacent to it by 1. Cooldown: 4. Crew: Set Cooldown to 2.
490.flavor: As King Foltest likes to say, it's not size that counts, but whether it gets the job done.

491.name: Golden Froth
491.flavor: Smell that? That's the smell of happiness.

492.name: Peasant Militia
492.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
492.ability: Deploy: Boost an allied unit by 2.
492.abilityHTML: Deploy: Boost an allied unit by 2.
492.flavor: We's the militia. We keep the peace.

493.name: Geralt: Professional
493.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
493.ability: Deploy (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 3. If its power was a multiple of 3, destroy it instead.
493.abilityHTML: Deploy (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 3. If its power was a multiple of 3, destroy it instead.
493.flavor: I accepted a job once, did it. Asked to choose my reward, I invoked the Law of Surprise.

494.name: Triss: Telekinesis
494.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Create: Spawn one of three randomly selected cards from the specified source.
494.ability: Deploy (Ranged): Create and play a bronze special card from either player's starting deck.
494.abilityHTML: Deploy (Ranged): Create and play a bronze special card from either player's starting deck.
494.flavor: Bindings won't suffice. Nor will a gag render her any less dangerous. No, dimeritium is the only solution.

495.name: Dandelion: Vainglory
495.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
495.abilityHTML: Deploy: Destroy an enemy Beast.
495.flavor: Dandelion told me all about your adventures. How he'd ready you for battle with his songs, how he tamed the kayran by playin' his lute...

496.name: Dandelion: Poet
496.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
496.ability: Deploy: Draw a card, then play a card.
496.abilityHTML: Deploy: Draw a card, then play a card.
496.flavor: The quill is mightier than the sword.

497.name: Roche: Merciless
497.keyword: deploy, deathblow, zeal, order, spawn, summon
497.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).
497.ability:
Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2.
Deathblow: Gain Zeal.
Order: Spawn a Blue Stripes Commando and Summon it to this row.
497.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2. Deathblow: Gain Zeal. Order: Spawn a Blue Stripes Commando and Summon it to this row.
497.flavor: Fear does not befit us. Yet, there is a certain d'hoine... Vernon Roche. Be wary of him.

498.name: Call of the Forest
498.ability: Play a Scoia'tael unit from your deck and boost it by 1.
498.abilityHTML: Play a Scoia'tael unit from your deck and boost it by 1.
498.flavor: I hold Brokilon dearer than my own life. She is a mother who cares for her children. I will defend her to my final breath.

499.name: Yennefer: Divination
499.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Reveal: Show a card to both players, then hide it back in the hand or deck.
499.ability: Deploy (Ranged): Reveal a random unit from your deck, then boost an allied unit by its power.
499.abilityHTML: Deploy (Ranged): Reveal a random unit from your deck, then boost an allied unit by its power.
499.flavor: Yes, I have seen the future. And you're not in it.

500.name: Imlerith
500.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Discard: Move a card from your hand to the graveyard. Note: Related abilities are not triggered when discarding manually.
500.ability: Deploy (Melee): Draw a card, then Discard a card. If the Discarded card was a unit, boost self by its power.
500.abilityHTML: Deploy (Melee): Draw a card, then Discard a card. If the Discarded card was a unit, boost self by its power.
500.flavor: The sisters said you would come. They saw you arrive in the water's surface.

501.name: Ihuarraquax
501.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played). Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
501.ability:
Deploy (Melee): Each player Summons the highest-provision unit from their deck to their Melee row.
Deploy (Ranged): Each player Summons the lowest-provision unit from their deck to their Ranged row.
501.abilityHTML: Deploy (Melee): Each player Summons the highest-provision unit from their deck to their Melee row. Deploy (Ranged): Each player Summons the lowest-provision unit from their deck to their Ranged row.
501.flavor: Inconceivable. Impossible, Ciri thought, returning to her senses. Unicorns don't exist, not any more, not in this world. Unicorns are extinct.

502.name: Gimpy Gerwin
502.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
502.ability: Deploy (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 3 and all copies of it by 1.
502.abilityHTML: Deploy (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 3 and all copies of it by 1.
502.flavor: Keep the vermin on a short leash. And don't be afraid to use that whip!

503.name: Elf and Onion Soup
503.keywordsHTML: Create: Spawn one of three randomly selected cards from the specified source.
503.ability: Destroy 2 allied units of the same border color, then Create and play a unit of the same color from your faction or neutrals.
503.abilityHTML: Destroy 2 allied units of the same border color, then Create and play a unit of the same color from your faction or neutrals.
503.flavor: Garnish each serving with grated cheese. Add eyeballs to taste. Serve hot.

504.name: Ivo of Belhaven
504.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
504.ability:
Order (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 2.
Cooldown: 2.
Whenever you play a Witcher, decrease Cooldown by 1.
504.abilityHTML: Order (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 2. Cooldown: 2. Whenever you play a Witcher, decrease Cooldown by 1.
504.flavor: It's not reason I'm devoid of, just emotion.

505.name: Eyck of Denesle
505.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
505.ability:
Deploy: If you have a Dragon in your hand, gain Zeal.
Order: Destroy an enemy unit with 9 or more power.
505.abilityHTML: Deploy: If you have a Dragon in your hand, gain Zeal. Order: Destroy an enemy unit with 9 or more power.
505.flavor: The Good Book says the world is a garden which the gods once conferred upon man. And we men have this garden neglected!

506.name: Gascon
506.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
506.ability: Deploy (Melee): Boost self by a random amount between 0 and 11.
506.abilityHTML: Deploy (Melee): Boost self by a random amount between 0 and 11.
506.flavor: Th' Strays of Spalla – 'tis you who lead them? 'Tis you they call the Duke of Dogs?

507.name: Prince Villem
507.keywordsHTML: Disloyal: This card is played on the opposite side of the battlefield, then gains Spying. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
507.ability:
Disloyal.
Deploy: Play a random gold card from your deck.
507.abilityHTML: Disloyal. Deploy: Play a random gold card from your deck.
507.flavor: The boy's not fit to wear the crown. Hasn't sufficient wit nor valor. I know this, you know this… just, he knows it not.

508.name: Count Caldwell
508.keywordsHTML: Spying: Status with no additional effect. Can be used by other cards and abilities.
508.ability: At the end of your turn, move this unit to the row with the highest power unit on the battlefield, excluding self. If it changed sides, gain Spying. If it already had Spying, remove Spying instead.
508.abilityHTML: At the end of your turn, move this unit to the row with the highest power unit on the battlefield, excluding self. If it changed sides, gain Spying. If it already had Spying, remove Spying instead.
508.flavor: Your Majesty… For the queen to question commoners, why, it's simply not proper…

509.name: Xavier Lemmens
509.keyword: zeal, order, melee, banish, ranged, cooldown
509.keywordsHTML: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Banish: Remove from the game. Note: Does not count as being destroyed. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
509.ability:
Zeal.
Order (Melee): Banish a card from opponent's graveyard.
Order (Ranged): Banish a card from your graveyard.
Cooldown: 1
509.abilityHTML: Zeal. Order (Melee): Banish a card from opponent's graveyard. Order (Ranged): Banish a card from your graveyard. Cooldown: 1
509.flavor: Your engineer's got a pate like stewed meat, but he kens his trade, that's for certain.

510.name: Keltullis
510.keywordsHTML: Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
510.ability: Melee: Every allied turn, on turn end, destroy the lowest unit on the side with the most units.
510.abilityHTML: Melee: Every allied turn, on turn end, destroy the lowest unit on the side with the most units.
510.flavor: When she took roost here, they fought 'er for near a century. Then the dragon got weary o' fightin' and they realized she weren't goin' nowheres, so… they cut a deal. She dinnae bother 'em, they give 'er what she needs.

511.name: Frightener: Awakened
511.keywordsHTML: Immunity: Status whereby this card cannot be manually targeted.
511.flavor: ”What have I done?” the mage cried out, frightened of his own creation.

512.name: Glustyworp
512.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
512.ability: Deploy: Destroy all units with 1 power. For each unit destroyed, boost self by 2.
512.abilityHTML: Deploy: Destroy all units with 1 power. For each unit destroyed, boost self by 2.
512.flavor: The swamp underfoot suddenly exploded with a powerful splash. Two long, mantis-like forelimbs bristling with spikes shot out from the murk. The monstrous, green hooks seized an unlucky footman, dragging him beneath the water's surface.

513.name: Gabor Zigrin
513.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Resilience: Status that allows a unit to remain on the battlefield at the end of the round, then disappears.\nNote: Boost and Armor are not carried over to the next round. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Immunity: Status whereby this card cannot be manually targeted.
513.ability:
Deploy (Melee): Gain Resilience.
Deploy (Ranged): Gain Immunity.
Whenever you play a Dwarf, boost self by 1.
513.abilityHTML: Deploy (Melee): Gain Resilience. Deploy (Ranged): Gain Immunity. Whenever you play a Dwarf, boost self by 1.
513.flavor: Brouver Hoog wanted to kick him out of Mahakam once for having a llama in his living room… it's a long story.

514.name: Barnabas Beckenbauer
514.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
514.ability: Deploy: Boost an allied Elf, Dwarf, and Dryad unit by 3.
514.abilityHTML: Deploy: Boost an allied Elf, Dwarf, and Dryad unit by 3.
514.flavor: Arrived here with his peddler's wagon full o' tricks an' gadgets. Went from house tae house, praised his rubbish tae the high heavens. An' what's it he sold us? Bombs that go off in yer hand! Beard-growth formula that makes yer hair catch fire!

515.name: Isbel of Hagge
515.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
515.ability: Order: (Ranged): If your opponent's hand is not full, look at the top card from both decks. Keep one and give the other to your opponent.
515.abilityHTML: Order: (Ranged): If your opponent's hand is not full, look at the top card from both decks. Keep one and give the other to your opponent.
515.flavor: I promised I would never again use magic to harm others.

516.name: Lippy Gudmund
516.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
516.ability: Deploy (Ranged): Swap your graveyard with your deck.
516.abilityHTML: Deploy (Ranged): Swap your graveyard with your deck.
516.flavor: The coast's picked clean since long! So we set our longships up the Yaruga – for gold and glory!

517.name: Dagur Two Blades
517.keywordsHTML: Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
517.ability: Melee: Whenever an enemy takes damage, boost self by 1.
517.abilityHTML: Melee: Whenever an enemy takes damage, boost self by 1.

518.name: Traheaern var Vdyffir
518.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
518.ability: Deploy: Look at the top 3 cards in your opponent's deck and move 1 to their graveyard.
518.abilityHTML: Deploy: Look at the top 3 cards in your opponent's deck and move 1 to their graveyard.
518.flavor: The Nilfgaardians proceeded in the queen's very direction without a sign of panic. The man leading the Nilfgaardians was clad in rich robes. He exuded pride... and the scent of musk.

519.name: Reynard Odo
519.keywordsHTML: Formation: If played on the melee row, gain Zeal. If played on the ranged row, boost self by 1. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
519.ability:
Formation.
Order: Boost adjacent units by 1.
Whenever you play a unit boost it by 1.
519.abilityHTML: Formation. Order: Boost adjacent units by 1. Whenever you play a unit boost it by 1.
519.flavor: Under your husband I served ten years, under you another eight. And never in that time did I fight for a more worthy cause.

520.name: Black Rayla
520.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Inspired: Trigger this ability if this unit's current power is higher than its base power. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
520.ability:
Order (Melee): Damage a unit by 1.
Inspired: Damage a unit by 2 instead.
Cooldown: 1.
520.abilityHTML: Order (Melee): Damage a unit by 1. Inspired: Damage a unit by 2 instead. Cooldown: 1.
520.flavor: Exceptions are a clear road to human blood spilt. All Scoia'tael must die. Leave the gods to sort the wheat from the chaff.

521.name: Phoenix Hatchling
521.keywordsHTML: Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
521.ability:
Doomed. Zeal.
Order: Transform into Phoenix.
521.abilityHTML: Doomed. Zeal. Order: Transform into Phoenix.
521.flavor: What came first, the chicken or the egg? Compared to the conundrum that is the phoenix, that question seems downright trivial.

522.name: Deadeye Ambush
522.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges.
522.ability:
Order: Spawn an Elven Deadeye in an allied row.
Charge: 3

This ability adds 15 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
522.abilityHTML: Order: Spawn an Elven Deadeye in an allied row. Charge: 3 This ability adds 15 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
522.flavor: The king once dispatched an envoy to Eldain… despite my advice to the contrary. Found the envoy the next day, eyes gouged out, shaft of his white flag jammed down his throat.

523.name: Royal Inspiration
523.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
523.ability:
Order: Boost an allied unit by 1. Cooldown: 2

This ability adds 16 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
523.abilityHTML: Order: Boost an allied unit by 1. Cooldown: 2 This ability adds 16 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
523.flavor: We're at war, when rulers don't strive nor choose. When rulers grasp sword and shield and ride out to defend their subjects.

524.name: Fruits of Ysgith
