524.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
524.ability:
Order: Spawn a Gernichora's Fruit on an allied row. 
At the start of your turn, reset this ability if you do not control any Fruits.

This ability adds 12 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
524.abilityHTML: Order: Spawn a Gernichora's Fruit on an allied row. At the start of your turn, reset this ability if you do not control any Fruits. This ability adds 12 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
524.flavor: Frescoes on the tomb walls depicted Angren's swamps and the beasts that prowled them. Two words were inscribed over the largest of the horrors: Gvaern Ichaer – the Bloody Mistress.

525.name: Enslave
525.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Seize: Move an enemy unit to the opposite row and give it Spying. If it already had Spying, remove Spying instead.
525.ability:
Order: Seize an enemy unit with 3 power or less. 
This value is raised by 1 for every 4 Tactic cards in your starting deck.

This ability adds 15 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
525.abilityHTML: Order: Seize an enemy unit with 3 power or less. This value is raised by 1 for every 4 Tactic cards in your starting deck. This ability adds 15 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
525.flavor: In my home, in the civilized world, a general commands his force. He does not rush and thrash about like some rabid hound.

526.name: Patricidal Fury
526.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
526.ability:
Order: Spawn and play Arnjolf the Patricide.

This ability adds 15 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
526.abilityHTML: Order: Spawn and play Arnjolf the Patricide. This ability adds 15 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
526.flavor: We're after killin'. Nilfgaardians, Lyrians... 's all the same to us. Strife an' blood an' guts to wash away our shame.

527.name: Strays of Spalla
527.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
527.ability: Deploy: Move a unit to the other row.
527.abilityHTML: Deploy: Move a unit to the other row.

528.name: Bomb Heaver
528.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
528.ability:
Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 1.
If you have a Bomb in your hand, damage it by 3 instead.
528.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 1. If you have a Bomb in your hand, damage it by 3 instead.
528.flavor: Knew a young couple once—got separated right after the weddin'. Bomb in the carriage'll do that.

529.name: Tactical Advantage
529.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Banish: Remove from the game. Note: Does not count as being destroyed.
529.ability: Order: Boost an allied unit by 5, then Banish self.
529.abilityHTML: Order: Boost an allied unit by 5, then Banish self.
529.flavor: Remember, cadets! He who first draws his blade has the advantage over his foe!

530.name: Stockpile
530.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges.
530.ability:
Order: Spawn a Volunteer on an allied row, then reduce the Cooldown of Northern Realms units in that row by 1.
Charge: 3

This ability adds 15 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
530.abilityHTML: Order: Spawn a Volunteer on an allied row, then reduce the Cooldown of Northern Realms units in that row by 1. Charge: 3 This ability adds 15 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
530.flavor: My king enjoys life... enjoys pleasures and indulges often. But none of this has hindered his ability to govern the realm bloody well.

531.name: Angoulême
531.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
531.ability: Deploy: Spawn and play a random artifact from your opponent's starting deck.
531.abilityHTML: Deploy: Spawn and play a random artifact from your opponent's starting deck.
531.flavor: Don't matter if it crawls, slithers, climbs—you name it, I've eaten it. As for things that fly... I once ate a kite just 'cause it had flour stuck to it.

532.name: Vysogota of Corvo
532.keywordsHTML: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges.
532.ability:
Zeal.
Order (Ranged): Boost a unit by 1. 
Charge: 1.
Gain 1 Charge whenever either player plays a card.
532.abilityHTML: Zeal. Order (Ranged): Boost a unit by 1. Charge: 1. Gain 1 Charge whenever either player plays a card.
532.flavor: It's been near half a century since I last practiced medicine. The years haven't been kind to my memory... Nor the dexterity of my fingers.

533.name: Falibor
533.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit.
533.ability:
Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 3.
Deathblow: Repeat the Deploy ability and decrease the damage by 1.
533.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 3. Deathblow: Repeat the Deploy ability and decrease the damage by 1.
533.flavor: From afar, he looks like a bear. From up close, well... A larger bear.

534.name: Anna Strenger
534.keywordsHTML: Inspired: Trigger this ability if this unit's current power is higher than its base power.
534.ability:
Every allied turn, on turn end, boost the unit to the right by 1.
Inspired: Boost adjacent units by 1 instead.
534.abilityHTML: Every allied turn, on turn end, boost the unit to the right by 1. Inspired: Boost adjacent units by 1 instead.
534.flavor: Anna hated her husband so much that she was ready to do anything in order to be free of the man — and the child he had put inside her.

535.name: Lyrian Cavalry
535.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
535.ability: Whenever you play a unit with Orders, boost self by 1.
535.abilityHTML: Whenever you play a unit with Orders, boost self by 1.
535.flavor: A horseman's worth no less than his steed. And Lyrian horses are among the Continent's best.

536.name: Rivian Pikeman
536.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Resupply: Trigger this ability whenever you play a Warfare card.
536.ability:
Order: Damage an enemy unit by 2.
Resupply: Boost self by 1.
536.abilityHTML: Order: Damage an enemy unit by 2. Resupply: Boost self by 1.
536.flavor: Get off your high horse and face me!

537.name: Lyrian Arbalest
537.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges.
537.ability:
Order: Damage a unit by 1. 
Charge: 1.
Gain 1 Charge whenever you play a card with Orders.
537.abilityHTML: Order: Damage a unit by 1. Charge: 1. Gain 1 Charge whenever you play a card with Orders.
537.flavor: I can find the bull's-eye from a hundred paces! Perhaps not with my first shot, mind you...

538.name: Lyrian Landsknecht
538.keywordsHTML: Formation: If played on the melee row, gain Zeal. If played on the ranged row, boost self by 1. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Inspired: Trigger this ability if this unit's current power is higher than its base power.
538.ability:
Formation.
Order: Damage a unit by 1.
Inspired: Damage it by 3 instead.
538.abilityHTML: Formation. Order: Damage a unit by 1. Inspired: Damage it by 3 instead.
538.flavor: Best not laugh at their silly-arse hats. Believe me.

539.name: Lyrian Scytheman
539.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
539.ability: Deploy: Boost self by 1 for each boosted unit on this row.
539.abilityHTML: Deploy: Boost self by 1 for each boosted unit on this row.
539.flavor: Our folk they feed, and our foes they bleed.

540.name: Deafening Siren
540.keywordsHTML: Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield.
540.flavor: Easy, mates! Sirens never attack when... Huh? What d'yous mean Right above me?

541.name: Arnjolf the Patricide
541.keywordsHTML: Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
541.ability:
Doomed.
Spawn 3 Deafening Sirens on the opposite row and damage them by 1.
541.abilityHTML: Doomed. Spawn 3 Deafening Sirens on the opposite row and damage them by 1.
541.flavor: Only death can cleanse me o' shame.

542.name: Gernichora's Fruit
542.keywordsHTML: Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield. Thrive: Boost this unit by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a unit with higher power.
542.flavor: Gernichora's a little like a vampire, they're kindred creatures. 'Cept instead of feasting on the blood of others, she feeds them her own.

543.name: Elven Deadeye
543.keywordsHTML: Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield.
543.flavor: One, two, come into view; Three, four, hide 'hind the door; Five, six, this'll be quick; Seven, eight, come meet your fate!

544.name: Blood Scent
544.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
544.ability:
Order: Give an enemy unit Bleeding for 3 turns. Charge: 3
Once all Charges are used up, Spawn an Ekimmara into a random allied row.

This ability adds 15 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
544.abilityHTML: Order: Give an enemy unit Bleeding for 3 turns. Charge: 3 Once all Charges are used up, Spawn an Ekimmara into a random allied row. This ability adds 15 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
544.flavor: He did not love like a man, but like an animal. Madly, deeply, unconditionally. Wildly.

545.name: Double Cross
545.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Create: Spawn one of three randomly selected cards from the specified source.
545.ability:
Order: Create and play a card from your opponent's hand.

This ability adds 16 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
545.abilityHTML: Order: Create and play a card from your opponent's hand. This ability adds 16 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
545.flavor: As head of state, I must judge her fairly. But she is my sister, thus my heart bleeds for her…

546.name: Pincer Maneuver
546.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges.
546.ability:
Order: Draw a Northern Realms card of your choice, then shuffle a card from your hand back into the deck and Spawn a Volunteer in your Melee row.
Charges: 2

This ability adds 15 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
546.abilityHTML: Order: Draw a Northern Realms card of your choice, then shuffle a card from your hand back into the deck and Spawn a Volunteer in your Melee row. Charges: 2 This ability adds 15 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
546.flavor: They call her the Lioness of Cintra. And not without good reason.

547.name: Call of Harmony
547.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
547.ability:
Order: Spawn and play Dana Meadbh.

This ability adds 16 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
547.abilityHTML: Order: Spawn and play Dana Meadbh. This ability adds 16 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
547.flavor: She revealeth herself as the Fairhaired Ladie, in flowers all, and all that liveth followeth her path and clingeth to her, as one, plant or beast.

548.name: Ursine Ritual
548.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
548.ability:
Order: Damage an allied unit by 1. Charge: 5
Once all Charges are used up, Spawn a Bear Abomination on a random allied row.

This ability adds 16 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
548.abilityHTML: Order: Damage an allied unit by 1. Charge: 5 Once all Charges are used up, Spawn a Bear Abomination on a random allied row. This ability adds 16 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
548.flavor: He proclaimed to his worshippers but one commandment: Kill.

549.name: Crimson Curse
549.keywordsHTML: Spawn: Add a card to the game. Blood Moon: At the start of the owner's turn, give a random unit in this row Bleeding (2). If the unit is already Bleeding, damage it by 2 instead.
549.ability: Spawn Blood Moon on an enemy row for 5 turns, then Spawn 2 Ekimmaras in the opposite row.
549.abilityHTML: Spawn Blood Moon on an enemy row for 5 turns, then Spawn 2 Ekimmaras in the opposite row.
549.flavor: When the moon burns red, latch the door and put your lambs to bed...

550.name: Tesham Mutna Sword
550.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit.
550.ability: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 5. If it has a Shield, destroy it instead.
550.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 5. If it has a Shield, destroy it instead.
550.flavor: Millenia have passed, but its thirst for blood has not.

551.name: Hen Gaidth Sword
551.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
551.ability:
Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2.
Deathblow: Spawn and play a base copy of it.
551.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2. Deathblow: Spawn and play a base copy of it.
551.flavor: Legend tells that wounds carved from this blade never heal. Blood shall flow until not a drop remains...

552.name: Land of a Thousand Fables
552.keywordsHTML: Resilience: Status that allows a unit to remain on the battlefield at the end of the round, then disappears.\nNote: Boost and Armor are not carried over to the next round. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
552.ability:
Resilience.
Deploy: Play a special card from your deck.
Order: Transform a special card in your hand into a random unit of the same provision cost from the same faction.
552.abilityHTML: Resilience. Deploy: Play a special card from your deck. Order: Transform a special card in your hand into a random unit of the same provision cost from the same faction.
552.flavor: The girls told me if I ever wished to visit alone, I need but crack open The Land of a Thousand Fables and utter out loud the incantation Expecto ludum!

553.name: Syanna
553.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
553.ability: Order: Repeat the Deploy ability of the next unit you play during this turn.
553.abilityHTML: Order: Repeat the Deploy ability of the next unit you play during this turn.
553.flavor: Your Majesty... The princess has been touched by the curse o' the Black Sun. There's no hope, I'm afraid...

554.name: Regis: Bloodlust
554.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit. Banish: Remove from the game. Note: Does not count as being destroyed.
554.ability:
Deploy (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 4.
Deathblow: Banish it.
554.abilityHTML: Deploy (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 4. Deathblow: Banish it.
554.flavor: I've been called a monster, a bloodthirsty freak. Among other, shall we say, more colorful names.

555.name: Lady of the Lake
555.keywordsHTML: Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
555.ability:
Shield.
Order: Give an allied unit a Shield.
555.abilityHTML: Shield. Order: Give an allied unit a Shield.
555.flavor: Take this sword as a sign of my favor. For centuries it lay in these depths, waiting... for you.

556.name: Fisher King
556.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
556.ability: Deploy (Ranged): Move any card from your deck to the top.
556.abilityHTML: Deploy (Ranged): Move any card from your deck to the top.

557.name: Vivienne: Oriole
557.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
557.ability: Deploy: Boost self by the provision cost of the card on the right.
557.abilityHTML: Deploy: Boost self by the provision cost of the card on the right.
557.flavor: Who'd not like to live free as a bird? Well, just ask Vivienne de Tabris.

558.name: Gregoire de Gorgon
558.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit. Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit.
558.ability:
Deploy (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 1.
Deathblow: Boost self by 5 and gain a Shield.
558.abilityHTML: Deploy (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 1. Deathblow: Boost self by 5 and gain a Shield.
558.flavor: Gregoire? That mountain o' muscle wrapped in armor? Course, I 'eard of 'im! Who hasn't?

559.name: Musicians of Blaviken
559.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit. Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield. Resilience: Status that allows a unit to remain on the battlefield at the end of the round, then disappears.\nNote: Boost and Armor are not carried over to the next round. Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it.
559.ability: Deploy: Gain randomly Shield, Doomed, Resilience or Poison.
559.abilityHTML: Deploy: Gain randomly Shield, Doomed, Resilience or Poison.

560.name: Portal
560.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).
560.ability:
Deploy: Summon a random 4 provision unit from your deck to the left of this card.
After 3 turns, Summon a random 4 provision unit from your deck to the right of this card.
560.abilityHTML: Deploy: Summon a random 4 provision unit from your deck to the left of this card. After 3 turns, Summon a random 4 provision unit from your deck to the right of this card.
560.flavor: Some value them highly. Others hate them.

561.name: Sangreal
561.keywordsHTML: Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit.
561.ability: Boost a unit by 6 and give it a Shield.
561.abilityHTML: Boost a unit by 6 and give it a Shield.
561.flavor: It is the duchess's exclusive privilege to delight in the prized, oaky flavor of Sangreal... A pleasure she partakes in very, very often.

562.name: Tempest
562.ability: Purify 3 adjacent enemy units and damage them by 2.
562.abilityHTML: Purify 3 adjacent enemy units and damage them by 2.
562.flavor: A Category 10 on the Bekker scale.

563.name: Curse of Corruption
563.flavor: Black magic – the grislier the better.

564.name: Sandstorm
564.ability: Damage units at both ends of an enemy row by 3.
564.abilityHTML: Damage units at both ends of an enemy row by 3.
564.flavor: Best case – sand in your teeth. Worst case – buried alive.

565.name: Dancing Star
565.keywordsHTML: Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit.
565.ability:
Damage an enemy unit by 3.
Deathblow: Damage the unit to the right by 1 less.
565.abilityHTML: Damage an enemy unit by 3. Deathblow: Damage the unit to the right by 1 less.
565.flavor: A spectacular sight – until it explodes in your face.

566.name: Devil's Puffball
566.keywordsHTML: Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit. Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it.
566.ability:
Damage an enemy unit by 3.
Deathblow: Poison adjacent enemy units.
566.abilityHTML: Damage an enemy unit by 3. Deathblow: Poison adjacent enemy units.
566.flavor: As lethal as it is foul.

567.name: Northern Wind
567.keywordsHTML: Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit. Banish: Remove from the game. Note: Does not count as being destroyed.
567.ability:
Damage a unit by 4.
Deathblow: Banish it.
567.abilityHTML: Damage a unit by 4. Deathblow: Banish it.
567.flavor: That ought to cool your temper.

568.name: Moon Dust
568.ability: Purify a unit and damage it by 4.
568.abilityHTML: Purify a unit and damage it by 4.
568.flavor: The werewolf lifted and tilted his head, mystified by the silvery dust... Then howled in utter agony.

569.name: Samum
569.keywordsHTML: Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit.
569.ability:
Damage a unit by 3.
Deathblow: Move adjacent units to the other row.
569.abilityHTML: Damage a unit by 3. Deathblow: Move adjacent units to the other row.
569.flavor: Zerrikanian alchemists have learned to harness the energy of hot desert storms and bind it into an arcane mixture.

570.name: Red Haze
570.ability: Choose an enemy unit, then damage one adjacent enemy unit by its power.
570.abilityHTML: Choose an enemy unit, then damage one adjacent enemy unit by its power.
570.flavor: Perhaps the most insidious invention of Zerrikanian alchemists. And there's no shortage to choose from.

571.name: Inspirational Ballad
571.keywordsHTML: Vitality: Status that boosts this unit by 1 on its turn end. Note: Vitality turns can accumulate; 1 turn of Vitality cancels out 1 turn of Bleeding.
571.ability: Give Vitality to an allied unit for 6 turns.
571.abilityHTML: Give Vitality to an allied unit for 6 turns.
571.flavor: War's not so horrific when you put a catchy tune to it.

572.name: Thaw
572.keywordsHTML: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses.
572.ability: Boost an allied unit by 4 and give it Veil.
572.abilityHTML: Boost an allied unit by 4 and give it Veil.
572.flavor: It heralds the coming of spring... Which, in turn, heralds the coming of war.

573.name: Traveling Merchant
573.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
573.ability: Deploy (Ranged): Shuffle a card from your hand into your deck, then draw a card.
573.abilityHTML: Deploy (Ranged): Shuffle a card from your hand into your deck, then draw a card.
573.flavor: Florens, orens, crowns – I accept them all!

574.name: Pellar
574.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Purify: Remove all statuses.
574.abilityHTML: Deploy: Purify a unit.
574.flavor:
Gather spirits for this wake,
A passing soul ne'er forsake,
Hear my call, my humble plea,
Unbind his chains, set him free.

575.name: Cutthroat
575.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor.
575.ability: Deploy: Give an enemy unit Bleeding for 2 turns.
575.abilityHTML: Deploy: Give an enemy unit Bleeding for 2 turns.
575.flavor: Ahhh, nothin' so soothin' as the sound o' gurglin' blood.

576.name: Oxenfurt Scholar
576.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Vitality: Status that boosts this unit by 1 on its turn end. Note: Vitality turns can accumulate; 1 turn of Vitality cancels out 1 turn of Bleeding.
576.ability: Deploy: Give an allied unit Vitality for 2 turns.
576.abilityHTML: Deploy: Give an allied unit Vitality for 2 turns.
576.flavor: Balderdash! Your blatant obfuscation of teleological and ontological axioms is an embarrassment to the field! Ostentatious verbiage for its own sake!

577.name: Spring Equinox
577.ability: Purify all units on a row.
577.abilityHTML: Purify all units on a row.
577.flavor: The days grow longer and the dresses of maidens grow shorter.

578.name: Scepter of Storms
578.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
578.ability: Deploy: Spawn and play Biting Frost, Impenetrable Fog, or Torrential Rain.
578.abilityHTML: Deploy: Spawn and play Biting Frost, Impenetrable Fog, or Torrential Rain.
578.flavor: Some call it the Stick of Truth.

579.name: Queen of the Night
579.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Purify: Remove all statuses.
579.ability:
Deploy (Melee): Give Bleeding (3) to an enemy.
Deploy (Ranged): Purify a unit.
579.abilityHTML: Deploy (Melee): Give Bleeding (3) to an enemy. Deploy (Ranged): Purify a unit.
579.flavor: Those seduced by her charms find themselves willing to pay any price.

580.name: Orianna
580.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
580.ability:
Deploy: Give an enemy unit Bleeding with a duration equal to the number of allied Vampires.
Ranged: Every allied turn, on turn end, boost self by the number of Bleeding enemy units.
580.abilityHTML: Deploy: Give an enemy unit Bleeding with a duration equal to the number of allied Vampires. Ranged: Every allied turn, on turn end, boost self by the number of Bleeding enemy units.
580.flavor: Lady Orianna's been a blessin' for us... She 'elps the beggarly, supports the arts – why, she even runs a home for them poor orphans!

581.name: Protofleder
581.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor.
581.ability: Deploy: Give an enemy unit Bleeding (3), then boost self by the amount of Bleeding on that unit.
581.abilityHTML: Deploy: Give an enemy unit Bleeding (3), then boost self by the amount of Bleeding on that unit.
581.flavor: Limited to only one region of the Continent, scholars consider them critically endangered. Gods be praised...

582.name: Garkain
582.keywordsHTML: Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor.
582.ability: At the end of every allied turn, boost self by 1 if there is a Bleeding enemy.
582.abilityHTML: At the end of every allied turn, boost self by 1 if there is a Bleeding enemy.
582.flavor: Blood on the ceiling, entrails on the wall... Got garkain written all over it.

583.name: Gael
583.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor. Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit.
583.ability:
Deploy (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 1. If it's Bleeding deal 3 damage instead.
Deathblow: Boost self by the destroyed unit's base power.
583.abilityHTML: Deploy (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 1. If it's Bleeding deal 3 damage instead. Deathblow: Boost self by the destroyed unit's base power.
583.flavor: A fondness for shiny trinkets is not a trait unique to magpies.

584.name: Undying Thirst
584.keywordsHTML: Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor.
584.ability: Give an enemy unit Bleeding for 6 turns.
584.abilityHTML: Give an enemy unit Bleeding for 6 turns.
584.flavor: Some appetites can never be sated.

585.name: Feast of Blood
585.keywordsHTML: Purify: Remove all statuses. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor.
585.ability:
Purify and damage an enemy unit by 3.
If you control a Vampire, also give it Bleeding for 3 turns.
585.abilityHTML: Purify and damage an enemy unit by 3. If you control a Vampire, also give it Bleeding for 3 turns.
585.flavor: Vampires have been known to fast for years at a time. Yet once the hunt resumes, they feed and feed until frenzied and drunk on blood.

586.name: Fleder
586.keywordsHTML: Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor. Vitality: Status that boosts this unit by 1 on its turn end. Note: Vitality turns can accumulate; 1 turn of Vitality cancels out 1 turn of Bleeding.
586.ability: Whenever an enemy unit receives Bleeding, gain Vitality with the same duration.
586.abilityHTML: Whenever an enemy unit receives Bleeding, gain Vitality with the same duration.
586.flavor: The children o' the night come as punishment from the gods! We's tolerated wizard-folk and non-human filth in our midst too long! Repent! 'Fore yer soul rots, repent!

587.name: Alp
587.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
587.ability:
Deploy: Give an enemy unit Bleeding (3).
Order: Give an enemy unit Bleeding (3).
587.abilityHTML: Deploy: Give an enemy unit Bleeding (3). Order: Give an enemy unit Bleeding (3).
587.flavor: The townsfolk, long plagued with horrific nightmares, posted a desperate plea for help... Hmm. An alp, gotta be, the witcher grumbled to himself.

588.name: Plumard
588.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor. Bonded: Trigger this ability if you control a copy of this card.
588.ability:
Deploy: Give an enemy unit Bleeding for 2 turns.
Bonded: Give it Bleeding for 4 turns instead.
588.abilityHTML: Deploy: Give an enemy unit Bleeding for 2 turns. Bonded: Give it Bleeding for 4 turns instead.
588.flavor: One alone poses no great threat. But a dozen? Gods be with you.

589.name: Nekurat
589.keywordsHTML: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
589.ability:
Zeal. 
Order (Melee): Give an enemy unit Bleeding for 2 turns. Cooldown: 2.
Whenever you play a Vampire card, reduce this unit's Cooldown by 1.
589.abilityHTML: Zeal. Order (Melee): Give an enemy unit Bleeding for 2 turns. Cooldown: 2. Whenever you play a Vampire card, reduce this unit's Cooldown by 1.
589.flavor: No matter how lightly you tread, how soft your step, he will hear you. He will find you.

590.name: Bruxa
590.keywordsHTML: Thrive: Boost this unit by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a unit with higher power. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor.
590.ability:
Thrive.
Deploy: Give an enemy unit Bleeding for 2 turns.
590.abilityHTML: Thrive. Deploy: Give an enemy unit Bleeding for 2 turns.
590.flavor: The vampiress lunged in a blur, unleashing an inhuman shriek. The wall of sound slammed into the witcher like a battering ram – splintering his ribs, forcing the air from his lungs, and sending tendrils of pain down his spine.

591.name: Vivienne de Tabris
591.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
591.ability: Deploy: Set a unit's power to its Provision Cost.
591.abilityHTML: Deploy: Set a unit's power to its Provision Cost.
591.flavor: Vivienne's a bit of an odd duck for a lady-in-waitin'. But by the Gods, ye can't deny her beauty an' grace!

592.name: Damien de la Tour
592.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
592.abilityHTML: Order (Melee): Re-enable your Leader's ability.
592.flavor: I served Beauclair well. At least... I hope I did.

593.name: Palmerin de Launfal
593.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit. Spying: Status with no additional effect. Can be used by other cards and abilities.
593.ability:
Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2. 
Deathblow: Give Spying to adjacent enemy units.
If Milton is in your hand, always trigger Deathblow ability.
593.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2. Deathblow: Give Spying to adjacent enemy units. If Milton is in your hand, always trigger Deathblow ability.
593.flavor: Rumor had it the esteemed baron Palmerin de Launfal had fallen into a profane affair with a succubus. The duchess, however, gave no credence to such baseless hearsay.

594.name: Milton de Peyrac-Peyran
594.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit.
594.ability:
Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 1. 
Deathblow: Damage adjacent enemy units by 2.
If Palmerin is in your hand, always trigger Deathblow ability.
594.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 1. Deathblow: Damage adjacent enemy units by 2. If Palmerin is in your hand, always trigger Deathblow ability.
594.flavor: Glinting under the rays of the Beauclair sun, there was no mistaking this knight-errant who bore the head of a great, white bull on his shield.

595.name: Artorius Vigo
595.keywordsHTML: Assimilate: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a card that is not from your starting deck. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Create: Spawn one of three randomly selected cards from the specified source.
595.ability:
Assimilate.
Deploy: Create and play a 1-power copy of a bronze unit from your starting deck.
595.abilityHTML: Assimilate. Deploy: Create and play a 1-power copy of a bronze unit from your starting deck.
595.flavor: It is said he created an illusion so realistic that he began to believe it himself...

596.name: Roderick of Dun Tynne
596.keywordsHTML: Disloyal: This card is played on the opposite side of the battlefield, then gains Spying. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
596.ability:
Disloyal.
Deploy: Look at 2 random gold cards from your deck, then play 1 of them.
596.abilityHTML: Disloyal. Deploy: Look at 2 random gold cards from your deck, then play 1 of them.
596.flavor: Roderick lived as a recluse, avoiding society at large. Instead, he preferred the company of a small party of knights. If they can truly be called such...

597.name: Tourney Shaelmaar
597.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
597.ability:
Deploy (Melee): Damage a Nilfgaardian enemy unit by 7.
Deploy (Ranged): Boost self by 2 for each allied unit from a different faction.
597.abilityHTML: Deploy (Melee): Damage a Nilfgaardian enemy unit by 7. Deploy (Ranged): Boost self by 2 for each allied unit from a different faction.
597.flavor: Releasing a monster that dangerous in front of a crowd? Plain irresponsible.

598.name: Tourney Joust
598.keywordsHTML: Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit.
598.ability: Remove an enemy unit's Shield and damage it by 4, or give an allied unit a Shield and boost it by 4.
598.abilityHTML: Remove an enemy unit's Shield and damage it by 4, or give an allied unit a Shield and boost it by 4.
598.flavor: Fame and glory eternal await the victor of this year's annual chivalric tourney!

599.name: Toussaint Knight-Errant
599.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
599.ability: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2. If it has at least 6 power, damage it by 4 instead.
599.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2. If it has at least 6 power, damage it by 4 instead.
599.flavor: White steed, shiny-arse armor... Aye, 'tis a knight-errant alright. Fetch the coffin maker!

600.name: Ducal Guard
600.keywordsHTML: Assimilate: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a card that is not from your starting deck.
600.flavor: And whatever you do, never, EVER, mention the duchess's sister. Right, so... Welcome to Her Majesty's royal guard!

601.name: Menagerie Keeper
601.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor.
601.ability: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2. If you have a Tactic in your hand, give it Bleeding for 2 turns.
601.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2. If you have a Tactic in your hand, give it Bleeding for 2 turns.
601.flavor: If there's one thing Nilfgaardians love more than blood-soaked arena battles, it's blood-soaked arena battles with exotic beasts.

602.name: Imperial Diviner
602.keywordsHTML: Assimilate: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a card that is not from your starting deck. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Purify: Remove all statuses.
602.abilityHTML: Assimilate. Deploy: Purify a unit.
602.flavor: Emperor Emhyr var Emreis spared no effort to find his daughter, even resorting to arcane magics of the mages and sorceresses he had so vehemently despised.

603.name: Fangs of the Empire
603.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it.
603.ability: Deploy: Give an enemy unit Poison.
603.abilityHTML: Deploy: Give an enemy unit Poison.
603.flavor: For a courtesan, a single drop. For a rock troll, an entire bottle. And for Nordling scum? Why waste good poison when a rusty dagger will do?

604.name: Duchess's Informant
604.keywordsHTML: Disloyal: This card is played on the opposite side of the battlefield, then gains Spying. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
604.ability:
Disloyal.
Deploy: Spawn and play a base copy of a non-Disloyal bronze enemy unit.
604.abilityHTML: Disloyal. Deploy: Spawn and play a base copy of a non-Disloyal bronze enemy unit.
604.flavor: Anna Henrietta wakes every morn to the tune of her songbirds.

605.name: King Roegner
605.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit.
605.ability: Deploy (Melee): Remove Shields from all units, then boost self by 3 for every Shield removed.
605.abilityHTML: Deploy (Melee): Remove Shields from all units, then boost self by 3 for every Shield removed.
605.flavor: King Roegner of Cintra, once grievously wounded at the bottom of a ravine, hollered for aid. Alas... His call was answered only by the hisses of vipers and the howls of ravenous werewolves...

606.name: Queen Adalia
606.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit.
606.ability: Deploy: Spawn and play a base copy of a bronze Northern Realms unit from your hand, then give it Shield.
606.abilityHTML: Deploy: Spawn and play a base copy of a bronze Northern Realms unit from your hand, then give it Shield.
606.flavor: Queen Adalia of Cintra possessed the power to raise a drawbridge with a twitch of her brow. A frightening thought what she could do with a wave of her hand...

607.name: Prince Anséis
607.keywordsHTML: Formation: If played on the melee row, gain Zeal. If played on the ranged row, boost self by 1. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Inspired: Trigger this ability if this unit's current power is higher than its base power. Duel: Units take turns dealing damage equal to their power until one of them is destroyed.
607.ability:
Formation.
Order: Damage an enemy unit by 4.
Inspired: Duel an enemy unit instead.
607.abilityHTML: Formation. Order: Damage an enemy unit by 4. Inspired: Duel an enemy unit instead.
607.flavor: Your presence at this tourney is an affront to my honor!

608.name: Vissegerd
608.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
608.ability:
Deploy: Gain Charges equal to the amount of boosted allied units.
Order: Damage an enemy unit by 1.
Charge: 1.
608.abilityHTML: Deploy: Gain Charges equal to the amount of boosted allied units. Order: Damage an enemy unit by 1. Charge: 1.
608.flavor: I will raise Cintra from the ashes no matter how great the cost.

609.name: Coodcoodak
609.keywordsHTML: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Purify: Remove all statuses.
609.abilityHTML: Zeal. Order: Purify adjacent units.
609.flavor: Coodcoodak, throwing his head back, howled and growled, screeched and squealed, whined and bleated – all in a medley of voices both known and unknown, domestic and wild, of reality and of myth.

610.name: Windhalm of Attre
610.keywordsHTML: Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit.
610.ability:
Shield.
Every allied turn, on turn end, boost this unit by 2 if it has a Shield.
610.abilityHTML: Shield. Every allied turn, on turn end, boost this unit by 2 if it has a Shield.
610.flavor: Off with his head! But slowly, drag it out, put on a show for all to see. His death must serve as an example.

611.name: Runeword
611.keywordsHTML: Create: Spawn one of three randomly selected cards from the specified source. Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit.
611.ability: Create and play a bronze Northern Realm Mage and give it a Shield.
611.abilityHTML: Create and play a bronze Northern Realm Mage and give it a Shield.
611.flavor: Probably best not to utter that.

612.name: Cintrian Spellweaver
612.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges.
612.ability:
Order: Damage a unit by 1. Charge: 1.
Gain 1 Charge whenever you play a Mage or a Spell.
612.abilityHTML: Order: Damage a unit by 1. Charge: 1. Gain 1 Charge whenever you play a Mage or a Spell.

613.name: Cintrian Enchantress
613.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Vitality: Status that boosts this unit by 1 on its turn end. Note: Vitality turns can accumulate; 1 turn of Vitality cancels out 1 turn of Bleeding. Bonded: Trigger this ability if you control a copy of this card.
613.ability:
Deploy (Ranged): Give an allied unit Vitality for 2 turns. 
Bonded: Give it Vitality for 4 turns instead.
613.abilityHTML: Deploy (Ranged): Give an allied unit Vitality for 2 turns. Bonded: Give it Vitality for 4 turns instead.
613.flavor: The ladies of the Cintrian court are oft touted for their stately elegance – and equally impressive aptitude for magic

614.name: Cintrian Artificer
614.keywordsHTML: Formation: If played on the melee row, gain Zeal. If played on the ranged row, boost self by 1. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit.
614.ability:
Formation.
Order: Give an allied unit a Shield.
614.abilityHTML: Formation. Order: Give an allied unit a Shield.
614.flavor: What shall I call it? Perhaps Andúril...

615.name: Cintrian Knight
615.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit. Vitality: Status that boosts this unit by 1 on its turn end. Note: Vitality turns can accumulate; 1 turn of Vitality cancels out 1 turn of Bleeding.
615.ability:
Deploy (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 2. 
Deathblow: Gain Vitality for 2 turns.
615.abilityHTML: Deploy (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 2. Deathblow: Gain Vitality for 2 turns.
615.flavor: For whom does the bell toll?

616.name: Cintrian Royal Guard
616.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
616.ability: Deploy: Boost self by 3 for every other Cintrian Royal Guard under your control.
616.abilityHTML: Deploy: Boost self by 3 for every other Cintrian Royal Guard under your control.
616.flavor: Queen Calanthe handpicked her personal guard with meticulous care. Each must serve with unconditional loyalty, stand more than six feet tall, and possess a devilishly handsome jawline.

617.name: Cintrian Envoy
617.keywordsHTML: Formation: If played on the melee row, gain Zeal. If played on the ranged row, boost self by 1. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
617.ability:
Formation.
Order: Look at 3 random cards from your deck. You may move 1 to the top of it.
Cooldown: 2.
617.abilityHTML: Formation. Order: Look at 3 random cards from your deck. You may move 1 to the top of it. Cooldown: 2.
617.flavor: She thought service in the diplomatic corps would mean a quiet life behind a desk. She and her blistered feet were sorely mistaken...

618.name: Knighthood
618.ability: Split 6 boost randomly between all units on an allied row.
618.abilityHTML: Split 6 boost randomly between all units on an allied row.
618.flavor: Kneel an everyman, arise a knight!

619.name: Fauve
619.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
619.ability: Deploy: Play a Nature card from your deck.
619.abilityHTML: Deploy: Play a Nature card from your deck.
619.flavor: At the edge of the wood, a lone dryad awaited them. Dandelion recognized her at once – the very same with green hair who had given them light in dark of night and urged the bard to continue his ballads.

620.name: The Great Oak
620.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
620.ability: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by the number of cards to the left of Great Oak, then boost self by the number of cards to the right of Great Oak.
620.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by the number of cards to the left of Great Oak, then boost self by the number of cards to the right of Great Oak.
620.flavor: The trees of Brokilon oft rustle amongst themselves, despairing of the ancient oak whose heart now rots with hatred.

621.name: Weeping Willow
621.keyword: harmony, deploy, melee, shield, ranged, poison
621.keywordsHTML: Harmony: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a Scoia'tael unit, whose primary category is unique among all of your units. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it.
621.ability:
Harmony.
Deploy (Melee): Gain Shield.
Deploy (Ranged): Poison an enemy unit.
621.abilityHTML: Harmony. Deploy (Melee): Gain Shield. Deploy (Ranged): Poison an enemy unit.
621.flavor: Its name misleads, for 'tis not the tree who weeps.

622.name: Water of Brokilon
622.keywordsHTML: Spawn: Add a card to the game.
622.ability: Spawn 2 Dryad Fledglings into the row.
622.abilityHTML: Spawn 2 Dryad Fledglings into the row.
622.flavor: Drink, child. Wash away your past, your worries. Drink and become our sister!

623.name: Sirssa
623.keywordsHTML: Harmony: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a Scoia'tael unit, whose primary category is unique among all of your units. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit.
623.ability:
Harmony.
Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2.
Deathblow: Boost a unit in your hand by 2.
623.abilityHTML: Harmony. Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2. Deathblow: Boost a unit in your hand by 2.
623.flavor: With silent grace, a dark-haired dryad nimbly descended a spiralling cascade of mushrooms along the tree's trunk, her lithe body camouflaged with fallen leaves.

624.name: Treant Boar
624.keyword: Deploy, zeal, order, melee, ranged, heal, cooldown
624.keywordsHTML: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Heal: If a unit's current power is lower than its base power, restore it either to base power or by the amount specified. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
624.ability:
Deploy: Gain Zeal if you Control a Dryad.
Order (Melee): Move self to the Ranged row and Heal self.
Order (Ranged): Move self to the Melee row and damage enemy by 2.
Cooldown: 1
624.abilityHTML: Deploy: Gain Zeal if you Control a Dryad. Order (Melee): Move self to the Ranged row and Heal self. Order (Ranged): Move self to the Melee row and damage enemy by 2. Cooldown: 1
624.flavor: Dryads wield a mystifying power to shape the forest's trees into any form they wish. So why not a giant boar?

625.name: Dryad's Caress
625.keywordsHTML: Purify: Remove all statuses. Vitality: Status that boosts this unit by 1 on its turn end. Note: Vitality turns can accumulate; 1 turn of Vitality cancels out 1 turn of Bleeding.
625.ability:
Purify an allied unit and boost it by 3.
If you control a Dryad, also give it Vitality for 3 turns.
625.abilityHTML: Purify an allied unit and boost it by 3. If you control a Dryad, also give it Vitality for 3 turns.
625.flavor: Shh, shh... Evelienn va maeth, elaine blath...

626.name: Dryad Grovekeeper
626.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Vitality: Status that boosts this unit by 1 on its turn end. Note: Vitality turns can accumulate; 1 turn of Vitality cancels out 1 turn of Bleeding.
626.ability: Deploy: Give an allied unit Vitality with a duration equal to the number of other allied Dryad units.
626.abilityHTML: Deploy: Give an allied unit Vitality with a duration equal to the number of other allied Dryad units.
626.flavor: Is it true? That flowers in Brokilon bloom seven times a year? But... How can that be?

627.name: Treant Mantis: Stalk
627.keywordsHTML: Ambush: Played face down, then flips over when the ability's condition is met. Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it.
627.ability:
Spring: Transform into Treant Mantis: Strike.
Ambush: Give the next unit played by your opponent Poison and transform into Treant Mantis: Strike.
627.abilityHTML: Spring: Transform into Treant Mantis: Strike. Ambush: Give the next unit played by your opponent Poison and transform into Treant Mantis: Strike.
627.flavor: Feel to you like we're bein' followed?

628.name: Forest Whisperer
628.keyword: deploy, melee, poison, order, ranged, vitality
628.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Vitality: Status that boosts this unit by 1 on its turn end. Note: Vitality turns can accumulate; 1 turn of Vitality cancels out 1 turn of Bleeding.
628.ability:
Deploy (Melee): Give an enemy unit Poison.
Order (Ranged): Give an allied unit Vitality for 3 turns.
628.abilityHTML: Deploy (Melee): Give an enemy unit Poison. Order (Ranged): Give an allied unit Vitality for 3 turns.
628.flavor: The dryads of Brokilon mastered a unique craft – to shape trees at will... And breathe into them life.

629.name: Brokilon Sentinel
629.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).
629.ability:
Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2.
Deathblow: Summon all copies of this unit from your deck to this row.
629.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2. Deathblow: Summon all copies of this unit from your deck to this row.
629.flavor: Brokilon is not merely the forest you see before you. She yet lives on in the cities, villages, and fields you so callously carved from her flesh. We shall yet reclaim what you have stolen from her.

630.name: Dryad Ranger
630.keywordsHTML: Harmony: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a Scoia'tael unit, whose primary category is unique among all of your units. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it.
630.ability:
Harmony.
Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2, then give it Poison.
630.abilityHTML: Harmony. Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2, then give it Poison.
630.flavor: I do not live in the forest of Brokilon. I am a part of it.

631.name: Dryad Matron
631.ability: Every allied turn, on turn end, move to the rightmost spot on this row, then boost an allied unit to the left by 1.
631.abilityHTML: Every allied turn, on turn end, move to the rightmost spot on this row, then boost an allied unit to the left by 1.
631.flavor: She teaches young dryads many useful skills: fletching arrows, communing with the forest, slitting the throats of men...

632.name: Dryad Fledgling
632.keywordsHTML: Harmony: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a Scoia'tael unit, whose primary category is unique among all of your units.
632.flavor: Having recently tasted of the Water of Brokilon, she yet feels strange in her new skin... Her gift for killing, on the other hand, bloomed without delay.

633.name: Knut the Callous
633.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
633.ability: Deploy: Damage an allied unit to the right by half of its current power, then damage an enemy unit by that amount.
633.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage an allied unit to the right by half of its current power, then damage an enemy unit by that amount.
633.flavor: Knut, son of Oluf? Aye, never has a jarl's moniker fit so well.

634.name: Svalblod Totem
634.keywordsHTML: Resilience: Status that allows a unit to remain on the battlefield at the end of the round, then disappears.\nNote: Boost and Armor are not carried over to the next round. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
634.ability:
Resilience.
Deploy: Spawn a Svalblod Fanatic on both sides of this card.
Order: Damage adjacent units by 2.
634.abilityHTML: Resilience. Deploy: Spawn a Svalblod Fanatic on both sides of this card. Order: Damage adjacent units by 2.
634.flavor: All totems to Svalblod were ordered destroyed, yet on distant, forgotten shores some yet stand tall... And continue to collect new victims.

635.name: Artis
635.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
635.ability:
Deploy: Play a 4 provision Cultist from your deck.
Ranged: Whenever a unit is played, damage it by half its power.
635.abilityHTML: Deploy: Play a 4 provision Cultist from your deck. Ranged: Whenever a unit is played, damage it by half its power.
635.flavor: Not all Svalblod priests were forced from the isles... Unfortunately.

636.name: Vildkaarl
636.keywordsHTML: Berserk: Trigger this ability whenever power is equal to or lower than the specified amount.
636.ability: Berserk 2: Transform into a Champion of Svalblod.
636.abilityHTML: Berserk 2: Transform into a Champion of Svalblod.
636.flavor: Strike me! C'mon, harder! You call this pain?!

637.name: Arnvald
637.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
637.ability: Deploy: Transform a damaged allied unit into a Bear Abomination.
637.abilityHTML: Deploy: Transform a damaged allied unit into a Bear Abomination.
637.flavor: His name on the island was synonymous with loyalty. For a time.

638.name: Sigvald
638.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused. Berserk: Trigger this ability whenever power is equal to or lower than the specified amount.
638.ability:
Order (Melee): Damage a unit by 1. Cooldown: 1
Berserk 4: Damage by 2 instead.
638.abilityHTML: Order (Melee): Damage a unit by 1. Cooldown: 1 Berserk 4: Damage by 2 instead.
638.flavor: A vildkaarl that lives to old age earns the respect of his clan.

639.name: Corrupted Flaminica
639.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
639.ability: Deploy: Boost self by 1 for every Beast in your graveyard.
639.abilityHTML: Deploy: Boost self by 1 for every Beast in your graveyard.
639.flavor: At times, even druids succumb to Svalblod's whispers...

640.name: Svalblod Priest
640.ability: At the end of your turn, damage the unit to the right by 1, then boost self by 2.
640.abilityHTML: At the end of your turn, damage the unit to the right by 1, then boost self by 2.
640.flavor: The cruelty of Svalblod priests proved so fierce, so merciless that – upon the cult's collapse – they were condemned and cast out to the high seas aboard longships with nary a paddle nor sail to guide them.

641.name: Svalblod Cultist
641.keywordsHTML: Heal: If a unit's current power is lower than its base power, restore it either to base power or by the amount specified.
641.ability: At the end of every allied turn, Heal the unit to the left by 1 and damage the unit to the right by 1.
641.abilityHTML: At the end of every allied turn, Heal the unit to the left by 1 and damage the unit to the right by 1.
641.flavor: They... They's butcherin' folk, Captain! S-sacrifices to a bear god or some such!

642.name: Svalblod Fanatic
642.keywordsHTML: Berserk: Trigger this ability whenever power is equal to or lower than the specified amount.
642.ability: Berserk 2: Transform into a Bear Abomination.
642.abilityHTML: Berserk 2: Transform into a Bear Abomination.
642.flavor: Not all are worthy of Svalblod's blessing.

643.name: Primal Savagery
643.keywordsHTML: Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).
643.ability:
Damage an enemy unit by 2. 
Deathblow: Spawn a Bear Abomination and Summon it to a random allied row.
643.abilityHTML: Damage an enemy unit by 2. Deathblow: Spawn a Bear Abomination and Summon it to a random allied row.
643.flavor: Not all of Svalblod's worshippers wield bow and blade. They've simply no need.

644.name: Disgraced Brawler
644.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Bloodthirst: Number of damaged enemy units required to trigger this ability. Lock: Status that disables a unit's abilities. Berserk: Trigger this ability whenever power is equal to or lower than the specified amount.
644.ability:
Deploy, Bloodthirst 3: Lock self.
Berserk 3: Destroy self.
644.abilityHTML: Deploy, Bloodthirst 3: Lock self. Berserk 3: Destroy self.
644.flavor: Skellige's no home to murderers and rogues... Their crimes must be repaid in blood.

645.name: Bear Abomination
645.keywordsHTML: Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield.
645.flavor: I'm tellin' youse. Bears fear us more than we fear them. Well... Normal bears, I mean.

646.name: Dettlaff: Higher Vampire
646.keywordsHTML: Deathwish: Trigger this ability when destroyed and moved from the battlefield to the graveyard. Note: Banished units are not sent to the graveyard. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).
646.ability:
Deathwish: Summon this unit from the graveyard to the same row. 
This unit's ability is limited to 2 uses and does not refresh when it leaves the battlefield.
646.abilityHTML: Deathwish: Summon this unit from the graveyard to the same row. This unit's ability is limited to 2 uses and does not refresh when it leaves the battlefield.
646.flavor: In his true form, the Beast of Beauclair could cause even a witcher to quake in his boots.

647.name: Champion of Svalblod
647.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Heal: If a unit's current power is lower than its base power, restore it either to base power or by the amount specified.
647.ability: Order: Destroy an allied unit, then Heal self.
647.abilityHTML: Order: Destroy an allied unit, then Heal self.
647.flavor: This bear taste funny to you?

648.name: Treant Mantis: Strike
648.flavor: Don't move! He can't see us if we don't move.

649.name: Courier
649.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
649.ability:
Deploy (Melee): Look at the top 3 cards from your opponent's deck and move one to the top.
Deploy (Ranged): Look at the top 3 cards from your deck and move one to the top.
649.abilityHTML: Deploy (Melee): Look at the top 3 cards from your opponent's deck and move one to the top. Deploy (Ranged): Look at the top 3 cards from your deck and move one to the top.
649.flavor: 'Tis not steel and blood that wins wars, but information.

650.name: Renegade Mage
650.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability.
650.ability:
Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 1.
Tribute 1: Damage it by 3 instead.
650.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 1. Tribute 1: Damage it by 3 instead.
650.flavor: I really hope that's boot leather I smell burning...

651.name: Caleb Menge
651.keywordsHTML: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Bounty: When a unit with this status is destroyed or banished, opponent gains coins equal to its base power. There can be only one unit with Bounty status on each side of the board at given time. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
651.ability:
Profit 3.
Fee 3 (Melee): Place a Bounty on an enemy unit.
Cooldown: 1.
651.abilityHTML: Profit 3. Fee 3 (Melee): Place a Bounty on an enemy unit. Cooldown: 1.
651.flavor: Deceivers, heretics, witches! They flood our city, corrupt our virtue, and threaten our very way of life!

652.name: Beggar
652.keywordsHTML: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Bonded: Trigger this ability if you control a copy of this card.
652.abilityHTML: Profit 3. Bonded: Profit 5 instead.
652.flavor: Say what you will about his technique, I think he captured your good side.

653.name: Philippa Eilhart
653.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round. Seize: Move an enemy unit to the opposite row and give it Spying. If it already had Spying, remove Spying instead.
653.ability: Deploy: Spend a number of Coins equal to an enemy unit's power, then Seize it.
653.abilityHTML: Deploy: Spend a number of Coins equal to an enemy unit's power, then Seize it.
653.flavor: Soon the power of kings will wither, and the Lodge shall seize its rightful place.

654.name: Sigi Reuven
654.keywordsHTML: Intimidate: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a Crime card. Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins.
654.ability:
Intimidate.
Profit 4.
For every unique gang category in your starting deck, increase Sigi Reuven's initial Profit by 1.
654.abilityHTML: Intimidate. Profit 4. For every unique gang category in your starting deck, increase Sigi Reuven's initial Profit by 1.
654.flavor: You sure he don't look the least bit familar...?

655.name: Vivaldi Bank
655.keywordsHTML: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round.
655.ability:
Profit 3.
Look at the top card from your deck plus an additional card for every Coin you possess. Play the top card for free, or play another card for a Coin cost equal to its distance from the top. Shuffle the remaining cards back into your deck.
655.abilityHTML: Profit 3. Look at the top card from your deck plus an additional card for every Coin you possess. Play the top card for free, or play another card for a Coin cost equal to its distance from the top. Shuffle the remaining cards back into your deck.
655.flavor: We're sorry to lose your business, but we wish ye well with those dunderhe-- er... With those fine folk over at Cianfanelli Bank.

656.name: Eavesdrop
656.keywordsHTML: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins.
656.ability:
Profit 5.
Draw a card, then put a card from your hand at the bottom of your deck.
656.abilityHTML: Profit 5. Draw a card, then put a card from your hand at the bottom of your deck.
656.flavor: There are always more ears in the room than those you can count.

657.name: Graden
657.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Bounty: When a unit with this status is destroyed or banished, opponent gains coins equal to its base power. There can be only one unit with Bounty status on each side of the board at given time. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability.
657.ability:
Deploy (Melee): Destroy an enemy unit with a Bounty.
Tribute 5: Boost self by that unit's base power.
657.abilityHTML: Deploy (Melee): Destroy an enemy unit with a Bounty. Tribute 5: Boost self by that unit's base power.
657.flavor: Initially, we burned any tomes on black magic we found. Recently we decided it might be wise to read them first.

658.name: Blood Money
658.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round.
658.ability:
Order: Damage an enemy unit by 8, then gain Coins equal to any excess damage dealt.

This ability adds 16 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
658.abilityHTML: Order: Damage an enemy unit by 8, then gain Coins equal to any excess damage dealt. This ability adds 16 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
658.flavor: A war with Whoreson will see Novigrad's gutters run red with blood.

659.name: Kurt
659.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Bounty: When a unit with this status is destroyed or banished, opponent gains coins equal to its base power. There can be only one unit with Bounty status on each side of the board at given time. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Purify: Remove all statuses.
659.ability:
Deploy (Melee): Place a Bounty on an enemy unit.
Deploy (Ranged): Purify a unit.
659.abilityHTML: Deploy (Melee): Place a Bounty on an enemy unit. Deploy (Ranged): Purify a unit.
659.flavor: Oy, Kurt, find out what Merigold's hollerin' about, if she needs anything. A hot iron to the tongue, maybe?

660.name: Moreelse
660.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability.
660.ability:
Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 4.
Tribute 6: Destroy it instead.
660.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 4. Tribute 6: Destroy it instead.
660.flavor: Some witch hunters truly believed the eradication of mages and sorceresses would make the world a better place. Moreelse did not require such a lofty justification.

661.name: Blindeye Apothecary
661.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Heal: If a unit's current power is lower than its base power, restore it either to base power or by the amount specified. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability.
661.ability:
Deploy (Melee): Heal an allied unit.
Deploy (Ranged): Boost an allied unit by 4.
Tribute 2: Combine both Deploy abilities instead.
661.abilityHTML: Deploy (Melee): Heal an allied unit. Deploy (Ranged): Boost an allied unit by 4. Tribute 2: Combine both Deploy abilities instead.
661.flavor: After her husband died in a tragic carriage accident, she threw herself completely into her work.

662.name: Horst Borsodi
662.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Vitality: Status that boosts this unit by 1 on its turn end. Note: Vitality turns can accumulate; 1 turn of Vitality cancels out 1 turn of Bleeding.
662.ability:
Deploy: Gain 3 Coins.
If Ewald Borsodi is in your graveyard, gain 6 Coins instead.
Fee 1: Give an allied unit Vitality 1.
662.abilityHTML: Deploy: Gain 3 Coins. If Ewald Borsodi is in your graveyard, gain 6 Coins instead. Fee 1: Give an allied unit Vitality 1.
662.flavor: My auction house is, above all, a gathering place for the elite of the elite.

663.name: Sly Seductress
663.keywordsHTML: Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit. Bonded: Trigger this ability if you control a copy of this card.
663.ability:
Fee 3: Gain a Shield.
Whenever your opponent plays a unit, boost self by 1.
Bonded: Whenever your opponent plays a card, boost self by 1.
663.abilityHTML: Fee 3: Gain a Shield. Whenever your opponent plays a unit, boost self by 1. Bonded: Whenever your opponent plays a card, boost self by 1.
663.flavor: The sweeter her words, the more bitter your losses.

664.name: Ewald Borsodi
664.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor.
664.ability:
Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2.
If Horst Borsodi is in your graveyard, damage an enemy unit by 4 instead.
Fee 1: Give an enemy unit Bleeding 1.
664.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2. If Horst Borsodi is in your graveyard, damage an enemy unit by 4 instead. Fee 1: Give an enemy unit Bleeding 1.
664.flavor: I've crafted this plan for over a year, but now the time's come for action. Can I count on your help?

665.name: Pickpocket
665.keywordsHTML: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins.
665.flavor: My apologies, miss... Always been a clumsy one, I have.

666.name: Tamara Strenger
666.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability.
666.ability:
Deploy: Boost all allied Witch Hunters by 1.
Tribute 3: Boost all allied Witch Hunters in hand, deck and on the battlefield by 1 instead.
666.abilityHTML: Deploy: Boost all allied Witch Hunters by 1. Tribute 3: Boost all allied Witch Hunters in hand, deck and on the battlefield by 1 instead.
666.flavor: Once the heat of the Fire has set your heart aflame, it gives you strength and leads you down the path of truth for the rest of your life.

667.name: Whoreson Senior
667.keywordsHTML: Intimidate: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a Crime card. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability.
667.ability:
Intimidate.
Deploy: Transform an adjacent unit into a Cutup Lackey.
Tribute 3: Transform adjacent units into Cutup Lackeys instead.
667.abilityHTML: Intimidate. Deploy: Transform an adjacent unit into a Cutup Lackey. Tribute 3: Transform adjacent units into Cutup Lackeys instead.

668.name: Adriano the Mink
668.keywordsHTML: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
668.ability:
Profit 2.
Increase the Profit by 1 for each allied Sly Seductress.
Tribute 5: Spawn a Sly Seductress in this row.
668.abilityHTML: Profit 2. Increase the Profit by 1 for each allied Sly Seductress. Tribute 5: Spawn a Sly Seductress in this row.
668.flavor: Right here, beautiful. Have a sit on daddy's lap.

669.name: Back-Alley Chemist
669.keywordsHTML: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it.
669.ability:
Zeal.
Order: Poison an allied unit and boost it by 2.
669.abilityHTML: Zeal. Order: Poison an allied unit and boost it by 2.
669.flavor: I do this for my family, always for my family!

670.name: Adalbertus Kalkstein
670.keywordsHTML: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Purify: Remove all statuses.
670.abilityHTML: Profit 2. Fee 2: Purify a unit.
670.flavor: Before Kalkstein departed this world, he left us with some rather unflattering words about our gracious king...

671.name: Oxenfurt Naturalist
671.keywordsHTML: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Vitality: Status that boosts this unit by 1 on its turn end. Note: Vitality turns can accumulate; 1 turn of Vitality cancels out 1 turn of Bleeding.
671.ability:
Profit 2.
Fee 1: Give an allied unit Vitality for 1 turn.
671.abilityHTML: Profit 2. Fee 1: Give an allied unit Vitality for 1 turn.
671.flavor: When handling mandrake, you must always remember to don a pair of protective... Wait, where are my gloves?

672.name: Rico Meiersdorf
672.ability: Whenever opponent plays a unit while Rico is in your hand or deck, set his power equal to that unit's power.
672.abilityHTML: Whenever opponent plays a unit while Rico is in your hand or deck, set his power equal to that unit's power.
672.flavor: I never did much like bees.

673.name: Witch Hunter Executioner
673.keywordsHTML: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins.
