Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor. Bounty: When a unit with this status is destroyed or banished, opponent gains coins equal to its base power. There can be only one unit with Bounty status on each side of the board at given time.
673.ability:
Profit 2.
Fee 1: Give an enemy unit Bleeding for 1 turn. If it has a Bounty, damage it by 1 instead.
673.abilityHTML: Profit 2. Fee 1: Give an enemy unit Bleeding for 1 turn. If it has a Bounty, damage it by 1 instead.
673.flavor: It'd be a right shame if I cut any of your beautiful hair.

674.name: Slander
674.keywordsHTML: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Bounty: When a unit with this status is destroyed or banished, opponent gains coins equal to its base power. There can be only one unit with Bounty status on each side of the board at given time.
674.ability:
Profit 3.
Place a Bounty on an enemy unit.
674.abilityHTML: Profit 3. Place a Bounty on an enemy unit.
674.flavor: All Novigradians have two great passions: coin and hearsay.

675.name: Witch Hunter
675.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Bounty: When a unit with this status is destroyed or banished, opponent gains coins equal to its base power. There can be only one unit with Bounty status on each side of the board at given time.
675.ability: Deploy: Place a Bounty on an enemy unit.
675.abilityHTML: Deploy: Place a Bounty on an enemy unit.
675.flavor: Long coats, wide-brimmed hats, and crooked grins – witch hunters are hard to miss.

676.name: Madame Luiza
676.keywordsHTML: Intimidate: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a Crime card. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
676.ability:
Intimidate.
Tribute 3: Gain Zeal.
Order: Your next Tribute this round costs 0.
676.abilityHTML: Intimidate. Tribute 3: Gain Zeal. Order: Your next Tribute this round costs 0.
676.flavor: We've bedded more men than all Redania's army barracks combined.

677.name: Fisstech
677.keywordsHTML: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it.
677.abilityHTML: Profit 4. Poison a unit.
677.flavor: Large pupils, chattering teeth, a mad cackle... Aye, that's fisstech for ye.

678.name: Igor the Hook
678.keywordsHTML: Insanity: If you have insufficient Coins, damage this unit by its Fee amount, ignoring its Armor, to trigger its Fee ability.\nNote: Insanity cannot be used if it would destroy the unit and works only if damage is inflicted. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played). Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
678.ability:
Insanity.
Fee 5: Spawn and Summon a base copy of a bronze allied unit to Igor's row.
Cooldown: 1.
678.abilityHTML: Insanity. Fee 5: Spawn and Summon a base copy of a bronze allied unit to Igor's row. Cooldown: 1.
678.flavor: In the left corner, a bloodthirsty shaelmaar, and in the right co--oh bollocks... Fight's over, hold your bets!

679.name: Tinboy
679.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability.
679.ability:
Deploy: Damage all units on an enemy row by 2.
Tribute 8: Damage all enemy units by 2 instead.
679.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage all units on an enemy row by 2. Tribute 8: Damage all enemy units by 2 instead.
679.flavor: Tinboy's old man labored as a metalworker. On his sober days, he smelted tin. On his drinking days, he smelted his son's face.

680.name: Doadrick Leumaerts
680.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
680.ability:
Deploy: If you control an Agent, gain Zeal.
Order (Ranged): Draw a card, then move a card from your hand to the bottom of your deck.
Cooldown: 1.
680.abilityHTML: Deploy: If you control an Agent, gain Zeal. Order (Ranged): Draw a card, then move a card from your hand to the bottom of your deck. Cooldown: 1.
680.flavor: The emperor has high expectations for you. See that you do not disappoint him. Hael Ker'zaer!

681.name: Tatterwing
681.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
681.ability: Deploy: Destroy an allied unit and boost self by its base power.
681.abilityHTML: Deploy: Destroy an allied unit and boost self by its base power.
681.flavor: She seems a bit sluggish. A few quick jabs to the ribs oughta liven her up.

682.name: Off the books
682.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability.
682.ability:
Order: Gain 2 Coin. Charge: 3.
Your Tributes cost 1 Coin less.

This ability adds 16 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
682.abilityHTML: Order: Gain 2 Coin. Charge: 3. Your Tributes cost 1 Coin less. This ability adds 16 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
682.flavor: Titles and trinkets don't interest me. I desire power, and power alone.

683.name: Dip in the Pontar
683.keywordsHTML: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins.
683.ability:
Profit 3.
Damage an enemy unit by 3.
683.abilityHTML: Profit 3. Damage an enemy unit by 3.
683.flavor: The Pontar's got more bodies than fish these days.

684.name: Payday
684.keywordsHTML: Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round.
684.ability: Damage an enemy unit by 5. Gain a Coin for each point of excess damage dealt.
684.abilityHTML: Damage an enemy unit by 5. Gain a Coin for each point of excess damage dealt.
684.flavor: I-I already gave ye all me coin!

685.name: Tidecloak Hideaway
685.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
685.ability: Deploy (Ranged): Boost an allied unit by 1 for every Pirate in your hand.
685.abilityHTML: Deploy (Ranged): Boost an allied unit by 1 for every Pirate in your hand.
685.flavor: Once a terror of the high seas, it now sits idle and fat with gold, unable to leave port.

686.name: Pugo Boom-Breaker
686.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
686.ability: Deploy: Damage a random allied unit by 3. If there are no allies, damage self by 5 instead.
686.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage a random allied unit by 3. If there are no allies, damage self by 5 instead.
686.flavor: Listen, troll, I can promise you a hundred crowns if you take the fa--AAAAAAGH!!!

687.name: Boris
687.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round.
687.ability:
Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 3.
Deathblow: Gain 3 Coins.
687.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 3. Deathblow: Gain 3 Coins.
687.flavor: After getting a taste of human flesh, he won't eat anything else.

688.name: Sewer Raiders
688.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Hoard: Trigger this ability if you possess the specified number of Coins or more. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).
688.ability: Deploy, Hoard 4: Summon copies of this unit from your deck to this row.
688.abilityHTML: Deploy, Hoard 4: Summon copies of this unit from your deck to this row.
688.flavor: Built for movin' shite, but it moves coin just as well.

689.name: Wretched Addict
689.keywordsHTML: Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it.
689.ability: Every allied turn, on turn end, if this unit is Poisoned, boost it by 2.
689.abilityHTML: Every allied turn, on turn end, if this unit is Poisoned, boost it by 2.
689.flavor: I'd sell me own mum for a whiff. And I'd cut 'er throat for two.

690.name: Eventide Plunder
690.keywordsHTML: Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round.
690.ability: Gain 4 Coins. If your opponent controls an artifact, gain 6 Coins instead.
690.abilityHTML: Gain 4 Coins. If your opponent controls an artifact, gain 6 Coins instead.
690.flavor: Wouldn't be right to let all this rot in port. We's doin' 'em a favor, really.

691.name: Whoreson's Freak Show
691.keywordsHTML: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
691.ability:
Profit 2.
Fee 2 (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 2.
691.abilityHTML: Profit 2. Fee 2 (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 2.

692.name: Townsfolk
692.keywordsHTML: Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round.
692.ability: Whenever you gain Coins, boost self by 1.
692.abilityHTML: Whenever you gain Coins, boost self by 1.
692.flavor: You see people, but I see a flock o' sheep that needs fleecin'.

693.name: Tidecloak Ransackers
693.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round. Hoard: Trigger this ability if you possess the specified number of Coins or more.
693.ability:
Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2.
Deathblow: Gain 2 Coins.
Hoard 5: Trigger the Deathblow even if the enemy unit survived.
693.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2. Deathblow: Gain 2 Coins. Hoard 5: Trigger the Deathblow even if the enemy unit survived.
693.flavor: There's more wealth in Novigrad than in all of Skellige – and the number of poor saps to match.

694.name: Tax Collector
694.keywordsHTML: Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round.
694.ability: Ranged: Every allied turn, on turn end, gain 1 Coin.
694.abilityHTML: Ranged: Every allied turn, on turn end, gain 1 Coin.
694.flavor: Just between rat catcher and latrine shoveler on this year's most desirable professions list.

695.name: Sea Jackal
695.keywordsHTML: Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Hoard: Trigger this ability if you possess the specified number of Coins or more.
695.ability:
Fee 2: Boost self by 2.
Hoard 7: Boost self by 3 instead.
695.abilityHTML: Fee 2: Boost self by 2. Hoard 7: Boost self by 3 instead.
695.flavor: You ever lift rings off a body that's been left to soak for two weeks? No? Then don't complain.

696.name: Kikimore Warrior
696.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).
696.ability: Order: Destroy an allied unit, then Spawn a Kikimore Warrior and Summon it to this row.
696.abilityHTML: Order: Destroy an allied unit, then Spawn a Kikimore Warrior and Summon it to this row.
696.flavor: Come spring, the buggers start to burst through the woodwork. Literally.

697.name: Line of Credit
697.keywordsHTML: Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round.
697.ability: Destroy an allied unit or artifact, then gain 7 Coins.
697.abilityHTML: Destroy an allied unit or artifact, then gain 7 Coins.
697.flavor: Illiterate, ye say? A moment, if ye could. I'll draw us up another agreement...

698.name: Fence
698.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Vitality: Status that boosts this unit by 1 on its turn end. Note: Vitality turns can accumulate; 1 turn of Vitality cancels out 1 turn of Bleeding. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability.
698.ability:
Deploy (Ranged): Gain Vitality for a duration equal to your Coin count.
Tribute 3: Boost self by your Coin count instead.
698.abilityHTML: Deploy (Ranged): Gain Vitality for a duration equal to your Coin count. Tribute 3: Boost self by your Coin count instead.

699.name: Fisstech Trafficker
699.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round.
699.ability: Deploy: Give Poison to a unit. If it's an ally, gain 3 Coins.
699.abilityHTML: Deploy: Give Poison to a unit. If it's an ally, gain 3 Coins.
699.flavor: Addictive? Why, not at all! I've quit several times before!

700.name: Hvitr and Aelydia
700.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Hoard: Trigger this ability if you possess the specified number of Coins or more. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
700.ability:
Order (Melee): Damage a unit by 1. 
Hoard 5: Damage an enemy unit by 2 instead.
Cooldown: 1.
700.abilityHTML: Order (Melee): Damage a unit by 1. Hoard 5: Damage an enemy unit by 2 instead. Cooldown: 1.

701.name: Congregate
701.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges.
701.ability:
Order: Spawn a Firesworn Zealot on an allied row and gain 1 Coin. Charge: 3.

This ability adds 16 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
701.abilityHTML: Order: Spawn a Firesworn Zealot on an allied row and gain 1 Coin. Charge: 3. This ability adds 16 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
701.flavor: Hierarch of the Eternal Fire, enthusiast of the arena, glutton of feasts, and luster of whores.

702.name: Prophet Lebioda
702.keywordsHTML: Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit.
702.ability: Whenever you play a unit next to Prophet Lebioda, give it a Shield.
702.abilityHTML: Whenever you play a unit next to Prophet Lebioda, give it a Shield.
702.flavor: To thine own self be judge and ruler for thou alone shalt answer for thine deeds before thee.

703.name: Sacred Flame
703.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
703.ability:
Deploy: Spawn a Firesworn Zealot on both sides of this card.
Order: Boost all allied Firesworn units by 1.
703.abilityHTML: Deploy: Spawn a Firesworn Zealot on both sides of this card. Order: Boost all allied Firesworn units by 1.
703.flavor: Do you feel it? I sense something else beyond its warmth, something more...

704.name: Grand Inquisitor Helveed
704.keywordsHTML: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
704.ability:
Profit 4.
Fee 2: Spawn a Firesworn Zealot in this row.
704.abilityHTML: Profit 4. Fee 2: Spawn a Firesworn Zealot in this row.
704.flavor: No sinful wretch shall escape his fate in the Fire. Of that, I will make sure.

705.name: Arena Endrega
705.keywordsHTML: Insanity: If you have insufficient Coins, damage this unit by its Fee amount, ignoring its Armor, to trigger its Fee ability.\nNote: Insanity cannot be used if it would destroy the unit and works only if damage is inflicted. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
705.ability:
Insanity.
Fee 1: Damage an enemy unit by 1.
Cooldown: 1.
705.abilityHTML: Insanity. Fee 1: Damage an enemy unit by 1. Cooldown: 1.
705.flavor: Strong as an ox, dumb as a box.

706.name: Damnation
706.keywordsHTML: Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
706.ability:
Damage 3 enemy units by 2.
Deathblow: Spawn a Firesworn Zealot on the opposite row, for each destroyed enemy.
706.abilityHTML: Damage 3 enemy units by 2. Deathblow: Spawn a Firesworn Zealot on the opposite row, for each destroyed enemy.
706.flavor: I can't bloody breathe! Won't they burn the wretches someplace else?

707.name: Nathaniel Pastodi
707.keywordsHTML: Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor.
707.ability: Whenever Nathaniel receives a boost, give Bleeding to a random enemy unit for 2 turns.
707.abilityHTML: Whenever Nathaniel receives a boost, give Bleeding to a random enemy unit for 2 turns.
707.flavor: Novigrad – where the impossible becomes possible. A professional torturer turned reverend, for instance.

708.name: Procession of Penance
708.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
708.ability: Deploy: Damage self by 10. Reduce the damage by 2 for every Firesworn Token you control.
708.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage self by 10. Reduce the damage by 2 for every Firesworn Token you control.
708.flavor: Careful not to stand too close. Got blood splattered on me favorite tunic last time.

709.name: Sukrus
709.ability: Prevent the unit to the left of Sukrus from taking any damage.
709.abilityHTML: Prevent the unit to the left of Sukrus from taking any damage.
709.flavor: One of many who sought fortune in Novigrad. And one of many more who never found it.

710.name: Excommunication
710.keywordsHTML: Banish: Remove from the game. Note: Does not count as being destroyed.
710.ability:
Banish an allied unit, then play the top card from your deck.
If the target was a Firesworn, look at the top 3 cards from your deck and play 1 of them instead.
710.abilityHTML: Banish an allied unit, then play the top card from your deck. If the target was a Firesworn, look at the top 3 cards from your deck and play 1 of them instead.
710.flavor: Aye, better than the pyre, I suppose... But did ye hear the disappointment in his voice? Now that's real sufferin'.

711.name: Arena Ghoul
711.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability.
711.ability:
Deploy: On turn end, destroy self.
Tribute 1: Cancel the Deploy ability.
711.abilityHTML: Deploy: On turn end, destroy self. Tribute 1: Cancel the Deploy ability.
711.flavor: He'll be a perfect fit for your arena. Just like a mutt lickin' your plate after dinner.

712.name: Tavern Brawl
712.keywordsHTML: Duel: Units take turns dealing damage equal to their power until one of them is destroyed.
712.ability: Force an enemy unit to Duel an adjacent unit.
712.abilityHTML: Force an enemy unit to Duel an adjacent unit.
712.flavor: About time we had some entertainment! My knuckles are itchin'!

713.name: Firesworn Zealot
713.keywordsHTML: Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield.
713.flavor: Great is my faith, and great is my ire!

714.name: Wheel of Fortune
714.ability: Damage an enemy unit by a random amount between 1 and 10.
714.abilityHTML: Damage an enemy unit by a random amount between 1 and 10.
714.flavor: A game where good aim is considered subjective.

715.name: Bincy Blumerholdt
715.keywordsHTML: Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round.
715.ability: Ranged: Whenever you gain Coins, boost self by 1 for each Coin gained.
715.abilityHTML: Ranged: Whenever you gain Coins, boost self by 1 for each Coin gained.
715.flavor: In all Novigrad, she has the hairiest feet and the stickiest hands.

716.name: Eternal Fire Priest
716.keywordsHTML: Spawn: Add a card to the game.
716.ability: Whenever you Spawn one or more units to the battlefield, boost self by 1.
716.abilityHTML: Whenever you Spawn one or more units to the battlefield, boost self by 1.
716.flavor: Closer, my sheep, gather closer. May the Eternal Fire warm your souls!

717.name: Cutup Lackey
717.keywordsHTML: Bonded: Trigger this ability if you control a copy of this card.
717.ability:
Whenever you play a Crime card, damage a random enemy unit by 1.
Bonded: Increase the damage by 1.
717.abilityHTML: Whenever you play a Crime card, damage a random enemy unit by 1. Bonded: Increase the damage by 1.
717.flavor: The boss always gets to have the most fun. Truth be told, I prefer to watch anyway.

718.name: Hammond
718.keywordsHTML: Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor.
718.ability:
Deploy: Move an enemy unit to the other row and give it Bleeding (2).
Increase Bleeding by 1 for each adjacent Pirate.
718.abilityHTML: Deploy: Move an enemy unit to the other row and give it Bleeding (2). Increase Bleeding by 1 for each adjacent Pirate.
718.flavor: Once mistaken for a whale calf and nearly harpooned. He's avoided swimming ever since.

719.name: Eternal Fire Inquisitor
719.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
719.ability:
Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2.
Deathblow: Spawn a Firesworn Zealot in this row.
719.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2. Deathblow: Spawn a Firesworn Zealot in this row.
719.flavor: The burning light of the Eternal Fire reveals all!

720.name: Eternal Fire Disciple
720.keywordsHTML: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
720.ability:
Profit 2.
Fee 2: Spawn a Firesworn Zealot in this row.
Cooldown: 1.
720.abilityHTML: Profit 2. Fee 2: Spawn a Firesworn Zealot in this row. Cooldown: 1.
720.flavor: Look into your hearts, dear brethen. Does a contempt for injustice not burn within it?

721.name: The Flying Redanian
721.keywordsHTML: Hoard: Trigger this ability if you possess the specified number of Coins or more. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).
721.ability: Hoard 9: On turn end, Summon this unit from your deck or graveyard to a random allied row.
721.abilityHTML: Hoard 9: On turn end, Summon this unit from your deck or graveyard to a random allied row.
721.flavor: Legend tells of a Redanian crew from generations past who unearthed a treasure so great they became forever destined to argue amongst themselves on how to divide their spoils.

722.name: Casino Bouncers
722.keywordsHTML: Insanity: If you have insufficient Coins, damage this unit by its Fee amount, ignoring its Armor, to trigger its Fee ability.\nNote: Insanity cannot be used if it would destroy the unit and works only if damage is inflicted. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).
722.ability:
Insanity.
Fee 1: Summon all copies of this unit from your deck to this row.
722.abilityHTML: Insanity. Fee 1: Summon all copies of this unit from your deck to this row.
722.flavor: Junior said our nasty mugs was frightenin' off all the coin. Don't rightly see 'ow this helps any...

723.name: Keeper of the Flame
723.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability.
723.ability:
Deploy: Boost adjacent units by 1.
Tribute 4: Boost all units in this row by 1 instead.
Decrease this card's Tribute cost by 1 for every allied Cleric.
723.abilityHTML: Deploy: Boost adjacent units by 1. Tribute 4: Boost all units in this row by 1 instead. Decrease this card's Tribute cost by 1 for every allied Cleric.
723.flavor: The flame shall forever burn, for evil shall forever corrupt!

724.name: Imke
724.keywordsHTML: Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit.
724.ability:
Ranged: Every allied turn, on turn end, gain 2 Coins.
Fee 3: Gain a Shield.
724.abilityHTML: Ranged: Every allied turn, on turn end, gain 2 Coins. Fee 3: Gain a Shield.
724.flavor: No sooner had she caught Gudrun's attention than sought to exploit it.

725.name: Bloody Good Fun
725.keywordsHTML: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round.
725.ability:
Profit 4.
Spend all your Coins and damage an enemy by the same amount.
725.abilityHTML: Profit 4. Spend all your Coins and damage an enemy by the same amount.
725.flavor: What do ye mean, Why? The game was beginnin' to drag!

726.name: Temple Guard
726.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
726.ability: Deploy (Melee): Boost 3 adjacent allied units by 1.
726.abilityHTML: Deploy (Melee): Boost 3 adjacent allied units by 1.
726.flavor: Halt! Who goes there?! Firesworn or heretic?

727.name: Jackpot
727.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round.
727.ability:
Order: Gain 9 Coins, then boost an allied unit by any excess amount gained.
Whenever an allied unit gives you Coins, boost it by any excess amount gained.

This ability adds 13 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
727.abilityHTML: Order: Gain 9 Coins, then boost an allied unit by any excess amount gained. Whenever an allied unit gives you Coins, boost it by any excess amount gained. This ability adds 13 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
727.flavor: Any hopes that a woman's presence might soften the city's underbelly proved misguided. Horribly, woefully misguided.

728.name: Congregation
728.keywordsHTML: Spawn: Add a card to the game.
728.ability:
Spawn 2 Firesworn Zealots in an allied row.
If a Firesworn unit is in that row, Spawn 3 Firesworn Zealots instead.
728.abilityHTML: Spawn 2 Firesworn Zealots in an allied row. If a Firesworn unit is in that row, Spawn 3 Firesworn Zealots instead.
728.flavor: Our church is not this temple, not our scripture. It is our people, our community, we who have faith.

729.name: Halfling Safecracker
729.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
729.ability: Deploy: Boost self by 1 for each Crime in your hand.
729.abilityHTML: Deploy: Boost self by 1 for each Crime in your hand.
729.flavor: With ears sharp as his, he could've been a musician. Alas, one cannot get rich as quickly from applause.

730.name: Firesworn Scribe
730.keywordsHTML: Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability.
730.ability:
Ranged: Whenever you Spawn one or more units to the battlefield, gain 1 Coin.
Tribute 2: Boost self by 2.
730.abilityHTML: Ranged: Whenever you Spawn one or more units to the battlefield, gain 1 Coin. Tribute 2: Boost self by 2.
730.flavor: Wouldn't disturb him if I were you. Those quills are bloody sharp.

731.name: Bare-Knuckle Brawler
731.keywordsHTML: Intimidate: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a Crime card.
731.flavor: Is tha' all that's left of 'im?\nThink I'm goin' tae boak...

732.name: Shakedown
732.keywordsHTML: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins.
732.ability:
Profit 3.
Boost an allied unit by 3.
732.abilityHTML: Profit 3. Boost an allied unit by 3.
732.flavor: Nae need to be stingy, pal. There's plenty to go 'round.

733.name: Coerced Blacksmith
733.keywordsHTML: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins.
733.ability:
Profit 2.
Fee 1: Boost an allied unit by 1.
733.abilityHTML: Profit 2. Fee 1: Boost an allied unit by 1.
733.flavor: Do ye prefer a full coin purse or a full set of fingers?

734.name: Swindle
734.keywordsHTML: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins.
734.ability:
Profit 4 - 6.
For each allied Crownsplitters, increase the minimal amount by 1.
734.abilityHTML: Profit 4 - 6. For each allied Crownsplitters, increase the minimal amount by 1.
734.flavor: There are a hundred ways to fleece a sheep. And Cleaver's crew knew them all.

735.name: Cleaver's Muscle
735.keywordsHTML: Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit.
735.flavor: Those who try to cheat Cleaver are in for a rude awakening... And a rough landing.

736.name: Crownsplitter Thug
736.keywordsHTML: Intimidate: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a Crime card. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
736.ability:
Intimidate.
Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2.
736.abilityHTML: Intimidate. Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2.
736.flavor: Frilly frock or Mahakam steel breastplate – wouldn't have mattered.

737.name: Harald Gord
737.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
737.ability:
Deploy: Boost self by 0.
Increase the boost by 1 for every special card you played this game. Boost cannot exceed 12.
737.abilityHTML: Deploy: Boost self by 0. Increase the boost by 1 for every special card you played this game. Boost cannot exceed 12.
737.flavor: The last occasion Harald's grim countenance betrayed a smile was in 1211 when Brouver Hoog drunkenly ate five bowls of goat and cabbage stew then promptly shat his trousers.

738.name: Novigradian Justice
738.keywordsHTML: Spawn: Add a card to the game. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
738.ability:
Play a bronze Dwarf or Crownsplitter unit from your deck.
If you already control a Dwarf or Crownsplitter, also Spawn a Cleaver's Muscle on the allied Melee row.
738.abilityHTML: Play a bronze Dwarf or Crownsplitter unit from your deck. If you already control a Dwarf or Crownsplitter, also Spawn a Cleaver's Muscle on the allied Melee row.
738.flavor: With both arms tied behind me back, recall ye said. So feel free to start kickin' me in the arse when the mood strikes ye.

739.name: Sir Skewertooth
739.keywordsHTML: Intimidate: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a Crime card. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability. Immunity: Status whereby this card cannot be manually targeted.
739.abilityHTML: Intimidate 2. Tribute 3: Gain Immunity.
739.flavor: Here he is! My knight in swining armor!

740.name: Tunnel Drill
740.keywordsHTML: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins.
740.ability:
Profit 2.
Fee 2: Damage an enemy unit by 1.
If you played a Crime this turn, damage an enemy unit by 3 instead.
740.abilityHTML: Profit 2. Fee 2: Damage an enemy unit by 1. If you played a Crime this turn, damage an enemy unit by 3 instead.
740.flavor: Though originally designed for mining excavations under Mount Carbon, the machine struck more gold under the streets of Novigrad.

741.name: Caesar Bilzen
741.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins.
741.ability:
Deploy: Trigger the Profit abilities of adjacent units.
Fee 2: Boost an allied unit by 2.
741.abilityHTML: Deploy: Trigger the Profit abilities of adjacent units. Fee 2: Boost an allied unit by 2.
741.flavor: Avid angler, meticulous collector, and a real piece of work.

742.name: The Sausage Maker
742.keywordsHTML: Intimidate: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a Crime card. Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Resilience: Status that allows a unit to remain on the battlefield at the end of the round, then disappears.\nNote: Boost and Armor are not carried over to the next round.
742.abilityHTML: Intimidate. Profit 3. Fee 3 (Melee): Gain Resilience.
742.flavor: Body disposal and sausage makin', that's what I do. And judgin' by that expression, I'd say ye already ken th' answer to your follow-up question.

743.name: Ferko the Sculptor
743.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
743.ability: Deploy (Melee): Play a Crime from your deck.
743.abilityHTML: Deploy (Melee): Play a Crime from your deck.
743.flavor: Some call it base thuggery. But me, I consider it the highest art form.

744.name: Pirate's Cove
744.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges.
744.ability:
Order: Spawn a Sea Jackal on an allied row.
Charges: 2.

This ability adds 14 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
744.abilityHTML: Order: Spawn a Sea Jackal on an allied row. Charges: 2. This ability adds 14 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
744.flavor: Me hogs willnae go hungry th' day thanks to ye.

745.name: Walter Veritas
745.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Create: Spawn one of three randomly selected cards from the specified source.
745.ability: Deploy: Create and play a bronze Syndicate card.
745.abilityHTML: Deploy: Create and play a bronze Syndicate card.
745.flavor: In a city that feeds on lies, truth can be a weapon.

746.name: Geralt: Axii
746.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Purify: Remove all statuses.
746.ability: Deploy: Purify a unit and reset its power.
746.abilityHTML: Deploy: Purify a unit and reset its power.
746.flavor: Placing his left arm around the horse's neck, Geralt makes the Axii sign with the fingers of his right hand above the steed's head and whispers the incantation.

747.name: Knickers
747.ability: This unit may raid the battlefield to aid you in battle.
747.abilityHTML: This unit may raid the battlefield to aid you in battle.
747.flavor: Leave it alone, Knickers! Damn it, leave it alone!

748.name: Olgierd: Immortal
748.ability: Olgierd's power cannot be changed by other cards wherever he is.
748.abilityHTML: Olgierd's power cannot be changed by other cards wherever he is.
748.flavor: All of my dreams have come true. Unfortunately.

749.name: Iris: Shade
749.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
749.ability: Deploy: Remove a unit's Armor and boost self by that amount.
749.abilityHTML: Deploy: Remove a unit's Armor and boost self by that amount.
749.flavor: Olgierd's betrothed was like a dream…

750.name: Gascon: Iron Falcon
750.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Create: Spawn one of three randomly selected cards from the specified source.
750.ability: Deploy: Create and play a bronze Bandit card.
750.abilityHTML: Deploy: Create and play a bronze Bandit card.
750.flavor: I'm doing what I used to do and they're paying me for it!

751.name: One-Eyed Betsy
751.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
751.ability: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 4. If it has Armor, damage it by 6 instead.
751.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 4. If it has Armor, damage it by 6 instead.
751.flavor: Maybe it lacks depth perception, but it sure packs a wallop.

752.name: Vlodimir von Everec
752.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
752.ability: Deploy: Swap a unit's power with Armor.
752.abilityHTML: Deploy: Swap a unit's power with Armor.
752.flavor: Vlodimir liked to have a good time when he was alive and greatly missed having fun after his death.

753.name: Free Company
753.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
753.ability: Deploy: Boost all allied Bandits by 1.
753.abilityHTML: Deploy: Boost all allied Bandits by 1.
753.flavor: It's because we're free to do whatever we want! Ha, ha, ha!

754.name: Living Armor
754.keywordsHTML: Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
754.ability: This unit's power is always equal to its Armor.
754.abilityHTML: This unit's power is always equal to its Armor.
754.flavor: Sure it's expensive. But considering how much you'll save on room and board, you'll get a return on the investment by the end of this century!

755.name: Armory
755.keywordsHTML: Resilience: Status that allows a unit to remain on the battlefield at the end of the round, then disappears.\nNote: Boost and Armor are not carried over to the next round. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
755.ability:
Resilience.
Deploy: Boost an allied unit by 6.
Order: Give 3 Armor to an allied unit.
755.abilityHTML: Resilience. Deploy: Boost an allied unit by 6. Order: Give 3 Armor to an allied unit.
755.flavor: Guisarmes? Maces? Spiked Maces? I have everything you could possibly need.

756.name: Surrender
756.keywordsHTML: Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
756.ability: Remove 2 Armor from all units in a row and damage them by 2.
756.abilityHTML: Remove 2 Armor from all units in a row and damage them by 2.
756.flavor: There's no shame in waving the white flag.

757.name: Wagenburg
757.keywordsHTML: Barricade: Trigger this ability if the unit has armor. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
757.ability: Barricade: At the end of your turn, give 1 Armor to adjacent units.
757.abilityHTML: Barricade: At the end of your turn, give 1 Armor to adjacent units.
757.flavor: Dh'oine can turn anything into a weapon. Even a simple wagon…

758.name: Iron Falcon Knife Juggler
758.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor.
758.ability: Deploy: Give 2 random enemy units Bleeding for 2 turns.
758.abilityHTML: Deploy: Give 2 random enemy units Bleeding for 2 turns.
758.flavor: The weapon's short, but its range is long.

759.name: Iron Falcon Infantry
759.keywordsHTML: Barricade: Trigger this ability if the unit has armor.
759.ability: Barricade: At the end of every allied turn, boost self by 1.
759.abilityHTML: Barricade: At the end of every allied turn, boost self by 1.
759.flavor: You have to look good on the battlefield too.

760.name: Iron Falcon Troubadour
760.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
760.ability: Deploy: Give 2 Armor to a unit in your hand.
760.abilityHTML: Deploy: Give 2 Armor to a unit in your hand.
760.flavor: When I play even dying's more pleasant.

761.name: Piercing Missile
761.keywordsHTML: Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
761.ability: Damage an enemy unit by 4, ignoring its Armor.
761.abilityHTML: Damage an enemy unit by 4, ignoring its Armor.
761.flavor: There's no armor that can't be pierced.

762.name: Wagon
762.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
762.ability:
Deploy: If you control a Bandit, gain Zeal.
Order: Give an allied unit 3 Armor.
762.abilityHTML: Deploy: If you control a Bandit, gain Zeal. Order: Give an allied unit 3 Armor.
762.flavor: The driver swore he was carrying seeds. But seeds don't clank on bumps in the road…

763.name: Mantlet
763.keywordsHTML: Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power. Barricade: Trigger this ability if the unit has armor.
763.ability:
Melee: Whenever you play a unit, give it 1 Armor.
Barricade: Give it 2 Armor instead.
763.abilityHTML: Melee: Whenever you play a unit, give it 1 Armor. Barricade: Give it 2 Armor instead.
763.flavor: Something like the bastard child of a shield and a palisade.

764.name: Sapper
764.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
764.abilityHTML: Deploy: Remove a unit's Armor.
764.flavor: Aim wherever you want. The shrapnel will take care of it.

765.name: Highwaymen
765.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
765.ability: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 1. If it has Armor, damage it by 3 instead.
765.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 1. If it has Armor, damage it by 3 instead.
765.flavor: We'll torture the merchant and sell the horses.

766.name: Armorer's Workshop
766.keywordsHTML: Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
766.ability: Boost 3 adjacent units by 2 and give them 2 Armor.
766.abilityHTML: Boost 3 adjacent units by 2 and give them 2 Armor.
766.flavor: He'll make a helm out of a pot if need be.

767.name: Philippa: Blind Fury
767.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
767.ability: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 4, then damage random enemy units by 3,2,1.
767.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 4, then damage random enemy units by 3,2,1.
767.flavor: Philippa Eilhart, though very attractive, was decidedly very unkind.

768.name: Donimir of Troy
768.keywordsHTML: Defender: Status that prevents the opponent from targeting other cards in this row. Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit.
768.flavor: I fought twice at Sodden and lived. I think you can surmise I'm not so bad at this sword thing.

769.name: Voymir
769.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
769.ability: Deploy: Boost an allied unit and all its copies by 1 and give them 1 Armor.
769.abilityHTML: Deploy: Boost an allied unit and all its copies by 1 and give them 1 Armor.
769.flavor: Quietly, on tiptoes, no noise, no fuss. Through the back alleys. In Loxia and the port keep your mouth shut! Go!

770.name: Mad Charge
770.keywordsHTML: Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power. Vitality: Status that boosts this unit by 1 on its turn end. Note: Vitality turns can accumulate; 1 turn of Vitality cancels out 1 turn of Bleeding.
770.ability:
Boost an allied unit by 4 and give it 2 Armor.
If you control a Knight, also give it Vitality for 3 turns.
770.abilityHTML: Boost an allied unit by 4 and give it 2 Armor. If you control a Knight, also give it Vitality for 3 turns.
770.flavor: You can't stop a galloping cavalry horse. So if things go bad, the only thing to do is to lower your lance, close your eyes and pray to the gods.

771.name: Radovid's Royal Guards
771.keywordsHTML: Formation: If played on the melee row, gain Zeal. If played on the ranged row, boost self by 1. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Inspired: Trigger this ability if this unit's current power is higher than its base power. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
771.ability:
Formation.
Order: Boost an allied unit by 2.
Inspired: Give it 2 Armor.
771.abilityHTML: Formation. Order: Boost an allied unit by 2. Inspired: Give it 2 Armor.
771.flavor: They'll do anything for their king. They know what he'll do to them if they refuse.

772.name: Redanian Archer
772.keywordsHTML: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges. Barricade: Trigger this ability if the unit has armor.
772.ability:
Zeal.
Order (Ranged): Damage an enemy unit by 1. Charge: 1.
Barricade: At the end of every allied turn, gain 1 Charge.
772.abilityHTML: Zeal. Order (Ranged): Damage an enemy unit by 1. Charge: 1. Barricade: At the end of every allied turn, gain 1 Charge.
772.flavor: The last thing you'll hear is the twang of the bowstring being let go.

773.name: Azar Javed
773.keywordsHTML: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability.
773.ability:
Profit 3.
Deploy: Spawn a Scarab in this row.
Tribute 3: Spawn 2 Scarabs in this row instead.
773.abilityHTML: Profit 3. Deploy: Spawn a Scarab in this row. Tribute 3: Spawn 2 Scarabs in this row instead.
773.flavor: Azar Javed's specialty is the element of fire. The sorcerer not only deftly manipulates the power of fire, it can be said that fire has become a part of his very being.

774.name: Professor
774.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Bounty: When a unit with this status is destroyed or banished, opponent gains coins equal to its base power. There can be only one unit with Bounty status on each side of the board at given time. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
774.ability:
Deploy: Put a Bounty on an enemy unit and damage it by 4.
Tribute 3: Ignore a target's Armor.
774.abilityHTML: Deploy: Put a Bounty on an enemy unit and damage it by 4. Tribute 3: Ignore a target's Armor.
774.flavor: I fear our conventicle may end disastrously for you.

775.name: Savolla
775.keywordsHTML: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
775.ability:
Profit 2.
Tribute 9: Spawn a Savolla's Frightener in this row.
775.abilityHTML: Profit 2. Tribute 9: Spawn a Savolla's Frightener in this row.
775.flavor: Witcher mutagens are a forgotten treasure. It's time the world learned of their potential.

776.name: Dire Mutated Hound
776.keywordsHTML: Barricade: Trigger this ability if the unit has armor. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
776.ability:
Barricade: At the end of every allied turn, boost self by 2.
Fee 4: Gain 1 Armor.
776.abilityHTML: Barricade: At the end of every allied turn, boost self by 2. Fee 4: Gain 1 Armor.
776.flavor: We couldn't decide what to name him and it just kind of came up…

777.name: Mutated Hounds
777.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it.
777.ability:
Deploy (Melee): Give an enemy unit Bleeding for 2 turns.
Deploy (Ranged): Poison a unit.
777.abilityHTML: Deploy (Melee): Give an enemy unit Bleeding for 2 turns. Deploy (Ranged): Poison a unit.
777.flavor: Out of man's best friend we made his worst enemy.

778.name: Assault
778.ability:
Damage an enemy unit by 4.
If you control 2 Salamandra units deal 6 damage instead.
778.abilityHTML:
Damage an enemy unit by 4.
If you control 2 Salamandra units deal 6 damage instead.
778.flavor: Human life is fragile. Especially in Novigrad.

779.name: Salamandra Assassin
779.keywordsHTML: Intimidate: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a Crime card. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
779.ability:
Intimidate.
Order: Damage an enemy unit by 2.
779.abilityHTML: Intimidate. Order: Damage an enemy unit by 2.
779.flavor: A name and bag full of gold. That's all I need.

780.name: Mutant Killer
780.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Hoard: Trigger this ability if you possess the specified number of Coins or more.
780.ability:
Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 1.
Hoard 4: Damage an enemy by 3 instead.
780.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 1. Hoard 4: Damage an enemy by 3 instead.
780.flavor: You have to keep him on a leash, muzzled and with blinders on, otherwise it'll be trouble.

781.name: Mutant
781.keywordsHTML: Intimidate: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a Crime card.
781.flavor: With the right tools you can shape the human body like wet clay.

782.name: Kikimore Queen
782.keywordsHTML: Thrive: Boost this unit by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a unit with higher power.
782.ability:
Thrive.
Whenever this unit's Thrive is triggered, boost all allied Insectoids in this row by 1.
782.abilityHTML: Thrive. Whenever this unit's Thrive is triggered, boost all allied Insectoids in this row by 1.
782.flavor: Many insectoids live in a matriarchy. A bloody one at that.

783.name: Cave Troll
783.keywordsHTML: Defender: Status that prevents the opponent from targeting other cards in this row.
783.flavor: Trolls have very tiny brains and huge stomachs. That's a very dangerous combination.

784.name: Yghern
784.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
784.ability:
Deploy: Gain Armor equal to the number of cards in your hand.
If this unit has no Armor, destroy self.
784.abilityHTML: Deploy: Gain Armor equal to the number of cards in your hand. If this unit has no Armor, destroy self.
784.flavor: Its other name is scolopendromorph. Rarely used, as it's hard to say without spitting all over oneself.

785.name: Endrega Queen
785.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Consume: Destroy a unit and boost self by its power. If target is in the graveyard, Banish it instead. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power. Barricade: Trigger this ability if the unit has armor. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
785.ability:
Deploy: Consume an allied unit and gain its Armor.
Barricade: At the end of your turn, damage self by 1, then Spawn a Drone in this row.
785.abilityHTML: Deploy: Consume an allied unit and gain its Armor. Barricade: At the end of your turn, damage self by 1, then Spawn a Drone in this row.
785.flavor: The Endrega Queen can be easily recognized by the specific coloring of its abdomen. Or, more easily, by its monstrous size

786.name: Armored Arachas
786.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor.
786.ability: Deploy: Apply Bleeding to an enemy unit equal to its base power.
786.abilityHTML: Deploy: Apply Bleeding to an enemy unit equal to its base power.
786.flavor: It can cut half-inch thick metal like a tailor cutting silk.

787.name: Endrega Larva
787.keywordsHTML: Thrive: Boost this unit by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a unit with higher power. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).
787.ability:
Thrive.
Deploy: Spawn a base copy of this unit and Summon it to this row.
787.abilityHTML: Thrive. Deploy: Spawn a base copy of this unit and Summon it to this row.

788.name: Endrega Warrior
788.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Consume: Destroy a unit and boost self by its power. If target is in the graveyard, Banish it instead. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
788.ability: Deploy: Consume adjacent units. Spawn a Drone in this row for each Insectoid consumed.
788.abilityHTML: Deploy: Consume adjacent units. Spawn a Drone in this row for each Insectoid consumed.
788.flavor: Where I come from no one was afraid of the Big Bad Wolf or Baba Yaga. Instead, we had an Endrega nest in the shrubs beyond the village.

789.name: Natural Selection
789.keywordsHTML: Spawn: Add a card to the game.
789.ability: Damage an enemy unit by 4, then Spawn a Drone in a random allied row for each point of excess damage dealt.
789.abilityHTML: Damage an enemy unit by 4, then Spawn a Drone in a random allied row for each point of excess damage dealt.
789.flavor: The strongest will survive. So not you.

790.name: Kikimore Worker
790.keywordsHTML: Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power. Exposed: Trigger this ability whenever the unit loses its Armor.
790.ability:
Melee: Whenever you play an Insectoid, gain 1 Armor.
Exposed: Destroy self.
790.abilityHTML: Melee: Whenever you play an Insectoid, gain 1 Armor. Exposed: Destroy self.
790.flavor: They say it can eat a whole man in armor down to the bone in less than a minute. I'd rather not find out if it's true.

791.name: Endrega Eggs
791.keywordsHTML: Deathwish: Trigger this ability when destroyed and moved from the battlefield to the graveyard. Note: Banished units are not sent to the graveyard. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
791.ability: Deathwish: Spawn 3 Drones in this row.
791.abilityHTML: Deathwish: Spawn 3 Drones in this row.
791.flavor: If you find some it's best to burn the entire forest down. Then run as far away as you can.

792.name: Affan Hillergrand
792.keywordsHTML: Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played). Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
792.ability: When moved to the top of your deck, Summon this unit to your Melee row.
792.abilityHTML: When moved to the top of your deck, Summon this unit to your Melee row.
792.flavor: Jarre doesn't mention him in his books. Maybe he never heard of him. Maybe he heard too much.

793.name: Ramon Tyrconnel
793.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
793.ability: Deploy: Spawn and play a base copy of a bronze Soldier from your hand and give it 2 Armor.
793.abilityHTML: Deploy: Spawn and play a base copy of a bronze Soldier from your hand and give it 2 Armor.
793.flavor: Colonel Ramon Tyrconnel, the young commander of the Ard Feainn division, whistled softly, staring at a point somewhere off in the distance…

794.name: War Council
794.ability: Look at the first 3 cards on the top of your deck and play one of them.
794.abilityHTML: Look at the first 3 cards on the top of your deck and play one of them.
794.flavor: Nilfgaardians fight every battle twice: first on the map, then in reality.

795.name: Ffion var Gaernel
795.keywordsHTML: Defender: Status that prevents the opponent from targeting other cards in this row. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
795.ability:
Defender.
Deploy: Spawn and play Battle Preparation.
795.abilityHTML: Defender. Deploy: Spawn and play Battle Preparation.
795.flavor: Everyone will die somehow. I'll die last.

796.name: Glynnis aep Loernach
796.keywordsHTML: Assimilate: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a card that is not from your starting deck.
796.flavor: She loved every soldier like a son. She cried for each one.

797.name: Ard Feainn Crossbowman
797.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Barricade: Trigger this ability if the unit has armor.
797.ability:
Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2.
Barricade: Damage a random enemy unit by 1 whenever you play a Soldier.
797.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2. Barricade: Damage a random enemy unit by 1 whenever you play a Soldier.
797.flavor: Many thought that mounted crossbowmen wouldn't work. Until they saw them in action.

798.name: Ard Feainn Tortoise
798.keywordsHTML: Exposed: Trigger this ability whenever the unit loses its Armor.
798.ability: Exposed: Boost an enemy unit with the most power by 3.
798.abilityHTML: Exposed: Boost an enemy unit with the most power by 3.
798.flavor: Close formation, clench your sphincters! Left, right, left, steady!

799.name: Ard Feainn Light Cavalry
799.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
799.ability: Deploy: Deal 2 damage to an enemy. If the target has Armor, damage it by 2 again.
799.abilityHTML: Deploy: Deal 2 damage to an enemy. If the target has Armor, damage it by 2 again.

800.name: Ard Feainn Heavy Cavalry
800.keywordsHTML: Assimilate: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a card that is not from your starting deck.
800.flavor: When Emhyr declared that his cavalry would stomp his enemies into the mud, we thought he was speaking metaphorically. We were wrong.

801.name: Battle Preparation
801.keywordsHTML: Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
801.ability:
Boost an allied unit by 4 and give it 2 Armor.
If it's a Soldier, boost it by 6 and give it 2 Armor instead.
801.abilityHTML: Boost an allied unit by 4 and give it 2 Armor. If it's a Soldier, boost it by 6 and give it 2 Armor instead.
801.flavor: Many a knight met an untimely death because of his shoddily tied breastplate coming undone.

802.name: Dracoturtle
802.keywordsHTML: Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power. Barricade: Trigger this ability if the unit has armor.
802.ability:
Whenever this unit loses Armor, boost it by the amount of Armor lost.
Barricade: At the end of your turn, gain 1 Armor.
802.abilityHTML: Whenever this unit loses Armor, boost it by the amount of Armor lost. Barricade: At the end of your turn, gain 1 Armor.
802.flavor: Oxenfurt monstrologists claim the brain of a dracoturtle is the size of a peanut. Its maw, however, is the size of a wide-open gate.

803.name: Covenant of Steel
803.keywordsHTML: Defender: Status that prevents the opponent from targeting other cards in this row. Berserk: Trigger this ability whenever power is equal to or lower than the specified amount. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
803.ability:
Defender.
Berserk 6: At the end of your turn, gain 1 Armor.
803.abilityHTML: Defender. Berserk 6: At the end of your turn, gain 1 Armor.
803.flavor: If you want to give Skelligers a laugh, tell them they're outnumbered.

804.name: Morkvarg: Heart of Terror
804.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
804.ability: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 1. Repeat until target is damaged.
804.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 1. Repeat until target is damaged.
804.flavor: He showed no mercy, didn't respect our laws or our gods. He knew how it must end. And it still didn't stop him.

805.name: Raiding Fleet
805.keywordsHTML: Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor.
805.ability: Give an enemy unit Bleeding for 4 turns, then play a random bronze ship from your deck.
805.abilityHTML: Give an enemy unit Bleeding for 4 turns, then play a random bronze ship from your deck.
805.flavor: The rocky Skellige lands, battered by cold winds, give life only to nettles and moss. But the islanders know that there is fertile soil on the other side of the sea…

806.name: Terror of the Seas
806.keywordsHTML: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
806.ability:
Zeal.
Order: Lose all Armor and damage an enemy unit by that amount.
Whenever you play a Pirate gain 1 Armor.
806.abilityHTML: Zeal. Order: Lose all Armor and damage an enemy unit by that amount. Whenever you play a Pirate gain 1 Armor.
806.flavor: All it takes is a small hole for the largest ship to sink.

807.name: Armored Drakkar
807.keywordsHTML: Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power. Exposed: Trigger this ability whenever the unit loses its Armor.
807.ability:
At the end of your turn, if Armored Drakkar has no Armor, gain 2 Armor.
Exposed: Boost self by 1.
Bloodthirst 2: Boost self by 2 instead.
807.abilityHTML: At the end of your turn, if Armored Drakkar has no Armor, gain 2 Armor. Exposed: Boost self by 1. Bloodthirst 2: Boost self by 2 instead.
807.flavor: You can't take it upriver… but you can certainly take it to chase the imperial fleet.

808.name: Terror Crew Plunderer
808.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
808.ability:
Deploy: Damage a unit by 2.
If it's an ally, boost self by 4.
808.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage a unit by 2. If it's an ally, boost self by 4.
808.flavor: They say diamonds are a girl's best friend. But my best friend is a knife. I can use it to get anything else I want.

809.name: Boatbuilders
809.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
809.ability:
Deploy: Give 2 Armor to an allied unit. If you control a Ship gain Zeal.
Order: Give 1 Armor to an allied unit.
Cooldown: 1
809.abilityHTML: Deploy: Give 2 Armor to an allied unit. If you control a Ship gain Zeal. Order: Give 1 Armor to an allied unit. Cooldown: 1
809.flavor: There's no more respected profession on the islands than boat building. The worst cutthroats bow and ask how things are going…

810.name: Terror Crew Axe-wielder
810.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Exposed: Trigger this ability whenever the unit loses its Armor.
810.ability:
Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2.
Exposed: Damage a random enemy unit by 2.
810.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2. Exposed: Damage a random enemy unit by 2.
810.flavor: But dear Skelligers, what use do you have for axes? There are no trees in the sea…

811.name: Stunning Blow
811.keywordsHTML: Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
811.ability: Damage a unit by 5. If it has Armor, increase damage to 6.
811.abilityHTML: Damage a unit by 5. If it has Armor, increase damage to 6.
811.flavor: It clanged like hitting a bell. The Redanian fell to the ground unconscious, dark blood gushing from underneath the dented metal…

812.name: Zoltan: Warrior
812.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
812.ability:
Deploy (Melee): Spawn 2 Rowdy Dwarves in this row.
Deploy (Ranged): Boost all allied Rowdy Dwarves by 2.
812.abilityHTML: Deploy (Melee): Spawn 2 Rowdy Dwarves in this row. Deploy (Ranged): Boost all allied Rowdy Dwarves by 2.
812.flavor: I've decided to do tangible good, that is not wasted. I am good to myself and my immediate surroundings.

813.name: Percival Schuttenbach
813.keywordsHTML: Harmony: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a Scoia'tael unit, whose primary category is unique among all of your units.
813.flavor: Underneath the wet hood, instead of a billowy beard, was a long, pointed nose, clearly marking its owner as a member of the old and noble race of gnomes.

814.name: Munro Bruys
814.keywordsHTML: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges.
814.ability:
Zeal.
Order: Transform 1 allied Rowdy Dwarf into a Dwarf Berserker.
Charges: 2.
814.abilityHTML: Zeal. Order: Transform 1 allied Rowdy Dwarf into a Dwarf Berserker. Charges: 2.
814.flavor: Munro dreamed of building steam and water-powered hammerworks. But he ended up as bouncer at the worst bar in Vizima…

815.name: Figgis Merluzzo
815.keywordsHTML: Defender: Status that prevents the opponent from targeting other cards in this row. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
815.ability:
Defender.
Deploy: Spawn Rowdy Dwarf in this row.
815.abilityHTML: Defender. Deploy: Spawn Rowdy Dwarf in this row.
815.flavor: I'm a simple guy. I like drinking, eating, singing lewd songs… And when the party dies down, pissing on the dying bonfire.

816.name: Zoltan's Company
816.keywordsHTML: Spawn: Add a card to the game. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
816.ability:
Spawn 3 Rowdy Dwarves on an allied row. 
If you control Zoltan, give 1 Armor to all Dwarves on that row.
816.abilityHTML: Spawn 3 Rowdy Dwarves on an allied row. If you control Zoltan, give 1 Armor to all Dwarves on that row.
816.flavor: They'd follow each other into the fire. And laugh about it.

817.name: Dwarven Chariot
817.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
817.ability:
Deploy: Spawn a Rowdy Dwarf on this row.
Order: Give an allied unit 1 Armor.
Cooldown: 1.
817.abilityHTML: Deploy: Spawn a Rowdy Dwarf on this row. Order: Give an allied unit 1 Armor. Cooldown: 1.
817.flavor: You can draw anything you like, my dear dwarves. But you can't build it, mark my words.

818.name: Tempering
818.keywordsHTML: Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
818.ability: Boost an ally by 5. If it's a Dwarf, also give it 2 Armor.
818.abilityHTML: Boost an ally by 5. If it's a Dwarf, also give it 2 Armor.
818.flavor: Dwarven steel is very tough. Almost as tough as the dwarves themselves.

819.name: Miner
819.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
819.ability:
Order: Boost an allied unit by 2.
If it's a Dwarf, also give it 2 Armor.
819.abilityHTML: Order: Boost an allied unit by 2. If it's a Dwarf, also give it 2 Armor.
819.flavor: Which moron's whistling in the mine?!

820.name: Dryad Enchantress
820.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Vitality: Status that boosts this unit by 1 on its turn end. Note: Vitality turns can accumulate; 1 turn of Vitality cancels out 1 turn of Bleeding.
820.ability:
Deploy (Melee): Give an allied unit 3 Armor.
Deploy (Ranged): Give an allied unit Vitality (3).
820.abilityHTML: Deploy (Melee): Give an allied unit 3 Armor. Deploy (Ranged): Give an allied unit Vitality (3).
820.flavor: The dryads used to stay on the sidelines, avoiding the conflict between the races. But times change…

821.name: Dwarf Berserker
821.keywordsHTML: Barricade: Trigger this ability if the unit has armor.
821.ability: Barricade: At the end of your turn, damage self by 1 then damage a random enemy unit by 1.
821.abilityHTML: Barricade: At the end of your turn, damage self by 1 then damage a random enemy unit by 1.
821.flavor: I know I'm going to die. So I'm making sure I'll have company.

822.name: Rowdy Dwarf
822.keywordsHTML: Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield.
822.flavor: Blech! What is this! That's piss, not beer!

823.name: Radeyah
823.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Create: Spawn one of three randomly selected cards from the specified source.
823.ability:
If your starting deck has no duplicates,
Deploy (Melee): Spawn your faction stratagem in this row.
Deploy (Ranged): Create Neutral stratagem in this row.
823.abilityHTML: If your starting deck has no duplicates, Deploy (Melee): Spawn your faction stratagem in this row. Deploy (Ranged): Create Neutral stratagem in this row.
823.flavor: You can hide a lot behind a beautiful smile.

824.name: Maraal
824.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
824.ability:
Deploy: Poison an enemy unit.
Order (Melee): Poison an enemy unit.
824.abilityHTML: Deploy: Poison an enemy unit. Order (Melee): Poison an enemy unit.
824.flavor: I know how to kill in a thousand and one ways.

825.name: Matta Hu'uri
825.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
825.ability: Deploy (Ranged): If neither player has passed and your opponent's hand is not full, they draw the lowest-cost card, and you draw the highest-cost card.
825.abilityHTML: Deploy (Ranged): If neither player has passed and your opponent's hand is not full, they draw the lowest-cost card, and you draw the highest-cost card.
825.flavor: Sorceresses use magic to hypnotize. I use dance.

826.name: Dulla kh'Amanni
826.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
826.ability: Deploy: If you control Runewright, Spawn Desert Treasure in this row.
826.abilityHTML: Deploy: If you control Runewright, Spawn Desert Treasure in this row.
826.flavor: To know the world is to praise god's name.

827.name: Runewright
827.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
827.ability: Deploy: If you control Dulla kh'Amanni, Spawn Desert Treasure in this row.
827.abilityHTML: Deploy: If you control Dulla kh'Amanni, Spawn Desert Treasure in this row.
827.flavor: Great power lies in words. But it's not easy to enchant it into steel.

828.name: Saer Qu'an
828.ability: After 2 of your turns, boost self by 10 at the end of the turn.
828.abilityHTML: After 2 of your turns, boost self by 10 at the end of the turn.
828.flavor: Every tiger is dangerous. Especially one that has taken a liking to human flesh…

829.name: Caravan Vanguard
829.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Bonded: Trigger this ability if you control a copy of this card.
829.ability:
Deploy (Melee): Boost self by 3.
Deploy (Ranged): Spawn a base copy of self in this row.
Bonded: Use both abilities.
829.abilityHTML: Deploy (Melee): Boost self by 3. Deploy (Ranged): Spawn a base copy of self in this row. Bonded: Use both abilities.
829.flavor: It's not easy to find one's way among the shifting dunes…

830.name: Caravan Guard
830.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
830.ability: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 1. Increase the damage by 1 for each 3 power the target has.
830.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 1. Increase the damage by 1 for each 3 power the target has.
830.flavor: There's a lot of ways you can die in the desert. Not just from thirst.

831.name: King Cobra
831.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it.
831.abilityHTML: Deploy: Poison an enemy unit.
831.flavor: As long as I play it'll dance. But when I stop…

832.name: Ofiri Merchant
832.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
832.ability: Deploy: Swap the top card of your opponent's deck with yours.
832.abilityHTML: Deploy: Swap the top card of your opponent's deck with yours.
832.flavor: I have that which you desire. As well as that which you have never seen before…

833.name: Basilisk Venom
833.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it.
833.abilityHTML: Order: Poison a unit.
833.flavor: People think a basilisk kills with its eyes, but it's the colorless fumes from its venom that cause death…

834.name: Crystal Skull
