834.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses.
834.ability: Order: Boost an allied unit by 4 and give it Veil.
834.abilityHTML: Order: Boost an allied unit by 4 and give it Veil.

835.name: Enchanted Armor
835.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
835.ability: Order: Boost a unit in your hand by 3 and give it 2 Armor.
835.abilityHTML: Order: Boost a unit in your hand by 3 and give it 2 Armor.
835.flavor: Lean in, listen closely, and you'll hear a whisper…

836.name: Cursed Scroll
836.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
836.ability: Order: Draw a card of your choice, then put a card from your hand at the bottom of your deck.
836.abilityHTML: Order: Draw a card of your choice, then put a card from your hand at the bottom of your deck.
836.flavor: The seal states clearly: do not open. But of course… curiosity will win out.

837.name: Ceremonial Dagger
837.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor.
837.ability: Order: Damage an enemy unit by 3 and give it Bleeding (2).
837.abilityHTML: Order: Damage an enemy unit by 3 and give it Bleeding (2).
837.flavor: Decorated like a prince's coronet. Sharp like a butcher's knife.

838.name: Magic Lamp
838.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
838.abilityHTML: Order: Transform into Lamp Djinn.
838.flavor: It's a little tarnished. A little rubbing will make it shiny again.

839.name: Engineering Solution
839.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit.
839.ability: Order: Boost an allied unit by 4 and give it Shield.
839.abilityHTML: Order: Boost an allied unit by 4 and give it Shield.

840.name: War Elephant
840.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Crew: Trigger this ability if this unit is between two Soldiers. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
840.ability:
Order: Damage adjacent units by 4, then boost self by 4 for each unit damaged.
Crew: Boost self by 8 instead.
Cooldown: 6
840.abilityHTML: Order: Damage adjacent units by 4, then boost self by 4 for each unit damaged. Crew: Boost self by 8 instead. Cooldown: 6
840.flavor: It's kind of like a fiend, but bald and with a nose that hangs to the ground. What? No, you're making things up!

841.name: Siege
841.keywordsHTML: Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
841.ability:
Doomed.
Scenario: Progress whenever you play a Siege Engine.
Prologue: Spawn a reinforced Trebuchet on your Ranged row.
Chapter 1: Spawn a Battering Ram on your Ranged row.
Chapter 2: Spawn and play Bombardment.
841.abilityHTML: Doomed. Scenario: Progress whenever you play a Siege Engine. Prologue: Spawn a reinforced Trebuchet on your Ranged row. Chapter 1: Spawn a Battering Ram on your Ranged row. Chapter 2: Spawn and play Bombardment.
841.flavor: There's no fortress that can't be taken. There are just fortresses not worth taking.

842.name: War Chariot
842.keyword: zeal, order, melee, bleeding, ranged, crew, cooldown
842.keywordsHTML: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Crew: Trigger this ability if this unit is between two Soldiers. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
842.ability:
Zeal.
Order (Melee): Give Bleeding for 4 turns to an enemy unit.
Order (Ranged): Move an enemy unit to the other row.
Crew: Combine both Order abilities.
Cooldown: 3.
842.abilityHTML: Zeal. Order (Melee): Give Bleeding for 4 turns to an enemy unit. Order (Ranged): Move an enemy unit to the other row. Crew: Combine both Order abilities. Cooldown: 3.
842.flavor: The chariot drove into the crowd and its enemies fell to the ground like wheat before the scythe…

843.name: Immortals
843.keywordsHTML: Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
843.ability:
Shield.
Melee: Whenever this unit loses its Shield, boost it by 2.
At the end of your turn, gain Shield.
843.abilityHTML: Shield. Melee: Whenever this unit loses its Shield, boost it by 2. At the end of your turn, gain Shield.
843.flavor: Where one falls, another will take his place.

844.name: Siege Ladder
844.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Crew: Trigger this ability if this unit is between two Soldiers.
844.ability:
Deploy: Move an allied unit to other row.
Crew: Boost it by 2.
844.abilityHTML: Deploy: Move an allied unit to other row. Crew: Boost it by 2.
844.flavor: What?! Now you tell me you're afraid of heights?!

845.name: Immortal Cavalry
845.keywordsHTML: Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
845.ability:
Shield.
Deploy: Spawn a base copy of this unit in this row.
845.abilityHTML: Shield. Deploy: Spawn a base copy of this unit in this row.
845.flavor: Maybe camels aren't as swift as horses… but at least they don't die after two days in the desert.

846.name: Carroballista
846.keyword: deploy, crew, armor, order, ranged, cooldown
846.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Crew: Trigger this ability if this unit is between two Soldiers. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
846.ability:
Deploy, Crew: Gain 2 Armor.
Order (Ranged): Damage an enemy unit by 2.
Cooldown: 3.
846.abilityHTML: Deploy, Crew: Gain 2 Armor. Order (Ranged): Damage an enemy unit by 2. Cooldown: 3.

847.name: Boiling Oil
847.keywordsHTML: Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit. Purify: Remove all statuses.
847.ability:
Damage an enemy unit by 5.
Deathblow: Purify adjacent units.
847.abilityHTML: Damage an enemy unit by 5. Deathblow: Purify adjacent units.

848.name: Mask of Uroboros
848.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Discard: Move a card from your hand to the graveyard. Note: Related abilities are not triggered when discarding manually. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
848.ability: Order: Draw a card, then Discard a card and Spawn 2 Crows in your Melee row.
848.abilityHTML: Order: Draw a card, then Discard a card and Spawn 2 Crows in your Melee row.
848.flavor: Time doesn't flow, it goes in circles. The past becomes the future, grandfathers repeat the mistakes of their grandsons.

849.name: Gedyneith
849.keywordsHTML: Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
849.ability:
Doomed.
Scenario: Progress whenever you play a Druid.
Prologue: Spawn a Crow Clan Preacher on this row.
Chapter 1: Spawn and play Crow's-eye Rhizome.
Chapter 2: Spawn and play Mardroeme.
849.abilityHTML: Doomed. Scenario: Progress whenever you play a Druid. Prologue: Spawn a Crow Clan Preacher on this row. Chapter 1: Spawn and play Crow's-eye Rhizome. Chapter 2: Spawn and play Mardroeme.
849.flavor: Rulers are crowned in its shadow. Traitors are hanged on its branches.

850.name: Crowmother
850.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).
850.ability:
Deploy: Spawn 2 Crows in this row.
Whenever you play an Alchemy card, Summon Crowmother from your graveyard to a random allied row.
850.abilityHTML: Deploy: Spawn 2 Crows in this row. Whenever you play an Alchemy card, Summon Crowmother from your graveyard to a random allied row.
850.flavor: Some crows learn human words. And some humans learn the language of the crows.

851.name: Gigascorpion Decoction
851.ability: Damage a unit by 1 six times.
851.abilityHTML: Damage a unit by 1 six times.
851.flavor: How much of a dose would be lethal? Any.

852.name: Axel Three-Eyes
852.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
852.ability:
Deploy (Melee): Spawn a Crow in this row.
Deploy (Ranged): Boost self by 1 for each allied Beast.
852.abilityHTML: Deploy (Melee): Spawn a Crow in this row. Deploy (Ranged): Boost self by 1 for each allied Beast.
852.flavor: Though his words contain much wisdom, it is easily drowned out by its madness.

853.name: Crow Clan Druid
853.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
853.abilityHTML: Deploy: Boost adjacent Beasts by 2.
853.flavor: Wise men claim that animals are mindless automatons. Wise men don't know what they're talking about.

854.name: Crow Clan Preacher
854.keywordsHTML: Bonded: Trigger this ability if you control a copy of this card.
854.ability:
Whenever you play an Alchemy card, boost self by 1.
Bonded: Boost self by 2 instead.
854.abilityHTML: Whenever you play an Alchemy card, boost self by 1. Bonded: Boost self by 2 instead.
854.flavor: A lot of learning awaits you. And a lot of mistakes.

855.name: Crow's-eye Rhizome
855.keywordsHTML: Spawn: Add a card to the game.
855.ability: Spawn 2 Crows in allied row. If you control a Druid, Spawn 3 Crows instead.
855.abilityHTML: Spawn 2 Crows in allied row. If you control a Druid, Spawn 3 Crows instead.
855.flavor: Fatally poisonous. Unless you know how to prepare it…

856.name: Crow Messenger
856.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).
856.ability:
Deploy: Summon all copies of this unit from your graveyard to this row.
If you hold an Alchemy card, also Summon all copies from your deck.
856.abilityHTML: Deploy: Summon all copies of this unit from your graveyard to this row. If you hold an Alchemy card, also Summon all copies from your deck.
856.flavor: The Crowmother has a thousand eyes and each one is closely watching.

857.name: Urn of Shadows
857.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Deathwish: Trigger this ability when destroyed and moved from the battlefield to the graveyard. Note: Banished units are not sent to the graveyard.
857.ability: Order: Trigger Deathwish of an allied unit.
857.abilityHTML: Order: Trigger Deathwish of an allied unit.
857.flavor: Everyone carries some darkness in them. Some have learned to bend it to their will…

858.name: Plague Maiden
858.keywordsHTML: Deathwish: Trigger this ability when destroyed and moved from the battlefield to the graveyard. Note: Banished units are not sent to the graveyard. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
858.ability: Deathwish: Spawn 7 Rats in this row.
858.abilityHTML: Deathwish: Spawn 7 Rats in this row.
858.flavor: To bring down humanity, she will awaken her rats and send them to die in the happy city.

859.name: Penitent
859.keywordsHTML: Thrive: Boost this unit by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a unit with higher power. Deathwish: Trigger this ability when destroyed and moved from the battlefield to the graveyard. Note: Banished units are not sent to the graveyard. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).
859.ability:
Thrive.
Deathwish: Summon a random 7-cost unit from your deck to this row.
859.abilityHTML: Thrive. Deathwish: Summon a random 7-cost unit from your deck to this row.
859.flavor: The places this monster haunts are quickly covered by fog and darkness. Those that get lost in it usually don't return to the living.

860.name: The Beast
860.ability: At the end of your turn, if this unit is not the unit with the highest power on the battlefield, boost it by 2.
860.abilityHTML: At the end of your turn, if this unit is not the unit with the highest power on the battlefield, boost it by 2.
860.flavor: The Beast didn't come from nowhere. You all summoned it. With your lust, your greed and your cruelty.

861.name: Haunt
861.keywordsHTML: Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield. Deathwish: Trigger this ability when destroyed and moved from the battlefield to the graveyard. Note: Banished units are not sent to the graveyard. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
861.ability:
Doomed.
Scenario: Progress whenever you play a unit with Deathwish.
Prologue: Spawn a Desert Banshee in this row.
Chapter 1: Spawn and play Barghest.
Chapter 2: Spawn and play Nightwraith.
861.abilityHTML: Doomed. Scenario: Progress whenever you play a unit with Deathwish. Prologue: Spawn a Desert Banshee in this row. Chapter 1: Spawn and play Barghest. Chapter 2: Spawn and play Nightwraith.
861.flavor: If you don't finish your oatmeal, a Haunt will come and eat you!

862.name: Barghest
862.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Consume: Destroy a unit and boost self by its power. If target is in the graveyard, Banish it instead. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Dominance: Trigger this ability if you control the highest unit on the battlefield.
862.ability:
Deploy: Consume an allied unit.
Order, Dominance: Consume an allied unit.
862.abilityHTML: Deploy: Consume an allied unit. Order, Dominance: Consume an allied unit.
862.flavor: Some claim they're the vanguard of the Wild Hunt. Others that they're vengeance incarnate. Everyone agrees that barghests have no mercy for the living.

863.name: Desert Banshee
863.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Consume: Destroy a unit and boost self by its power. If target is in the graveyard, Banish it instead. Deathwish: Trigger this ability when destroyed and moved from the battlefield to the graveyard. Note: Banished units are not sent to the graveyard.
863.ability:
Order: Consume an allied unit.
Whenever you play a unit with the Deathwish ability, boost self by 1.
863.abilityHTML: Order: Consume an allied unit. Whenever you play a unit with the Deathwish ability, boost self by 1.
863.flavor: You're worried you'll die of thirst in the sands? Relax. You won't make it that long.

864.name: Noonwraith
864.keywordsHTML: Deathwish: Trigger this ability when destroyed and moved from the battlefield to the graveyard. Note: Banished units are not sent to the graveyard. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
864.ability: Deathwish: Spawn 2 Rats in a random enemy row.
864.abilityHTML: Deathwish: Spawn 2 Rats in a random enemy row.
864.flavor: Contrary to popular belief, farmers don't stop work in the middle of the day to hide from the heat - they hide from the Noonwraith.

865.name: Nightwraith
865.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Deathwish: Trigger this ability when destroyed and moved from the battlefield to the graveyard. Note: Banished units are not sent to the graveyard.
865.ability:
Deploy: Spawn 2 Rats in this row.
Deathwish: Spawn 2 Rats in this row.
865.abilityHTML: Deploy: Spawn 2 Rats in this row. Deathwish: Spawn 2 Rats in this row.
865.flavor: How much damage can a pale, emaciated woman, entangled in a ripped dress, do? A lot, it turns out.

866.name: Aen Seidhe Sabre
866.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
866.ability: Order: Spawn and play Scoia'tael Neophyte.
866.abilityHTML: Order: Spawn and play Scoia'tael Neophyte.
866.flavor: When this blade cuts through the air, you don't hear a swish, you hear music…

867.name: Etriel
867.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
867.ability:
Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 3.
If you control Muirlega, damage it by 7 instead.
867.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 3. If you control Muirlega, damage it by 7 instead.
867.flavor: People tame wild animals. I talk to them.

868.name: Muirlega
868.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
868.ability:
Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 3.
If you control Etriel, also damage adjacent units by 3.
868.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 3. If you control Etriel, also damage adjacent units by 3.
868.flavor: It has brushes for ears. And human blood on its teeth.

869.name: Vernossiel
869.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
869.ability:
Deploy (Melee): Each allied Elven Deadeye damages a random enemy unit by 2.
Deploy (Ranged): Spawn 2 Elven Deadeyes in this row.
869.abilityHTML: Deploy (Melee): Each allied Elven Deadeye damages a random enemy unit by 2. Deploy (Ranged): Spawn 2 Elven Deadeyes in this row.
869.flavor: It turns out that the forest isn't inhabited by, to quote the captain of the guard, some furry fucking thing, but Scoia'tael commandos. They were led by someone named Vernossiel…

870.name: Feign Death
870.keywordsHTML: Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
870.ability:
Doomed.
Scenario: Progress whenever you play an elf.
Prologue: Spawn a Vernossiel's Commando in this row.
Chapter 1: Spawn 2 Elven Deadeyes in this row.
Chapter 2: Spawn and play Waylay.
870.abilityHTML: Doomed. Scenario: Progress whenever you play an elf. Prologue: Spawn a Vernossiel's Commando in this row. Chapter 1: Spawn 2 Elven Deadeyes in this row. Chapter 2: Spawn and play Waylay.
870.flavor: In order to set a trap, you should usually hide. But… there are exceptions to this rule.

871.name: Vernossiel's Commando
871.ability:
At the end of your turn, boost self by 1 if you control only Elf units.
Ignore the condition if you control Vernossiel.
871.abilityHTML:
At the end of your turn, boost self by 1 if you control only Elf units.
Ignore the condition if you control Vernossiel.
871.flavor: Only a swish could be heard... Followed by six men tumbling dead to the ground.

872.name: Vrihedd Saboteur
872.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
872.ability: Deploy (Melee): Boost an Elf in your hand by 2.
872.abilityHTML: Deploy (Melee): Boost an Elf in your hand by 2.
872.flavor: The gates were ordered to be closed… But they didn't budge.

873.name: Nature's Rebuke
873.keywordsHTML: Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit.
873.ability:
Damage an enemy unit by 5. 
Deathblow: Boost a random allied Treant by 2.
873.abilityHTML: Damage an enemy unit by 5. Deathblow: Boost a random allied Treant by 2.
873.flavor: Nature has long endured man's excesses. But even she finally ran out of patience…

874.name: Trained Hawk
874.keywordsHTML: Harmony: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a Scoia'tael unit, whose primary category is unique among all of your units. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
874.ability:
Harmony.
Deploy (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 2.
Deploy (Ranged): Move an enemy unit to their other row.
874.abilityHTML: Harmony. Deploy (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 2. Deploy (Ranged): Move an enemy unit to their other row.
874.flavor: I whistle once, it comes back. I whistle twice, it comes back with your eyes in its talons.

875.name: Collar
875.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Lock: Status that disables a unit's abilities.
875.ability: Order: Lock an enemy unit and damage it by 3.
875.abilityHTML: Order: Lock an enemy unit and damage it by 3.
875.flavor: Those who fall into debt with the Moorlehems have two options: go into slavery or kill themselves. The smart ones choose option number two.

876.name: Vincent Van Moorlehem
876.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
876.ability: Deploy: Destroy an enemy unit with status.
876.abilityHTML: Deploy: Destroy an enemy unit with status.
876.flavor: Everyone gives the Moorlehems a wide berth. Even tax collectors.

877.name: Masquerade Ball
877.keywordsHTML: Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
877.ability:
Doomed.
Scenario: Progress whenever you play an Aristocrat on your side of the battlefield.
Prologue: Spawn a Thirsty Dame in this row.
Chapter 1: Spawn and play Fangs of the Empire.
Chapter 2: Spawn and play Fangs of the Empire.
877.abilityHTML: Doomed. Scenario: Progress whenever you play an Aristocrat on your side of the battlefield. Prologue: Spawn a Thirsty Dame in this row. Chapter 1: Spawn and play Fangs of the Empire. Chapter 2: Spawn and play Fangs of the Empire.
877.flavor: Ophelie Van Moorlehem loves throwing huge galas. The fact that some attendees then disappear without a trace doesn't seem to bother anyone…

878.name: Philippe Van Moorlehem
878.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
878.ability:
Order (Ranged): Damage a unit by 1. Cooldown: 1.
If target has status, damage it by 2 instead.
878.abilityHTML: Order (Ranged): Damage a unit by 1. Cooldown: 1. If target has status, damage it by 2 instead.
878.flavor: It's said that Vincent Van Moorlehem fears only one man. It's not Emhyr var Emreis or Geralt of Rivia - it’s his own son.

879.name: Van Moorlehem's Cupbearer
879.keyword: assimilate, deploy, melee, poison, ranged, purify
879.keywordsHTML: Assimilate: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a card that is not from your starting deck. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Purify: Remove all statuses.
879.ability:
Assimilate.
Deploy (Melee): Poison a unit.
Deploy (Ranged): Purify a unit.
879.abilityHTML: Assimilate. Deploy (Melee): Poison a unit. Deploy (Ranged): Purify a unit.
879.flavor: My specialty? Tartar. Of what? Ah, that depends on the host's mood…

880.name: Van Moorlehem Hunter
880.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Lock: Status that disables a unit's abilities.
880.ability:
Deploy (Melee) Give an enemy unit Bleeding for 2 turns.
Deploy (Ranged): Lock a unit.
880.abilityHTML: Deploy (Melee) Give an enemy unit Bleeding for 2 turns. Deploy (Ranged): Lock a unit.
880.flavor: Rather than beasts, he prefers to stalk poachers. But they don't come as often anymore into the woods surrounding the palace…

881.name: Hunting Pack
881.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).
881.ability: Deploy: If enemy unit has status, Summon all copies of this unit from your deck to this row.
881.abilityHTML: Deploy: If enemy unit has status, Summon all copies of this unit from your deck to this row.
881.flavor: The hounds of the Van Moorlehems have an extraordinary sense of smell - and extremely sharp teeth.

882.name: Van Moorlehem Servant
882.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Vitality: Status that boosts this unit by 1 on its turn end. Note: Vitality turns can accumulate; 1 turn of Vitality cancels out 1 turn of Bleeding.
882.ability: Deploy: Give an allied unit Vitality with duration equal to the number of enemy units with status.
882.abilityHTML: Deploy: Give an allied unit Vitality with duration equal to the number of enemy units with status.
882.flavor: They say she's served the Moorlehems for thirty years. And she hasn't aged a day…

883.name: Thirsty Dame
883.ability: Whenever an enemy unit receives a status, boost self by 1.
883.abilityHTML: Whenever an enemy unit receives a status, boost self by 1.
883.flavor: My teeth are red? Oh, that's from the wine…

884.name: Tiger's Eye
884.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round.
884.flavor: A diamond the size of a goose egg. And worth a small country.

885.name: Collusion
885.keywordsHTML: Spawn: Add a card to the game. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round.
885.ability:
If you control a unit with the gang category:
Blindeyes - Increase all other effects by 1.
Crownsplitters - Boost an allied unit with the lowest power by 4.
Cutups - Damage an enemy unit with the highest power by 4.
Firesworn - Spawn 2 Firesworn Zealot in a random allied row.
Tidecloaks - Gain 4 Coins.
885.abilityHTML: If you control a unit with the gang category: Blindeyes - Increase all other effects by 1. Crownsplitters - Boost an allied unit with the lowest power by 4. Cutups - Damage an enemy unit with the highest power by 4. Firesworn - Spawn 2 Firesworn Zealot in a random allied row. Tidecloaks - Gain 4 Coins.
885.flavor: There's enough gold in this city for everyone. Well, at least for us.

886.name: Passiflora
886.keywordsHTML: Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round.
886.ability:
Doomed.
Scenario: Progress whenever you play a Blindeye.
Prologue: Spawn Passiflora Peaches in this row.
Chapter 1: Gain 6 Coins.
Chapter 2: Spawn Sly Seductress in this row.
886.abilityHTML: Doomed. Scenario: Progress whenever you play a Blindeye. Prologue: Spawn Passiflora Peaches in this row. Chapter 1: Gain 6 Coins. Chapter 2: Spawn Sly Seductress in this row.
886.flavor: More pilgrims come here than to the Temple of the Eternal Fire…

887.name: Saul de Navarette
887.keywordsHTML: Hoard: Trigger this ability if you possess the specified number of Coins or more.
887.ability:
Hoard 3: At the end of your turn, boost self by 1.
Hoard 6: At the end of your turn, boost self by 2 instead.
Hoard 9: At the end of your turn, boost self by 3 instead.
887.abilityHTML: Hoard 3: At the end of your turn, boost self by 1. Hoard 6: At the end of your turn, boost self by 2 instead. Hoard 9: At the end of your turn, boost self by 3 instead.
887.flavor: A connoisseur with bottomless pockets and a soul black as tar.

888.name: Ludovicus Brunenbaum
888.keywordsHTML: Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability.
888.ability:
After 3 turns, gain 9 Coins.
Tribute 5: Gain 9 Coins immediately.
888.abilityHTML: After 3 turns, gain 9 Coins. Tribute 5: Gain 9 Coins immediately.
888.flavor: They say he'd sell his own mother. But no one was buying.

889.name: Bloody Good Friends
889.keywordsHTML: Insanity: If you have insufficient Coins, damage this unit by its Fee amount, ignoring its Armor, to trigger its Fee ability.\nNote: Insanity cannot be used if it would destroy the unit and works only if damage is inflicted. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor.
889.ability:
Insanity.
Fee 1: Give an enemy unit Bleeding for 1 turn. If it's boosted, damage it by 1 instead.
889.abilityHTML: Insanity. Fee 1: Give an enemy unit Bleeding for 1 turn. If it's boosted, damage it by 1 instead.
889.flavor: I'll kill you as soon as we kill them!

890.name: Street Urchins
890.keywordsHTML: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins.
890.abilityHTML: Profit: 3. Fee 1: Boost self by 1.
890.flavor: When I was five, I stole candy. Now I'm six and I work in robbery.

891.name: Payroll Specialist
891.keywordsHTML: Intimidate: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a Crime card. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability.
891.ability:
Intimidate.
Tribute 1: Move a unit to the other row.
891.abilityHTML: Intimidate. Tribute 1: Move a unit to the other row.
891.flavor: Guards in Novigrad work for very little money, yet live like kings. Just another paradox of the Free City…

892.name: Passiflora Peaches
892.keywordsHTML: Hoard: Trigger this ability if you possess the specified number of Coins or more.
892.ability: Hoard 4: At the end of your turn, boost self by 1.
892.abilityHTML: Hoard 4: At the end of your turn, boost self by 1.
892.flavor: They'll mess with your head, break your heart and empty your purse.

893.name: Scarab
893.keywordsHTML: Defender: Status that prevents the opponent from targeting other cards in this row. Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield.
893.flavor: In Zerrikania, they’re considered a symbol of resurrection. But to be born again, first you have to die.

894.name: Savolla's Frightener
894.keywordsHTML: Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield.
894.flavor: The witchers thought the Salamandra thugs wouldn't get through Kaer Morhen's walls. The witchers were wrong.

895.name: Greater Brothers
895.keywordsHTML: Insanity: If you have insufficient Coins, damage this unit by its Fee amount, ignoring its Armor, to trigger its Fee ability.\nNote: Insanity cannot be used if it would destroy the unit and works only if damage is inflicted. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power. Exposed: Trigger this ability whenever the unit loses its Armor.
895.ability:
Insanity.
Fee 2: Gain 2 Armor.
Exposed: Destroy self.
895.abilityHTML: Insanity. Fee 2: Gain 2 Armor. Exposed: Destroy self.
895.flavor: A battering ram? No need, we'll handle it another way.

896.name: Lamp Djinn
896.flavor: I lived in a bottle once, but I prefer Ofiri lamps, they're much more comfortable.

897.name: Rat
897.keywordsHTML: Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield.
897.flavor: I call the tiny one Yersinia. She's cute, isn't she?

898.name: Crow
898.keywordsHTML: Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield.
898.flavor: When among crows, you must caw like they do.

899.name: Desert Treasure
899.keywordsHTML: Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
899.ability:
Doomed. Zeal.
Order: Spawn and play a random legendary unit from any faction.
899.abilityHTML: Doomed. Zeal. Order: Spawn and play a random legendary unit from any faction.
899.flavor: I definitely prefer digging up treasure to burying it.

900.name: Overwhelming Hunger
900.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges.
900.ability:
Order: Destroy an allied unit, then Spawn an Ekimmara in its row and boost it by the destroyed unit's power.
Charge: 2.

This ability adds 15 provisions to your deck's provision limit.
900.abilityHTML: Order: Destroy an allied unit, then Spawn an Ekimmara in its row and boost it by the destroyed unit's power. Charge: 2. This ability adds 15 provisions to your deck's provision limit.

901.name: Imposter
901.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Lock: Status that disables a unit's abilities. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
901.ability:
Order: Lock an enemy unit, then Spawn its base copy in the opposite row and boost it by the number of enemy units with a status on the Locked unit's row.

This ability adds 15 provisions to your deck's provision limit.
901.abilityHTML: Order: Lock an enemy unit, then Spawn its base copy in the opposite row and boost it by the number of enemy units with a status on the Locked unit's row. This ability adds 15 provisions to your deck's provision limit.

902.name: Uprising
902.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
902.ability:
Order: Boost an allied unit by 1. Charge: 3
Once all Charges are used up, Spawn and play Lyrian Scytheman.

This ability adds 14 provisions to your deck's provision limit.
902.abilityHTML: Order: Boost an allied unit by 1. Charge: 3 Once all Charges are used up, Spawn and play Lyrian Scytheman. This ability adds 14 provisions to your deck's provision limit.

903.name: Mahakam Forge
903.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
903.ability:
Order: Spawn and play Tempering.
All Dwarves in your starting deck get 1 Armor.

This ability adds 16 provisions to your deck's provision limit.
903.abilityHTML: Order: Spawn and play Tempering. All Dwarves in your starting deck get 1 Armor. This ability adds 16 provisions to your deck's provision limit.

904.name: Blaze of Glory
904.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
904.ability:
Order: Move a Skellige unit from your deck to your graveyard, then damage an enemy unit by its power.

This ability adds 16 provisions to your deck's provision limit.
904.abilityHTML: Order: Move a Skellige unit from your deck to your graveyard, then damage an enemy unit by its power. This ability adds 16 provisions to your deck's provision limit.

905.name: Hidden Cache
905.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round. Hoard: Trigger this ability if you possess the specified number of Coins or more.
905.ability:
Order: Gain 3 Coins.
At the beginning of the round, refresh this ability.
Your Hoards require 2 less Coins to trigger.

This ability adds 14 provisions to your deck's provision limit.
905.abilityHTML: Order: Gain 3 Coins. At the beginning of the round, refresh this ability. Your Hoards require 2 less Coins to trigger. This ability adds 14 provisions to your deck's provision limit.

906.name: Master Mirror
906.keywordsHTML: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
906.ability:
Veil.
Deploy: Transform the leftmost card in your hand into a random legendary card from your faction that was not in your starting deck.
Repeat this ability whenever you play the rightmost card from your hand.
906.abilityHTML: Veil. Deploy: Transform the leftmost card in your hand into a random legendary card from your faction that was not in your starting deck. Repeat this ability whenever you play the rightmost card from your hand.
906.flavor: Some figures prefer to always remain hidden while playing the role of shadow in the most crucial events in history. One figure especially, to be precise.

907.name: Ethereal
907.keywordsHTML: Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
907.ability:
Doomed.
Deploy: Gain Zeal.
Order: Transform unit to the right into base copy of self.
907.abilityHTML: Doomed. Deploy: Gain Zeal. Order: Transform unit to the right into base copy of self.
907.flavor: Her worst nightmare can easily be yours too.

908.name: Oneiromancy
908.keywordsHTML: Echo: At the beginning of the round, move this card from the graveyard to the top of its owner's deck. Give it Doomed.
908.ability:
Echo.
Play any card from your deck.
908.abilityHTML: Echo. Play any card from your deck.
908.flavor: Deciphering the past and the future as they appear in dreams is very difficult, even for a master.

909.name: Siegfried of Denesle
909.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Purify: Remove all statuses.
909.abilityHTML: Deploy: Purify all other units.
909.flavor: We're on the same side, witcher. You'll realize this one day.

910.name: Allgod
910.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
910.ability: Deploy: Boost 3 units in your deck by 2.
910.abilityHTML: Deploy: Boost 3 units in your deck by 2.
910.flavor: Make your sacrifices or face divine anger! The food better be good or prepare to face my wrath nonetheless.

911.name: Marlene de Trastamara
911.keywordsHTML: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
911.ability:
Veil.
Order: Give a unit Veil.
911.abilityHTML: Veil. Order: Give a unit Veil.
911.flavor: None shall sit and dine with you at your table, no spoon you have shall sate you, never again shall you wish to spy your reflection in the mirror.

912.name: Pact
912.keywordsHTML: Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield.
912.ability: Boost a unit by 6 and give it Doomed.
912.abilityHTML: Boost a unit by 6 and give it Doomed.
912.flavor: Your wishes he grants, as he swears to adore you – Gold, silver, jewels... he lays riches before you – Dues need be repaid, and he will come for you – All to reclaim, no smile to console you!

913.name: Will o' the wisp
913.keywordsHTML: Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield.
913.flavor: Fool's fires... those little shiny thingies that shall lead thee to certain doom.

914.name: Squirrel
914.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Banish: Remove from the game. Note: Does not count as being destroyed.
914.ability: Deploy: Banish a card from your opponent's graveyard.
914.abilityHTML: Deploy: Banish a card from your opponent's graveyard.
914.flavor: Just one badass squirrel. Nothing less, nothing more.

915.name: Offering
915.keywordsHTML: Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit. Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield.
915.ability:
Damage a unit by 1.
Deathblow: Play a bronze unit from your graveyard and give it Doomed.
915.abilityHTML: Damage a unit by 1. Deathblow: Play a bronze unit from your graveyard and give it Doomed.
915.flavor: Both gods and demons alike can be appeased by a plentiful sacrifice.

916.name: Fortune Teller
916.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses.
916.ability:
Deploy (Melee): Give Doomed to a unit.
Deploy (Ranged): Give Veil to a unit.
916.abilityHTML: Deploy (Melee): Give Doomed to a unit. Deploy (Ranged): Give Veil to a unit.
916.flavor: Her prophecies have never been wrong – mainly because she always predicts something bad to happen.

917.name: Auberon King
917.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
917.ability:
Deploy: Spawn and play a random bronze Wild Hunt unit.
At the start of round, while in hand or deck, transform.
917.abilityHTML: Deploy: Spawn and play a random bronze Wild Hunt unit. At the start of round, while in hand or deck, transform.
917.flavor: The end of one world can be the beginning of another.

918.name: Auberon Invader
918.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Create: Spawn one of three randomly selected cards from the specified source. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
918.ability:
Deploy: Create and play a bronze Wild Hunt unit.
Devotion: At the start of round, while in hand or deck, transform.
918.abilityHTML: Deploy: Create and play a bronze Wild Hunt unit. Devotion: At the start of round, while in hand or deck, transform.
918.flavor: If they will not submit, they shall be driven out!

919.name: Auberon Conqueror
919.keywordsHTML: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Create: Spawn one of three randomly selected cards from the specified source.
919.ability:
Veil. Deploy: Create and play a bronze Wild Hunt unit.
Whenever you play a Wild Hunt unit, boost it by 1.
919.abilityHTML: Veil. Deploy: Create and play a bronze Wild Hunt unit. Whenever you play a Wild Hunt unit, boost it by 1.
919.flavor: After having lived over six hundred and fifty years, little remains to excite.

920.name: Eredin Bréacc Glas
920.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Frost: At the start of the owner's turn, damage the highest power unit in this row by 2. Dominance: Trigger this ability if you control the highest unit on the battlefield.
920.ability:
Deploy: Spawn Frost on an enemy row for 2 turns.
Dominance: Increase damage dealt by Frost by 1
920.abilityHTML: Deploy: Spawn Frost on an enemy row for 2 turns. Dominance: Increase damage dealt by Frost by 1

921.name: Ard Gaeth
921.keywordsHTML: Echo: At the beginning of the round, move this card from the graveyard to the top of its owner's deck. Give it Doomed. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Frost: At the start of the owner's turn, damage the highest power unit in this row by 2.
921.ability:
Echo.
Spawn Frost on both enemy rows for 3 turns.
921.abilityHTML: Echo. Spawn Frost on both enemy rows for 3 turns.
921.flavor: Very useful for travels to other dimensions and bringing apocalypse upon the world.

922.name: Winter Queen
922.keywordsHTML: Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards. Thrive: Boost this unit by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a unit with higher power. Frost: At the start of the owner's turn, damage the highest power unit in this row by 2. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played). Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
922.ability:
Devotion: Thrive.
At the end of your turn, if there is Frost on both enemy rows, Summon this unit from your deck to the Ranged row.
922.abilityHTML: Devotion: Thrive. At the end of your turn, if there is Frost on both enemy rows, Summon this unit from your deck to the Ranged row.
922.flavor: Truth is but a shard of ice.

923.name: The Apiarian Phantom
923.keywordsHTML: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
923.ability:
Veil. Zeal.
Order (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 3.
At the end of your turn, if Order is not used, boost self by 1.
923.abilityHTML: Veil. Zeal. Order (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 3. At the end of your turn, if Order is not used, boost self by 1.
923.flavor: Who's a good boy? Well, surely not him.

924.name: Red Riders
924.keywordsHTML: Spawn: Add a card to the game. Frost: At the start of the owner's turn, damage the highest power unit in this row by 2.
924.ability:
Choose one:
Spawn Frost on an enemy row for 4 turns.
Spawn Frost on both enemy rows for 2 turns.
924.abilityHTML: Choose one: Spawn Frost on an enemy row for 4 turns. Spawn Frost on both enemy rows for 2 turns.
924.flavor: They paint the sky with snow and the earth with fire.

925.name: Wild Hunt Bruiser
925.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Frost: At the start of the owner's turn, damage the highest power unit in this row by 2.
925.ability: Deploy: Move an enemy unit to the other row. If the target moves to a row affected by Frost, damage it by 2.
925.abilityHTML: Deploy: Move an enemy unit to the other row. If the target moves to a row affected by Frost, damage it by 2.
925.flavor: He considers it an excellent joke - to split the skulls of the living with the skulls of the dead.

926.name: Naglfar's Crew
926.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Frost: At the start of the owner's turn, damage the highest power unit in this row by 2.
926.ability:
Deploy: Spawn Frost for 2 turns on an enemy row.
At the end of your turn, if there is Frost on the opposite row, boost self by 1.
926.abilityHTML: Deploy: Spawn Frost for 2 turns on an enemy row. At the end of your turn, if there is Frost on the opposite row, boost self by 1.
926.flavor: Humans don’t know what powers the Naglfar. What is the source of its magic? For those that discover the truth... Well, it’s already too late for them.

927.name: Naglfar's Taskmaster
927.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Purify: Remove all statuses. Dominance: Trigger this ability if you control the highest unit on the battlefield.
927.ability:
Deploy: Purify an enemy unit.
Dominance: Purify a unit instead.
927.abilityHTML: Deploy: Purify an enemy unit. Dominance: Purify a unit instead.
927.flavor: She ensures the ship is sustained by squeezing the life essence from those insignificant human vermin.

928.name: Aen Elle Conqueror
928.keywordsHTML: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
928.ability:
Veil.
Deploy: Destroy self.
Devotion: Cancel the Deploy ability.
928.abilityHTML: Veil. Deploy: Destroy self. Devotion: Cancel the Deploy ability.
928.flavor: For his noble kind morality is but a whim enjoyed by others. More specifically, those who lose.

929.name: Harald an Craite
929.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield.
929.ability:
Deploy: Play a bronze Warrior from your graveyard, give it Doomed and damage self by 2.
At the start of round, while in hand or deck, transform.
929.abilityHTML: Deploy: Play a bronze Warrior from your graveyard, give it Doomed and damage self by 2. At the start of round, while in hand or deck, transform.
929.flavor: His battle with the bear made him a different man, no doubt. But many argue if for the better.

930.name: Harald Warmonger
930.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
930.ability:
Deploy: Play a bronze Warrior from your graveyard and give it Doomed.
Devotion: At the start of round, while in hand or deck, transform.
930.abilityHTML: Deploy: Play a bronze Warrior from your graveyard and give it Doomed. Devotion: At the start of round, while in hand or deck, transform.
930.flavor: The grit of constant suffering had festered in him an unstoppable thirst for inflicting the same pain onto others.

931.name: Harald the Cripple
931.keywordsHTML: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield.
931.ability:
Veil.
Deploy: Play a bronze Warrior from your graveyard and give it Doomed.
Whenever you play a Warrior, damage a random enemy unit by 1.
931.abilityHTML: Veil. Deploy: Play a bronze Warrior from your graveyard and give it Doomed. Whenever you play a Warrior, damage a random enemy unit by 1.
931.flavor: He did not stop until the islands were his and the head of the old jarl lay on the ground before him.

932.name: Tyrggvi Tuirseach
932.keywordsHTML: Veteran: At the start of the second and third round, increase the base power of this unit by 1. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Rupture: At the end of owner's turn, damage this unit equal to its base power, then remove this status.
932.ability:
Veteran.
Deploy: Give an enemy unit Rupture.
932.abilityHTML: Veteran. Deploy: Give an enemy unit Rupture.
932.flavor: It’s not betrayal if you side with the winner.

933.name: Blood Eagle
933.keywordsHTML: Echo: At the beginning of the round, move this card from the graveyard to the top of its owner's deck. Give it Doomed. Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit. Bloodthirst: Number of damaged enemy units required to trigger this ability.
933.ability:
Echo.
Damage an enemy unit by 2 then play a Warrior from your deck with a provision cost of 7 or less.
Deathblow: Play a Warrior from your deck instead.
Bloodthirst 3: Always trigger the Deathblow ability.
933.abilityHTML: Echo. Damage an enemy unit by 2 then play a Warrior from your deck with a provision cost of 7 or less. Deathblow: Play a Warrior from your deck instead. Bloodthirst 3: Always trigger the Deathblow ability.
933.flavor: Fly like an eagle – Let my spirit carry me – I want to fly like an eagle.

934.name: Skjordal Drummond
934.keywordsHTML: Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards. Veteran: At the start of the second and third round, increase the base power of this unit by 1. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
934.ability:
Devotion: Veteran.
Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by Skjordal's base power.
934.abilityHTML: Devotion: Veteran. Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by Skjordal's base power.
934.flavor: He believed in honor, and that became his undoing.

935.name: Herkja Drummond
935.keywordsHTML: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
935.ability:
Veil. Zeal.
Order (Melee): Split 3 damage randomly between enemy units on a row.
At the end of your turn, if Order is not used, damage a random enemy unit by 1.
935.abilityHTML: Veil. Zeal. Order (Melee): Split 3 damage randomly between enemy units on a row. At the end of your turn, if Order is not used, damage a random enemy unit by 1.
935.flavor: Faithful to her clan and its jarl, her father – to the very end.

936.name: War of Clans
936.keywordsHTML: Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit. Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
936.ability:
Damage an enemy unit by 2.
Deathblow: Play a 4 provision cost Warrior from your graveyard and give it Doomed.
Devotion: Always trigger the Deathblow ability.
936.abilityHTML: Damage an enemy unit by 2. Deathblow: Play a 4 provision cost Warrior from your graveyard and give it Doomed. Devotion: Always trigger the Deathblow ability.
936.flavor: Brother against brother, sister against sister. One blood that soaks up the ground.

937.name: Tuirseach Invader
937.keywordsHTML: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Veteran: At the start of the second and third round, increase the base power of this unit by 1.
937.flavor: Mother of four, ya sayeth? Well, then she shouldst been smarter than running 'round with an axe.

938.name: An Craite Raiders
938.keywordsHTML: Veteran: At the start of the second and third round, increase the base power of this unit by 1. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Bloodthirst: Number of damaged enemy units required to trigger this ability. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
938.ability:
Veteran.
Deploy, Bloodthirst 3: Gain Zeal.
Order: Damage a unit by 2.
938.abilityHTML: Veteran. Deploy, Bloodthirst 3: Gain Zeal. Order: Damage a unit by 2.
938.flavor: Cabbage, really? It’s just the worst when there’s nothing good to plunder.

939.name: Drummond Villager
939.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor.
939.ability: Deploy: Give Bleeding (4) to the unit to the right, then give Bleeding (4) to an enemy unit.
939.abilityHTML: Deploy: Give Bleeding (4) to the unit to the right, then give Bleeding (4) to an enemy unit.
939.flavor: The lovely jointress, mother of four, wondrous cook, and last but not least – a fierce warrior.

940.name: Drummond Berserker
940.keywordsHTML: Berserk: Trigger this ability whenever power is equal to or lower than the specified amount.
940.ability:
At the end of your turn, damage self and a random enemy unit by 1. 
Berserk 3: Transform into a Bear Abomination.
940.abilityHTML: At the end of your turn, damage self and a random enemy unit by 1. Berserk 3: Transform into a Bear Abomination.

941.name: Jacques Miraculous Child
941.keywordsHTML: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
941.ability:
Profit 4.
Tribute 4: Spawn 2 Firesworn Zealots in this row.
At the start of round, while in hand or deck, transform.
941.abilityHTML: Profit 4. Tribute 4: Spawn 2 Firesworn Zealots in this row. At the start of round, while in hand or deck, transform.
941.flavor: As a child he loved two things: playing with his toy soldiers and a game called “Kill the Elf”.

942.name: Jacques de Aldersberg
942.keywordsHTML: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
942.ability:
Profit 4.
Tribute 4: Spawn 2 Flaming Rose Footmen in this row.
Fee 1: Boost self by 1.
Devotion: At the start of round, while in hand or deck, transform.
942.abilityHTML: Profit 4. Tribute 4: Spawn 2 Flaming Rose Footmen in this row. Fee 1: Boost self by 1. Devotion: At the start of round, while in hand or deck, transform.
942.flavor: His visions both terrified Jacques and made him determined to become stronger.

943.name: Jacques Grand Master
943.keyword: veil, profit, tribute, spawn, fee, coin
943.keywordsHTML: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round.
943.ability:
Veil. Profit 4.
Tribute 4: Spawn 2 Flaming Rose Footmen in this row.
Fee 1: Boost self by 1.
Whenever you play a Firesworn card, gain 1 Coin.
943.abilityHTML: Veil. Profit 4. Tribute 4: Spawn 2 Flaming Rose Footmen in this row. Fee 1: Boost self by 1. Whenever you play a Firesworn card, gain 1 Coin.
943.flavor: The Grand Master did not hesitate to try anything that could save everything.

944.name: Ulrich
944.keywordsHTML: Intimidate: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a Crime card. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
944.ability:
Intimidate. 
Deploy: Spawn and play a base copy of a bronze Firesworn unit from your hand.
Devotion: Boost it by 2.
944.abilityHTML: Intimidate. Deploy: Spawn and play a base copy of a bronze Firesworn unit from your hand. Devotion: Boost it by 2.
944.flavor: When the Order was disbanded, those who didn't join the witch hunters formed the Fallen Knights, of which Ulrich became the Grand Master.

945.name: Dies Irae
945.keywordsHTML: Echo: At the beginning of the round, move this card from the graveyard to the top of its owner's deck. Give it Doomed. Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit.
945.ability:
Echo.
Damage an enemy unit by 3 and boost all allied Firesworn units by 1.
Deathblow: Boost all allied units instead.
945.abilityHTML: Echo. Damage an enemy unit by 3 and boost all allied Firesworn units by 1. Deathblow: Boost all allied units instead.
945.flavor: The righteous wrath of the Eternal Fire! Justice of the Flaming Rose!

946.name: Roderick de Wett
946.keyword: veil, zeal, order, melee, spawn, coin
946.keywordsHTML: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round.
946.ability:
Veil. Zeal.
Order (Melee): Spawn a Flaming Rose Footman in this row.
At the end of your turn, if Order is not used, gain 1 Coin.
946.abilityHTML: Veil. Zeal. Order (Melee): Spawn a Flaming Rose Footman in this row. At the end of your turn, if Order is not used, gain 1 Coin.
946.flavor: Count de Wett is exceptionally loathsome and arrogant, but at least he enjoys a little dice poker on the side.

947.name: Lieutenant Von Herst
947.keywordsHTML: Hoard: Trigger this ability if you possess the specified number of Coins or more. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins.
947.ability:
Hoard 4: At the end of your turn, Spawn a Firesworn Zealot in this row.
Fee 1: Transform a Firesworn Zealot into a Flaming Rose Footman.
947.abilityHTML: Hoard 4: At the end of your turn, Spawn a Firesworn Zealot in this row. Fee 1: Transform a Firesworn Zealot into a Flaming Rose Footman.
947.flavor: The fall of the Order wasn’t so hard for him like for the others. He is still required to count the goods and manage supplies, only now it has become even easier… Less strict at least.

948.name: Smuggle
948.keywordsHTML: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
948.ability:
Profit 3.
Spawn a Flaming Rose Footman in an allied row.
948.abilityHTML: Profit 3. Spawn a Flaming Rose Footman in an allied row.
948.flavor: Whoever said that the dead are good for nothing? They make for such great smuggle-bags.

949.name: Cleric of the Flaming Rose
949.keywordsHTML: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins.
949.ability:
Profit 2.
Tribute 2: Spawn a Firesworn Zealot in this row.
Fee 1: Transform a Firesworn Zealot into a Flaming Rose Footman.
949.abilityHTML: Profit 2. Tribute 2: Spawn a Firesworn Zealot in this row. Fee 1: Transform a Firesworn Zealot into a Flaming Rose Footman.
949.flavor: We have two eyes, two ears, but only one tongue, so that we would look and listen twice more than we speak.

950.name: Fallen Knight
950.keywordsHTML: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Intimidate: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a Crime card. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
950.ability:
Veil. Intimidate.
Whenever you Spawn a unit on your side of the battlefield, boost self by 1 for each unit Spawned.
950.abilityHTML: Veil. Intimidate. Whenever you Spawn a unit on your side of the battlefield, boost self by 1 for each unit Spawned.
950.flavor: He abandoned the righteous fight and the flame in him has long gone.

951.name: Lonely Champion
951.keywordsHTML: Immunity: Status whereby this card cannot be manually targeted. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
951.ability:
Immunity.
Deploy: Destroy all Firesworn Tokens in this row, then boost self by the sum of their power.
951.abilityHTML: Immunity. Deploy: Destroy all Firesworn Tokens in this row, then boost self by the sum of their power.
951.flavor: So long as he continues the righteous fight, the Order and its flame endure.

952.name: Mutants Maker
952.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
952.ability:
Deploy: Destroy an allied unit, then gain 3 Coins.
Devotion: Gain 3 Coins instead.
952.abilityHTML: Deploy: Destroy an allied unit, then gain 3 Coins. Devotion: Gain 3 Coins instead.
952.flavor: I’m a scientist, truly. I can’t help it if the Oxenfurt professors were just too narrow-sighted to appreciate my particular research methods.

953.name: Flaming Rose Footman
953.keywordsHTML: Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield.
953.flavor: Anyone can join The Order – a knight, a peasant, even a witcher.

954.name: Viraxas Prince
954.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
954.ability:
Order: Reset an allied Northern Realms unit's Order ability.
At the start of round, while in hand or deck, transform.
954.abilityHTML: Order: Reset an allied Northern Realms unit's Order ability. At the start of round, while in hand or deck, transform.
954.flavor: Parents often envy their children's strength and vigor. And children rarely notice it.

955.name: Viraxas Outcast
955.keywordsHTML: Formation: If played on the melee row, gain Zeal. If played on the ranged row, boost self by 1. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
955.ability:
Formation.
Order: Reset an allied Northern Realms unit's Order ability and give it Zeal.
Devotion: At the start of round, while in hand or deck, transform.
955.abilityHTML: Formation. Order: Reset an allied Northern Realms unit's Order ability and give it Zeal. Devotion: At the start of round, while in hand or deck, transform.
955.flavor: He was banished just for being what Belohun couldn’t be anymore: young, vital, and strong.

956.name: Viraxas King
956.keywordsHTML: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Formation: If played on the melee row, gain Zeal. If played on the ranged row, boost self by 1. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield.
956.ability:
Veil. Formation.
Order: Reset an allied Northern Realms unit's Order ability and give it Zeal.
Whenever you play a Soldier, boost it by 1.
956.abilityHTML: Veil. Formation. Order: Reset an allied Northern Realms unit's Order ability and give it Zeal. Whenever you play a Soldier, boost it by 1.
956.flavor: Revenge is a dish that tastes best when served for two.

957.name: Ildiko
957.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield.
957.ability:
Order: Boost an allied unit by 4.
Whenever you play a Northern Realms unit, give it Zeal.
957.abilityHTML: Order: Boost an allied unit by 4. Whenever you play a Northern Realms unit, give it Zeal.
957.flavor: The necklace was Ildiko’s gift to king Belohun in honor of their impending marriage. By choking the old fool, it solved that problem quite nicely.

958.name: Amphibious Assault
958.keywordsHTML: Echo: At the beginning of the round, move this card from the graveyard to the top of its owner's deck. Give it Doomed.
958.ability:
Echo.
Play a Northern Realms unit from your deck with a provision cost of 9 or less. Boost it by 1 for each provision below the limit.
958.abilityHTML: Echo. Play a Northern Realms unit from your deck with a provision cost of 9 or less. Boost it by 1 for each provision below the limit.
958.flavor: One ship here, one ship there, and the kingdom will be ours!

959.name: King Belohun
959.keywordsHTML: Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
959.ability:
Whenever you play a unit with power less than 4, set its power to 4.
Devotion: Increase the power limit to 5.
959.abilityHTML: Whenever you play a unit with power less than 4, set its power to 4. Devotion: Increase the power limit to 5.
959.flavor: The king, quite rightly, didn’t trust anyone. He also didn’t believe anybody capable of outsmarting him. This proved a fatal assumption.

960.name: Egmund
960.keywordsHTML: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
960.ability:
Veil. Zeal.
Order (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 3.
At the end of your turn, if Order is not used, boost the unit to the right by 1.
960.abilityHTML: Veil. Zeal. Order (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 3. At the end of your turn, if Order is not used, boost the unit to the right by 1.
960.flavor: Since father has never appreciated nor trusted Egmund, it was but a simple decision to betray him.

961.name: Smoke them out!
961.keywordsHTML: Spawn: Add a card to the game.
961.ability:
Spawn 2 Volunteers on an allied row. 
If you control a boosted unit, also boost Spawned Volunteers by 1.
961.abilityHTML: Spawn 2 Volunteers on an allied row. If you control a boosted unit, also boost Spawned Volunteers by 1.
961.flavor: Fight fire with fire, fight people with fire, fight non-humans with fire... Basically it’s best to fight everything with fire!

962.name: Kerack Frigate
962.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Crew: Trigger this ability if this unit is between two Soldiers.
962.ability:
Order: Spawn a Volunteer in this row.
Crew: At the end of your turn, refresh this ability.
962.abilityHTML: Order: Spawn a Volunteer in this row. Crew: At the end of your turn, refresh this ability.
962.flavor: “I should buy a boat”, said a Kerackian cat once. Or so claims the drunken ballad.

963.name: Kerack City Guard
963.keywordsHTML: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
963.ability:
Veil.
Order: Move an enemy unit to the other row.
At the end of your turn, if Order is not used, boost self by 1.
963.abilityHTML: Veil. Order: Move an enemy unit to the other row. At the end of your turn, if Order is not used, boost self by 1.
963.flavor: Geralt thought there were no ugly women, but in the guardhouse of Kerack he felt compelled to revise this view.

964.name: Kerack Marine
964.keywordsHTML: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
964.ability:
Zeal. Order: Boost an allied unit by 2.
Devotion: Boost an allied unit by 4 instead.
964.abilityHTML: Zeal. Order: Boost an allied unit by 2. Devotion: Boost an allied unit by 4 instead.
964.flavor: I spy with my little eye something that is… green. Oh, shite! That’s a dryad!

965.name: Kerack Cutthroat
965.keywordsHTML: Formation: If played on the melee row, gain Zeal. If played on the ranged row, boost self by 1. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor.
965.ability:
Formation.
Order: Give an enemy unit Bleeding (3).
965.abilityHTML: Formation. Order: Give an enemy unit Bleeding (3).
965.flavor: He massacred that poor dryad’s body to the point that even her own mother would no longer be able to recognize it.

966.name: Volunteer
966.keywordsHTML: Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield.
966.flavor: For joining the army you shall receive no greater reward than the glory of the battle itself. And gold. Gold is great too.

967.name: Usurper Officer
967.keyword: deploy, spawn, spying, zeal, order, seize
967.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Spying: Status with no additional effect. Can be used by other cards and abilities. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Seize: Move an enemy unit to the opposite row and give it Spying. If it already had Spying, remove Spying instead.
967.ability:
Deploy: Spawn an Operative in an enemy row and give it Spying.
Zeal. Order: Seize all Spying Operatives.
At the start of round, while in hand or deck, transform.
967.abilityHTML: Deploy: Spawn an Operative in an enemy row and give it Spying. Zeal. Order: Seize all Spying Operatives. At the start of round, while in hand or deck, transform.
967.flavor: He was an ordinary soldier until his mind was open to the madness around him.

968.name: Usurper General
968.keyword: deploy, spawn, spying, zeal, order, seize, devotion
968.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Spying: Status with no additional effect. Can be used by other cards and abilities. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Seize: Move an enemy unit to the opposite row and give it Spying. If it already had Spying, remove Spying instead. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
968.ability:
Deploy: Spawn an Operative in each enemy row and give them Spying.
Zeal. Order: Seize all Spying Operatives.
Devotion: At the start of round, while in hand or deck, transform.
968.abilityHTML: Deploy: Spawn an Operative in each enemy row and give them Spying. Zeal. Order: Seize all Spying Operatives. Devotion: At the start of round, while in hand or deck, transform.
968.flavor: The general had a great talent for transforming idiotic orders into brilliantly executed maneuvers.

969.name: Usurper Emperor
969.keyword: veil, deploy, spawn, spying, zeal, order, seize
969.keywordsHTML: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Spying: Status with no additional effect. Can be used by other cards and abilities. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Seize: Move an enemy unit to the opposite row and give it Spying. If it already had Spying, remove Spying instead.
969.ability:
Veil.
Deploy: Spawn an Operative in each enemy row and give them Spying.
Zeal. Order: Seize all Spying Operatives.
Whenever you play an Agent, boost self by 1.
969.abilityHTML: Veil. Deploy: Spawn an Operative in each enemy row and give them Spying. Zeal. Order: Seize all Spying Operatives. Whenever you play an Agent, boost self by 1.
969.flavor: There were but two options: wash the blood born of foolish orders or wash the blood of the fool himself. A simple decision really.

970.name: Braathens
970.keywordsHTML: Assimilate: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a card that is not from your starting deck. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Create: Spawn one of three randomly selected cards from the specified source. Disloyal: This card is played on the opposite side of the battlefield, then gains Spying.
970.ability:
Assimilate.
Deploy: Create and play a bronze Disloyal unit from your starting deck.
970.abilityHTML: Assimilate. Deploy: Create and play a bronze Disloyal unit from your starting deck.
970.flavor: His name sounded so similar to “urchin” in Nilfgaardian that Braathens decided to turn him into one. Years later Emhyr paid the mage back in kind. Braathens sounds just like “fried” after all.

971.name: Coup de Grace
971.keywordsHTML: Echo: At the beginning of the round, move this card from the graveyard to the top of its owner's deck. Give it Doomed. Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Conspiracy: Trigger this ability if target unit has Spying status.
971.ability:
Echo.
Damage an enemy unit by 3.
Deathblow: Spawn and play a base copy of it.
Conspiracy: Always trigger Deathblow ability.
971.abilityHTML: Echo. Damage an enemy unit by 3. Deathblow: Spawn and play a base copy of it. Conspiracy: Always trigger Deathblow ability.
971.flavor: Sometimes death is but a simple act of mercy.

972.name: Fergus var Emreis
972.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spying: Status with no additional effect. Can be used by other cards and abilities. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
972.ability:
Deploy: Give an enemy unit Spying.
Devotion: Give 3 enemy units Spying instead.
972.abilityHTML: Deploy: Give an enemy unit Spying. Devotion: Give 3 enemy units Spying instead.
972.flavor: Usurper demanded that the fallen emperor grant legitimacy to the coup, and when Fergus refused, his 13-year-old son, Emhyr, was tortured. But that changed nothing.

973.name: Urcheon of Erlenwald
973.keywordsHTML: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield.
