Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
973.ability:
Veil. Zeal. 
Order (Melee): Transform self into Duny.
At the end of your turn, boost a random allied unit by 1.
973.abilityHTML: Veil. Zeal. Order (Melee): Transform self into Duny. At the end of your turn, boost a random allied unit by 1.
973.flavor: This is how I look, which you well knew, Calanthe. King Roegner, in telling you of the oath, would not have omitted such a detail in his tale.

974.name: Duny
974.keywordsHTML: Immunity: Status whereby this card cannot be manually targeted.
974.flavor: After the curse was lifted Duny claimed ignorance regarding its origin, or who was responsible. He was lying, of course.

975.name: Amnesty
975.keywordsHTML: Seize: Move an enemy unit to the opposite row and give it Spying. If it already had Spying, remove Spying instead. Conspiracy: Trigger this ability if target unit has Spying status. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
975.ability:
Seize an enemy unit with 3 power or less.
Conspiracy: Boost it by 2.
Devotion: Always trigger Conspiracy ability.
975.abilityHTML: Seize an enemy unit with 3 power or less. Conspiracy: Boost it by 2. Devotion: Always trigger Conspiracy ability.
975.flavor: You did what to who? To be fair, I can’t even recall the specifics anymore.

976.name: Mage Torturer
976.keywordsHTML: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Assimilate: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a card that is not from your starting deck. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spying: Status with no additional effect. Can be used by other cards and abilities.
976.ability:
Veil. Assimilate.
Deploy: Give an enemy unit Spying.
976.abilityHTML: Veil. Assimilate. Deploy: Give an enemy unit Spying.

977.name: Seditious Aristocrats
977.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spying: Status with no additional effect. Can be used by other cards and abilities.
977.ability:
Deploy: Boost self by 1 for every Spying enemy unit.
Whenever an enemy unit gains Spying, boost self by 1.
977.abilityHTML: Deploy: Boost self by 1 for every Spying enemy unit. Whenever an enemy unit gains Spying, boost self by 1.
977.flavor: They love expensive wine, horse riding, and good old backstabbing.

978.name: Mage Infiltrator
978.keywordsHTML: Disloyal: This card is played on the opposite side of the battlefield, then gains Spying. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit. Spying: Status with no additional effect. Can be used by other cards and abilities.
978.ability:
Disloyal.
Deploy: Damage adjacent units by 3.
Deathblow: Move self to the opposite row and remove Spying.
978.abilityHTML: Disloyal. Deploy: Damage adjacent units by 3. Deathblow: Move self to the opposite row and remove Spying.
978.flavor: In her spare time, she likes playing practical jokes on others. Her favorite gag is switching footwraps and headwear.

979.name: Angry Mob
979.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Conspiracy: Trigger this ability if target unit has Spying status.
979.ability:
Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2.
Conspiracy: Boost self by 2.
979.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2. Conspiracy: Boost self by 2.
979.flavor: Wanna know their secret? They are always angry.

980.name: Operative
980.keywordsHTML: Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield.
980.flavor: The tricky part isn’t getting on the roof. It’s how to get down without killing yourself.

981.name: Eithné Young Queen
981.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
981.ability:
Deploy: Spawn a Young Dryad in this row.
At the start of round, while in hand or deck, transform.
981.abilityHTML: Deploy: Spawn a Young Dryad in this row. At the start of round, while in hand or deck, transform.
981.flavor: She used to instruct her Dryads to warn people two or even three times before shooting with lethal intention. Used to anyhow.

982.name: Eithné Mother
982.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
982.ability:
Deploy: Spawn 2 Young Dryads in this row.
Devotion: At the start of round, while in hand or deck, transform.
982.abilityHTML: Deploy: Spawn 2 Young Dryads in this row. Devotion: At the start of round, while in hand or deck, transform.
982.flavor: The queen wanted to protect that which was most important - Brokilon and its children. However, it’s sometimes impossible to save everyone.

983.name: Eithné: Wrath of the Brokilon
983.keywordsHTML: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Symbiosis: Whenever you play a Nature card, Spawn a Wandering Treant in a random allied row and set its power equal to the number of units with Symbiosis you control. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
983.ability:
Veil. Symbiosis.
Deploy: Spawn 2 Young Dryads in this row.
983.abilityHTML: Veil. Symbiosis. Deploy: Spawn 2 Young Dryads in this row.
983.flavor: After the Battle of the Ribbon, Morénn's body was so massacred that even Silver-Eyed could not recognize her own daughter.

984.name: Forest Protector
984.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
984.ability: Deploy: Play a bronze Nature card from your graveyard.
984.abilityHTML: Deploy: Play a bronze Nature card from your graveyard.
984.flavor: You know today is not your day when you go searching for firewood but the wood ends up seeing you as good fertilizer instead.

985.name: Shaping Nature
985.keywordsHTML: Echo: At the beginning of the round, move this card from the graveyard to the top of its owner's deck. Give it Doomed. Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Vitality: Status that boosts this unit by 1 on its turn end. Note: Vitality turns can accumulate; 1 turn of Vitality cancels out 1 turn of Bleeding.
985.ability:
Echo.
Choose one:
Boost an allied unit by 6 and give it Veil.
Boost an allied unit by 8.
Boost an allied unit by 5 and give it Vitality (5).
985.abilityHTML: Echo. Choose one: Boost an allied unit by 6 and give it Veil. Boost an allied unit by 8. Boost an allied unit by 5 and give it Vitality (5).
985.flavor: You talk to me of kings and princes. Who are they? Those whom I know are white skeletons lying in the necropolises of Craag An, deep in the forest.

986.name: Freixenet
986.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
986.ability:
Deploy (Melee): Boost a Dryad in your hand by 2.
Deploy (Ranged): Spawn a Young Dryad in this row.
Devotion: Use both abilities.
986.abilityHTML: Deploy (Melee): Boost a Dryad in your hand by 2. Deploy (Ranged): Spawn a Young Dryad in this row. Devotion: Use both abilities.
986.flavor: He was only meant to be a breeding stud to her. But in the end, they fell in love regardless.

987.name: Dunca
987.keywordsHTML: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
987.ability:
Veil. Zeal.
Order (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 3. 
At the end of your turn, if Order is not used, boost a random Scoia'tael unit in your hand by 1.
987.abilityHTML: Veil. Zeal. Order (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 3. At the end of your turn, if Order is not used, boost a random Scoia'tael unit in your hand by 1.
987.flavor: She does no warning shot, always aims to kill. No mercy, even for the little ones.

988.name: Circle of Life
988.keywordsHTML: Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit.
988.ability:
Damage an enemy unit by 3, then boost a random Scoia'tael unit in your hand by 2.
Deathblow: Boost Scoia'tael unit in your hand instead.
988.abilityHTML: Damage an enemy unit by 3, then boost a random Scoia'tael unit in your hand by 2. Deathblow: Boost Scoia'tael unit in your hand instead.
988.flavor: Those who want to destroy Brokilon, who try to burn its trees and kill all the living things in it, will soon enough become nourishment for its soil.

989.name: Hamadryad
989.keywordsHTML: Symbiosis: Whenever you play a Nature card, Spawn a Wandering Treant in a random allied row and set its power equal to the number of units with Symbiosis you control. Vitality: Status that boosts this unit by 1 on its turn end. Note: Vitality turns can accumulate; 1 turn of Vitality cancels out 1 turn of Bleeding.
989.ability:
Symbiosis.
At the end of your turn, if this unit has Vitality, boost self by 1.
989.abilityHTML: Symbiosis. At the end of your turn, if this unit has Vitality, boost self by 1.
989.flavor: Hamadryads form a deep life-long bond with their tree – and its squirrels, of course.

990.name: Duén Canell Guardian
990.keywordsHTML: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Symbiosis: Whenever you play a Nature card, Spawn a Wandering Treant in a random allied row and set its power equal to the number of units with Symbiosis you control. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
990.ability:
Veil. Symbiosis.
Order: Damage an enemy unit by 2.
990.abilityHTML: Veil. Symbiosis. Order: Damage an enemy unit by 2.
990.flavor: You have conquered the world, d'hoine, you are everywhere, everywhere you bring with you what you call progress. But we don't want you or your progress here.

991.name: Oakcritters
991.keyword: deploy, melee, bleeding, ranged, spawn, devotion
991.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
991.ability:
Deploy (Melee): Give an enemy unit Bleeding (3).
Deploy (Ranged): Spawn a base copy of self in this row.
Devotion: Use both abilities.
991.abilityHTML: Deploy (Melee): Give an enemy unit Bleeding (3). Deploy (Ranged): Spawn a base copy of self in this row. Devotion: Use both abilities.
991.flavor: They especially like to chew on fingers, which to them are just like juicy carrots.

992.name: Abandoned Girl
992.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
992.ability: Order: Transform self into a Young Dryad without changing power.
992.abilityHTML: Order: Transform self into a Young Dryad without changing power.
992.flavor: People believe that sick girls will spread their illness among the dryads, but in reality, Brokilon protects its children. Abandoned ones, too.

993.name: Young Dryad
993.keywordsHTML: Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield. Symbiosis: Whenever you play a Nature card, Spawn a Wandering Treant in a random allied row and set its power equal to the number of units with Symbiosis you control.
993.flavor: She can share her arrows with you, but not her apple.

994.name: Wandering Treant
994.keywordsHTML: Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield.
994.flavor: I’m not wandering around, I’m roaming! Can’t you see the difference?

995.name: Shaping Nature: Veil
995.keywordsHTML: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses.
995.ability: Boost an allied unit by 6 and give it Veil.
995.abilityHTML: Boost an allied unit by 6 and give it Veil.
995.flavor: You talk to me of kings and princes. Who are they? Those whom I know are white skeletons lying in the necropolises of Craag An, deep in the forest.

996.name: Shaping Nature: Boost
996.flavor: You talk to me of kings and princes. Who are they? Those whom I know are white skeletons lying in the necropolises of Craag An, deep in the forest.

997.name: Shaping Nature: Vitality
997.keywordsHTML: Vitality: Status that boosts this unit by 1 on its turn end. Note: Vitality turns can accumulate; 1 turn of Vitality cancels out 1 turn of Bleeding.
997.ability: Boost an allied unit by 5 and give it Vitality (5).
997.abilityHTML: Boost an allied unit by 5 and give it Vitality (5).
997.flavor: You talk to me of kings and princes. Who are they? Those whom I know are white skeletons lying in the necropolises of Craag An, deep in the forest.

998.name: Red Riders: Precision
998.keywordsHTML: Spawn: Add a card to the game. Frost: At the start of the owner's turn, damage the highest power unit in this row by 2.
998.ability: Spawn Frost on an enemy row for 4 turns.
998.abilityHTML: Spawn Frost on an enemy row for 4 turns.
998.flavor: They paint the sky with snow and the earth with fire.

999.name: Red Riders: Spread
999.keywordsHTML: Spawn: Add a card to the game. Frost: At the start of the owner's turn, damage the highest power unit in this row by 2.
999.ability: Spawn Frost on both enemy rows for 2 turns.
999.abilityHTML: Spawn Frost on both enemy rows for 2 turns.
999.flavor: They paint the sky with snow and the earth with fire.

1000.name: Dana Méadbh
1000.keywordsHTML: Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield. Harmony: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a Scoia'tael unit, whose primary category is unique among all of your units.
1000.flavor: And thus she reveals herself, the Fairhaired Lady, adorned in flowers full. All life, both plant and beast, follows closely her step, clinging in earnest to her being.

1001.name: Woodland Spirit
1001.keywordsHTML: Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield.
1001.flavor: We never hunt in these woods. Not even if it means the whole village'll starve.

1002.name: Morvran Voorhis
1002.keywordsHTML: Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
1002.ability:
Doomed.
Deploy: Draw up to 3 cards, then put the same number of cards on top of your deck.
1002.abilityHTML: Doomed. Deploy: Draw up to 3 cards, then put the same number of cards on top of your deck.
1002.flavor: The summer sun reflected in the quiet waters of the Alba – that's Nilfgaard to me.

1003.name: Alzur
1003.keywordsHTML: Spawn: Add a card to the game.
1003.ability:
Whenever you play a Spell card, Spawn a random unit with the same provision cost on this row.
Counter: 3.
1003.abilityHTML: Whenever you play a Spell card, Spawn a random unit with the same provision cost on this row. Counter: 3.
1003.flavor: A rebel… outcast... knight… even sorcerer if you can believe that.

1004.name: Snowdrop
1004.keywordsHTML: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
1004.ability:
Zeal.
Order: Draw up to 2 cards, then shuffle the same number of cards back to your deck.
Whenever you draw a card, boost self by 2.
1004.abilityHTML: Zeal. Order: Draw up to 2 cards, then shuffle the same number of cards back to your deck. Whenever you draw a card, boost self by 2.
1004.flavor: There’s more to life than song and dance, probably...

1005.name: Cosimo Malaspina
1005.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
1005.ability: Deploy: Transform adjacent units into random units that cost 1 provision more.
1005.abilityHTML: Deploy: Transform adjacent units into random units that cost 1 provision more.
1005.flavor: Children keep asking him for gifts. He doesn’t know why, but it really helps with finding subjects for his experiments.

1006.name: Idarran of Ulivo
1006.keywordsHTML: Spawn: Add a card to the game. Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield.
1006.ability: The first time you Spawn a unit each turn on your side of the board, Spawn a 1-power copy of it on this row, then give it Doomed.
1006.abilityHTML: The first time you Spawn a unit each turn on your side of the board, Spawn a 1-power copy of it on this row, then give it Doomed.
1006.flavor: They say beauty is in the eye of the beholder, but no one wants to see what Idarran considers beautiful...

1007.name: Geralt: Quen
1007.keywordsHTML: Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger.
1007.ability:
Shield. 
Deploy: Play a Witcher card from your deck.
Adrenaline 3: Give it Shield.
1007.abilityHTML: Shield. Deploy: Play a Witcher card from your deck. Adrenaline 3: Give it Shield.
1007.flavor: Geralt, feeling the iron taste of blood in his mouth, shouted a spell, throwing his hand out in front of him with his fingers open in the Quen Sign.

1008.name: Selective mutation
1008.keywordsHTML: Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
1008.ability: Draw a card with Adrenaline of your choice, then shuffle back a card from your hand to your deck. Spawn a Witcher Student on each allied row.
1008.abilityHTML: Draw a card with Adrenaline of your choice, then shuffle back a card from your hand to your deck. Spawn a Witcher Student on each allied row.
1008.flavor: We can destroy what we have created, but we cannot uncreate it.

1009.name: Triangle Within a Triangle
1009.ability: Boost an ally by its provision cost or damage an enemy by its provision cost.
1009.abilityHTML: Boost an ally by its provision cost or damage an enemy by its provision cost.
1009.flavor: Adepts of magic often confuse it with a pentacle, which can lead to an infernal disaster.

1010.name: Berengar
1010.ability: At the end of your turn, destroy this card if it's the only Witcher on this row.
1010.abilityHTML: At the end of your turn, destroy this card if it's the only Witcher on this row.
1010.flavor: Talking the vodyanoi out of sacrificing the prize-winning cow wasn’t an easy task.

1011.name: Leo
1011.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
1011.ability: Deploy: Boost self by 1 for every Witcher you control.
1011.abilityHTML: Deploy: Boost self by 1 for every Witcher you control.
1011.flavor: He would have caught the arrow if he only had some heads-up.

1012.name: Maxii Van Dekkar
1012.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
1012.ability:
Deploy: Look at your deck in order from top to bottom.
You may shuffle your deck, then put a card on the bottom of it.
1012.abilityHTML: Deploy: Look at your deck in order from top to bottom. You may shuffle your deck, then put a card on the bottom of it.
1012.flavor: Magic doesn’t work on her, as she is a proud daughter of the Black Sun—and a bounty hunter that has her eyes on some very powerful sorcerers.

1013.name: Witcher Student
1013.keywordsHTML: Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield.
1013.flavor: Four out of ten boys survive… at most.

1015.name: Blue Mutagen
1015.keywordsHTML: Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round.
1015.ability: Poison an allied unit and gain 5 Coins.
1015.abilityHTML: Poison an allied unit and gain 5 Coins.

1016.name: Green Mutagen
1016.keywordsHTML: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses.
1016.ability: Boost an allied unit by 4 and give it Veil.
1016.abilityHTML: Boost an allied unit by 4 and give it Veil.
1016.flavor: I’ve a green mutagen for you.

1017.name: Ivar Evil-Eye
1017.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger.
1017.ability:
Deploy: Swap this unit's power with an enemy unit.
Adrenaline 2: Damage an enemy unit by 4 instead.
1017.abilityHTML: Deploy: Swap this unit's power with an enemy unit. Adrenaline 2: Damage an enemy unit by 4 instead.
1017.flavor: There’s a terrible tale behind each and every scar⁠—you’d be surprised just how many are true.

1018.name: Vypper
1018.keywordsHTML: Banish: Remove from the game. Note: Does not count as being destroyed. Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield. Spying: Status with no additional effect. Can be used by other cards and abilities. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).
1018.ability:
At the end of the round, put this card in the opponent's graveyard. 
At the end of your turn, while in graveyard, Banish the lowest-cost card from it.
If Vypper is the only card in the graveyard, give it Doomed and Spying, then Summon it to your opponent's random row.
1018.abilityHTML: At the end of the round, put this card in the opponent's graveyard. At the end of your turn, while in graveyard, Banish the lowest-cost card from it. If Vypper is the only card in the graveyard, give it Doomed and Spying, then Summon it to your opponent's random row.
1018.flavor: Vicious, cunning. Known to wait patiently for hours before striking their prey. Once it uncoils to strike, there is no escape. Death is inevitable. ⁠— Ivar Evil-Eye

1019.name: Gorthur Gvaed
1019.keywordsHTML: Resilience: Status that allows a unit to remain on the battlefield at the end of the round, then disappears.\nNote: Boost and Armor are not carried over to the next round. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
1019.ability:
Resilience.
Deploy: Spawn and play Viper Witcher Adept, Viper Witcher, Viper Witcher Mentor or Viper Witcher Alchemist.
Order: Move a card from your opponent's graveyard to the top of their deck.
1019.abilityHTML: Resilience. Deploy: Spawn and play Viper Witcher Adept, Viper Witcher, Viper Witcher Mentor or Viper Witcher Alchemist. Order: Move a card from your opponent's graveyard to the top of their deck.
1019.flavor: There were many scrolls and manuscripts about the legend of the Wild Hunt in the stronghold—and for a good reason.

1020.name: Kolgrim
1020.keywordsHTML: Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger.
1020.ability: Adrenaline 1: At the end of your turn, boost self by the difference between the number of cards in players' decks.
1020.abilityHTML: Adrenaline 1: At the end of your turn, boost self by the difference between the number of cards in players' decks.
1020.flavor: Fortune only smiled upon him if it was accompanied by a stroke of very bad luck.

1021.name: Warritt The All-Seeing
1021.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
1021.ability:
Deploy (Melee): Put the highest cost card in your opponent's deck on the top of it.
Deploy (Ranged): Put the lowest cost card in your opponent's deck on the top of it.
1021.abilityHTML: Deploy (Melee): Put the highest cost card in your opponent's deck on the top of it. Deploy (Ranged): Put the lowest cost card in your opponent's deck on the top of it.
1021.flavor: By slightly modifying the Supirre sign, Warritt gained the ability to see... everything.

1022.name: Viper Witcher
1022.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
1022.ability:
Deploy: Give Bleeding (2) to an enemy unit.
Adrenaline 6: If it's not a Token, Spawn a base copy of that unit at the top of opponent's deck.
1022.abilityHTML: Deploy: Give Bleeding (2) to an enemy unit. Adrenaline 6: If it's not a Token, Spawn a base copy of that unit at the top of opponent's deck.
1022.flavor: Viper Witchers are trained to fight with twin blades, often referred to as “fangs”. This style focuses on fast and furious strikes aimed to overwhelm their target, be it monster or man.

1023.name: Viper Witcher Mentor
1023.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger.
1023.ability:
Deploy: Set the power of this card to match the provision cost of the top card in your opponent's deck.
Adrenaline 2: Set the power of this card to match the provision cost of the highest-cost card in your opponent's deck instead.
1023.abilityHTML: Deploy: Set the power of this card to match the provision cost of the top card in your opponent's deck. Adrenaline 2: Set the power of this card to match the provision cost of the highest-cost card in your opponent's deck instead.
1023.flavor: Viper mentors are especially cold and ruthless in order to prepare their students for the harsh life that awaits them.

1024.name: Viper Witcher Alchemist
1024.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Reveal: Show a card to both players, then hide it back in the hand or deck.
1024.ability: Deploy (Melee): Reveal a random unit from your opponent's deck and boost self by its power.
1024.abilityHTML: Deploy (Melee): Reveal a random unit from your opponent's deck and boost self by its power.
1024.flavor: What doesn’t kill you makes you stronger. Or weaker. It depends, really.

1025.name: Viper Witcher Adept
1025.ability: At the end of your turn, boost self by 1 if your opponent has more cards in the deck than you.
1025.abilityHTML: At the end of your turn, boost self by 1 if your opponent has more cards in the deck than you.
1025.flavor: Each student is given a pet to raise during their stay at Gorthur Gvaed, in order to form a strong emotional bond throughout their training. Years later, before becoming a fully-fledged witcher, they are ordered to slaughter their companion in cold blood.

1026.name: Coated Weapons
1026.keywordsHTML: Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit. Banish: Remove from the game. Note: Does not count as being destroyed. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
1026.ability:
Damage an enemy unit by 5.
Deathblow: If it wasn't a Token, Banish it and Spawn a base copy of it on top of opponent's deck.
1026.abilityHTML: Damage an enemy unit by 5. Deathblow: If it wasn't a Token, Banish it and Spawn a base copy of it on top of opponent's deck.
1026.flavor: No need to strike deep when but a scratch will prove fatal.

1027.name: Gezras of Leyda
1027.keywordsHTML: Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger.
1027.ability:
Melee: At the end of your turn, move self to the Ranged row and boost a random allied unit on this row by 1.
Ranged: At the end of your turn, move self to the Melee row and damage a random enemy unit on the opposite row by 1.
Adrenaline 3: Instead of a random unit, affect all other units in a row.
1027.abilityHTML: Melee: At the end of your turn, move self to the Ranged row and boost a random allied unit on this row by 1. Ranged: At the end of your turn, move self to the Melee row and damage a random enemy unit on the opposite row by 1. Adrenaline 3: Instead of a random unit, affect all other units in a row.
1027.flavor: “Take a contract from Aen Seidhe over a dh'oine any day, as you’re far less likely to receive a knife between the ribs in place of coin.” ⁠— Gezras

1028.name: Saber-Tooth Tiger
1028.keywordsHTML: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
1028.ability: Zeal. Order: Transform self into Saber-Tooth Tiger: Stealth.
1028.abilityHTML: Zeal. Order: Transform self into Saber-Tooth Tiger: Stealth.
1028.flavor: The prized possession of a royal menagerie, until a commando of Scoia'tael assaulted the exhibition, released the beast, and set it upon its cruel masters. Since that day, it has acquired a selective taste for human flesh.

1029.name: Stygga Castle
1029.keywordsHTML: Resilience: Status that allows a unit to remain on the battlefield at the end of the round, then disappears.\nNote: Boost and Armor are not carried over to the next round. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
1029.ability:
Resilience.
Deploy: Spawn and play Cat Witcher Adept, Cat Witcher, Cat Witcher Mentor or Cat Witcher Saboteur.
Order: Move 3 allied units to the other row.
1029.abilityHTML: Resilience. Deploy: Spawn and play Cat Witcher Adept, Cat Witcher, Cat Witcher Mentor or Cat Witcher Saboteur. Order: Move 3 allied units to the other row.
1029.flavor: The Feline witchers did not stay in Stygga Castle for long. Nor anywhere else, actually.

1030.name: Brehen
1030.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger.
1030.ability:
Deploy: Destroy the rightmost unit on an enemy row with at least 5 units.
Adrenaline 3: Destroy the rightmost unit on an enemy row with at least 3 units instead.
1030.abilityHTML: Deploy: Destroy the rightmost unit on an enemy row with at least 5 units. Adrenaline 3: Destroy the rightmost unit on an enemy row with at least 3 units instead.
1030.flavor: Known as the Cat of Iello. A moniker earned not from origins, but as a result of slaughtering peasants there. More of a massacre, really.

1031.name: Gaetan
1031.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
1031.ability:
Deploy: Move the other cards from this row to the other row.
Damage a random enemy unit for each card moved by 1.
1031.abilityHTML: Deploy: Move the other cards from this row to the other row. Damage a random enemy unit for each card moved by 1.
1031.flavor: “Murder me just to save few crowns? I’m supposed to protect whoresons like that?” ⁠— Gaetan

1032.name: Cat Witcher
1032.keywordsHTML: Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger.
1032.ability:
At the end of your turn, move self to the other row and damage a random enemy unit on the opposite row by 1.
Adrenaline 3: Damage it by 2 instead.
1032.abilityHTML: At the end of your turn, move self to the other row and damage a random enemy unit on the opposite row by 1. Adrenaline 3: Damage it by 2 instead.
1032.flavor: Members of the School of the Cat are ill-famed due to their penchant for frenzy and bloodlust in the heat of battle. Even when their enemies capitulate, beg for mercy... Cats never stop killing.

1033.name: Cat Witcher Mentor
1033.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger.
1033.ability:
Deploy: Boost self by the number of the other cards on this row. 
Adrenaline 4: Whenever a card appears in this row, boost self by 1.
1033.abilityHTML: Deploy: Boost self by the number of the other cards on this row. Adrenaline 4: Whenever a card appears in this row, boost self by 1.
1033.flavor: If you fall, it’s over. Your nine lives are up, kid.

1034.name: Cat Witcher Saboteur
1034.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
1034.ability: Deploy: Move an enemy unit to the left-most position on its row. Damage it by 1 for every card it passed.
1034.abilityHTML: Deploy: Move an enemy unit to the left-most position on its row. Damage it by 1 for every card it passed.
1034.flavor: “Needless to say, the ill fame of their deeds hangs like a dark cloud over our reputation to this day.” ⁠— Vesemir

1035.name: Cat Witcher Adept
1035.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Vitality: Status that boosts this unit by 1 on its turn end. Note: Vitality turns can accumulate; 1 turn of Vitality cancels out 1 turn of Bleeding.
1035.ability:
Deploy (Melee): Give an enemy unit Bleeding with duration equal to the number of units on that unit's row.
Deploy (Ranged): Give an allied unit Vitality with duration equal to the number of units on that unit's row.
1035.abilityHTML: Deploy (Melee): Give an enemy unit Bleeding with duration equal to the number of units on that unit's row. Deploy (Ranged): Give an allied unit Vitality with duration equal to the number of units on that unit's row.
1035.flavor: Cat students hone their balance by walking a tightrope blindfolded. Failure is easy to shrug off at first, but throughout their training, the walk gets higher⁠—and more perilous⁠—as they work toward their final Trial, where failure is not so forgiving.

1036.name: Making a Bomb
1036.keywordsHTML: Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor.
1036.ability: Move an enemy unit to the other row, give it Bleeding (4). If it's the only unit on that row, damage it by 4 instead.
1036.abilityHTML: Move an enemy unit to the other row, give it Bleeding (4). If it's the only unit on that row, damage it by 4 instead.
1036.flavor: You’ll probably want to follow the instructions…

1037.name: Arnaghad
1037.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger.
1037.ability:
Deploy: Gain 1 Armor for every damaged unit.
Adrenaline 4: When your opponent plays a unit on their side of the battlefield, damage that unit by Arnaghad's power and damage Arnaghad by that unit's power.
1037.abilityHTML: Deploy: Gain 1 Armor for every damaged unit. Adrenaline 4: When your opponent plays a unit on their side of the battlefield, damage that unit by Arnaghad's power and damage Arnaghad by that unit's power.
1037.flavor: “A witcher’s job is to kill monsters and collect coin. No more, no less.” ⁠— Arnaghad

1038.name: Dire Bear
1038.keywordsHTML: Berserk: Trigger this ability whenever power is equal to or lower than the specified amount.
1038.ability:
Units in this and opposite row can't be boosted.
Berserk 7: Affects only the opposite row.
1038.abilityHTML: Units in this and opposite row can't be boosted. Berserk 7: Affects only the opposite row.
1038.flavor: After countless attempts to slay the savage beast, one could now easily consider it… a mobile armory.

1039.name: Haern Caduch
1039.keywordsHTML: Resilience: Status that allows a unit to remain on the battlefield at the end of the round, then disappears.\nNote: Boost and Armor are not carried over to the next round. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Heal: If a unit's current power is lower than its base power, restore it either to base power or by the amount specified.
1039.ability:
Resilience.
Deploy: Spawn and play Bear Witcher Adept, Bear Witcher, Bear Witcher Mentor or Bear Witcher Quartermaster.
Order: Heal adjacent units by 2.
1039.abilityHTML: Resilience. Deploy: Spawn and play Bear Witcher Adept, Bear Witcher, Bear Witcher Mentor or Bear Witcher Quartermaster. Order: Heal adjacent units by 2.
1039.flavor: Carved into the icy rock of the Amell Mountains, hidden amid jagged crags and snowdrifts, the location of the long-abandoned School of the Bear remains a well-kept secret.

1040.name: Gerd
1040.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger.
1040.ability:
Deploy: Spawn a Deafening Siren on the opposite row and damage all units on that row by 1.
Adrenaline 3: Spawn a Deafening Siren on the opposite row and damage it by 1 instead.
1040.abilityHTML: Deploy: Spawn a Deafening Siren on the opposite row and damage all units on that row by 1. Adrenaline 3: Spawn a Deafening Siren on the opposite row and damage it by 1 instead.
1040.flavor: He was contracted to slay a dragon, a siren, and a striga. He was also being pursued by a vengeful knight, bounty hunters, and bandits. Despite all this, he still found time for a round of Gwent.

1041.name: Junod of Belhaven
1041.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
1041.ability: Deploy: Destroy a damaged enemy unit.
1041.abilityHTML: Deploy: Destroy a damaged enemy unit.
1041.flavor: Rumour has it he was born of an unusual love between a lady giant and one VERY brave dwarf.

1042.name: Bear Witcher
1042.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger.
1042.ability:
Deploy: Damage self by 3.
Adrenaline 4: Damage self and an enemy unit by 3 instead.
1042.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage self by 3. Adrenaline 4: Damage self and an enemy unit by 3 instead.
1042.flavor: Life alone on the road can be tough⁠—be sure to bring all the bare necessities.

1043.name: Bear Witcher Mentor
1043.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger.
1043.ability:
Deploy: Boost self by 1 for every damaged allied unit.
Adrenaline 3: Boost self by 1 for every damaged unit instead.
1043.abilityHTML: Deploy: Boost self by 1 for every damaged allied unit. Adrenaline 3: Boost self by 1 for every damaged unit instead.
1043.flavor: If you’re unsure of the way, just keep a lookout for markers⁠—the frozen corpses of would-be witchers.

1044.name: Bear Witcher Quartermaster
1044.keywordsHTML: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges.
1044.ability:
Zeal.
Order: Damage an allied unit by 1, then Spawn a Witcher Student on this row.
Charges: 2.
1044.abilityHTML: Zeal. Order: Damage an allied unit by 1, then Spawn a Witcher Student on this row. Charges: 2.
1044.flavor: Supply him with enough Mahakam mead, and he might just tell you a tale of how a bear took his shield and arm too!

1045.name: Bear Witcher Adept
1045.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Heal: If a unit's current power is lower than its base power, restore it either to base power or by the amount specified. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
1045.ability:
Deploy: Damage self by 4.
At the end of your turn, Heal self by 1. While not damaged, gain 1 Armor instead.
1045.abilityHTML: Deploy: Damage self by 4. At the end of your turn, Heal self by 1. While not damaged, gain 1 Armor instead.
1045.flavor: To become a Bear Witcher, all students must pass the Trial of the Mountain. This requires venturing to the peak of Mount Gorgon to retrieve a special runestone as proof of ascent—an especially brutal challenge, as many boys freeze to death long before they find the summit.

1046.name: Armor Up
1046.keywordsHTML: Spawn: Add a card to the game. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
1046.ability:
Damage an enemy unit by 2.
Spawn 3 Witcher Students on the opposite row, damage them by 1, then give them 1 Armor.
1046.abilityHTML: Damage an enemy unit by 2. Spawn 3 Witcher Students on the opposite row, damage them by 1, then give them 1 Armor.
1046.flavor: Why try to sidestep the blow, when you can easily bear the brunt?

1047.name: Erland of Larvik
1047.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger. Immunity: Status whereby this card cannot be manually targeted. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
1047.ability:
Deploy: Boost all units in your deck by 1.
Adrenaline 3: Also gain Immunity.
Order: Remove boosts from all units in your deck, then boost this unit by the same amount.
1047.abilityHTML: Deploy: Boost all units in your deck by 1. Adrenaline 3: Also gain Immunity. Order: Remove boosts from all units in your deck, then boost this unit by the same amount.
1047.flavor: Erland founded the School of the Griffin, and hoped his emphasis on knightly values would help elevate the reputation of witchers among the common folk. Alas, his efforts would go in vain.

1048.name: Archgriffin
1048.ability: At the end of the round, shuffle this card back to your deck, keeping its boosts.
1048.abilityHTML: At the end of the round, shuffle this card back to your deck, keeping its boosts.
1048.flavor: Considered the embodiment of courage, loyalty and fighting spirit, the very essence of what Griffin Witchers are known for. However, the School of the Griffin was actually named after a knight errant known as Gryphon, who had long ago instilled these values into its founder.

1049.name: Kaer Seren
1049.keywordsHTML: Resilience: Status that allows a unit to remain on the battlefield at the end of the round, then disappears.\nNote: Boost and Armor are not carried over to the next round. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
1049.ability:
Resilience.
Deploy: Spawn and play Griffin Witcher Adept, Griffin Witcher, Griffin Witcher Mentor or Griffin Witcher Ranger.
Order: Boost a unit in your deck by 3.
1049.abilityHTML: Resilience. Deploy: Spawn and play Griffin Witcher Adept, Griffin Witcher, Griffin Witcher Mentor or Griffin Witcher Ranger. Order: Boost a unit in your deck by 3.
1049.flavor: Kaer Seren’s literary collection was its greatest treasure and the envy of a group of overzealous mages. In their attempt to seize it for themselves, they destroyed the very thing they desired most.

1050.name: Coën
1050.keywordsHTML: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
1050.ability: Zeal. Order: Boost all other units with power equal to Coën's power by the amount Coën is boosted.
1050.abilityHTML: Zeal. Order: Boost all other units with power equal to Coën's power by the amount Coën is boosted.
1050.flavor: “There is no such thing as a fair fight. Every advantage and every opportunity that arises is used in combat.” ⁠— Coën

1051.name: Keldar
1051.keywordsHTML: Resupply: Trigger this ability whenever you play a Warfare card. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger.
1051.ability:
Resupply: Spawn a Witcher Student on this row.
Adrenaline 4: At the end of your turn, Spawn a Witcher Student on this row.
1051.abilityHTML: Resupply: Spawn a Witcher Student on this row. Adrenaline 4: At the end of your turn, Spawn a Witcher Student on this row.
1051.flavor: “You blunt, brainless humanoids! What do you mean by ‘I don't know?’. You would go hunt the vampires with the Lebioda idol, smeared in garlic!” ⁠— Keldar

1052.name: Griffin Witcher
1052.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger. Lock: Status that disables a unit's abilities.
1052.ability:
Order (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 1.
Cooldown: 1.
Adrenaline 3: At the end of your turn, damage a random enemy unit by 3 and Lock self.
1052.abilityHTML: Order (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 1. Cooldown: 1. Adrenaline 3: At the end of your turn, damage a random enemy unit by 3 and Lock self.
1052.flavor: Silver swords are great, yeah. But have you ever tried silver-plated arrowheads?

1053.name: Griffin Witcher Mentor
1053.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger.
1053.ability:
Deploy: Draw your top unit, then shuffle a card from your hand back to your deck.
Adrenaline 4: Boost the unit you've drawn by 2.
1053.abilityHTML: Deploy: Draw your top unit, then shuffle a card from your hand back to your deck. Adrenaline 4: Boost the unit you've drawn by 2.
1053.flavor: Knowledge will keep you alive far longer than might, dear boy.

1054.name: Griffin Witcher Ranger
1054.keywordsHTML: Formation: If played on the melee row, gain Zeal. If played on the ranged row, boost self by 1. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
1054.ability:
Formation.
Deploy: Boost self by 1 for every unit on an enemy row.
Order: Transfer all boosts from self to an allied unit.
1054.abilityHTML: Formation. Deploy: Boost self by 1 for every unit on an enemy row. Order: Transfer all boosts from self to an allied unit.
1054.flavor: Griffin Witcher Rangers are unparalleled masters in the art of tracking and hunting, even amid the most inhospitable of environments. No matter the trail, they won’t rest until their prey is captured, or killed.

1055.name: Griffin Witcher Adept
1055.keywordsHTML: Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
1055.ability:
Shield.
Order: Transform an allied Witcher into a base copy of Griffin Witcher Adept.
1055.abilityHTML: Shield. Order: Transform an allied Witcher into a base copy of Griffin Witcher Adept.
1055.flavor: At Kaer Seren, students are afforded the luxury of choice when it comes to their final Trial. They either locate and retrieve a griffin’s egg, or recite the entirety of Liber Tenebrarum verbatim. To Old Keldar’s dismay, no one has ever chosen the latter.

1056.name: Target Practice
1056.keywordsHTML: Spawn: Add a card to the game.
1056.ability: Boost an allied unit by 4. If there is a Witcher on the boosted unit's row, also Spawn a Witcher Student on that row.
1056.abilityHTML: Boost an allied unit by 4. If there is a Witcher on the boosted unit's row, also Spawn a Witcher Student on that row.
1056.flavor: Most Griffins can split an apple in two from a hundred paces. Just make sure you don’t move.

1057.name: Viy
1057.keywordsHTML: Deathwish: Trigger this ability when destroyed and moved from the battlefield to the graveyard. Note: Banished units are not sent to the graveyard.
1057.ability: Deathwish: Shuffle Viy back to your deck then increase its base power by 3.
1057.abilityHTML: Deathwish: Shuffle Viy back to your deck then increase its base power by 3.
1057.flavor: What has a million legs and can eat a city whole?

1058.name: Koshchey
1058.keywordsHTML: Thrive: Boost this unit by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a unit with higher power. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger.
1058.ability:
Thrive.
Whenever this unit's Thrive is triggered, Spawn a Drone in this row.
Adrenaline 4: Whenever this unit's Thrive is triggered, Spawn an Endrega Larva in this row instead.
1058.abilityHTML: Thrive. Whenever this unit's Thrive is triggered, Spawn a Drone in this row. Adrenaline 4: Whenever this unit's Thrive is triggered, Spawn an Endrega Larva in this row instead.
1058.flavor: If I tell you koshchey is death, you'll go to the creek anyway, right?

1059.name: Dol Dhu Lokke
1059.keywordsHTML: Resilience: Status that allows a unit to remain on the battlefield at the end of the round, then disappears.\nNote: Boost and Armor are not carried over to the next round. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
1059.ability:
Resilience.
Deploy: Spawn and play Succubus, Phooca, Chimera or Hybrid.
Order: Move the highest power unit to the top of your deck and Spawn a Drone on both sides of this card.
1059.abilityHTML: Resilience. Deploy: Spawn and play Succubus, Phooca, Chimera or Hybrid. Order: Move the highest power unit to the top of your deck and Spawn a Drone on both sides of this card.
1059.flavor: A monster lair unlike any other. Home to countless horrors and monstrosities. Even a witcher would think twice about setting foot near this hellhole.

1060.name: Idr
1060.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger. Consume: Destroy a unit and boost self by its power. If target is in the graveyard, Banish it instead. Immunity: Status whereby this card cannot be manually targeted. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
1060.ability:
Order (Adrenaline 3): Consume all Tokens on this row and gain Immunity.
Whenever you Consume one or more units, Spawn a Drone in this row.
1060.abilityHTML: Order (Adrenaline 3): Consume all Tokens on this row and gain Immunity. Whenever you Consume one or more units, Spawn a Drone in this row.

1061.name: Wererat
1061.keywordsHTML: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused. Consume: Destroy a unit and boost self by its power. If target is in the graveyard, Banish it instead.
1061.ability:
Order: Reset this unit's power and Spawn a number of Rats in this row equal to the amount of boost it lost.
Cooldown: 1.
At the end of your turn, Consume a unit to the right.
1061.abilityHTML: Order: Reset this unit's power and Spawn a number of Rats in this row equal to the amount of boost it lost. Cooldown: 1. At the end of your turn, Consume a unit to the right.
1061.flavor: As a child, Idarran lived in the canals of Vizima. He was a natural-born genius, and at the age of five, he had already started experimenting on sewer rats.

1062.name: Succubus
1062.keywordsHTML: Deathwish: Trigger this ability when destroyed and moved from the battlefield to the graveyard. Note: Banished units are not sent to the graveyard. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played). Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game when it leaves the battlefield. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger.
1062.ability:
Deathwish: At the end of your turn, if there is another Succubus in your graveyard, Summon self from your graveyard to a random row and gain Doomed.
Adrenaline 3: Don't gain Doomed.
1062.abilityHTML: Deathwish: At the end of your turn, if there is another Succubus in your graveyard, Summon self from your graveyard to a random row and gain Doomed. Adrenaline 3: Don't gain Doomed.

1063.name: Phooca
1063.keywordsHTML: Thrive: Boost this unit by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a unit with higher power.
1063.flavor: Particularly troublesome are the larger, stronger breed—a rare kind of nekker known as phoocas. If you see one, run.

1064.name: Chimera
1064.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Consume: Destroy a unit and boost self by its power. If target is in the graveyard, Banish it instead. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger.
1064.ability:
Deploy: Consume an allied unit.
Adrenaline 4: Boost all copies of Consumed unit in that unit's row by 1.
1064.abilityHTML: Deploy: Consume an allied unit. Adrenaline 4: Boost all copies of Consumed unit in that unit's row by 1.
1064.flavor: At first, Cosimo combined genes of a fiend and a griffin. Then he added some traces of insectoid and wyvern to the pool, resulting in a creature far worse than the sum of its parts.

1065.name: Spontaneous Evolution
1065.keywordsHTML: Spawn: Add a card to the game. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
1065.ability:
Boost an allied unit by 4 and gain an additional effect based on the unit's category.

Insectoid - Spawn 3 Drones on the boosted unit's row.
Beast -  Boost that unit by 8 instead.
Ogroid - Give all Ogroids in your hand 2 Armor.
1065.abilityHTML: Boost an allied unit by 4 and gain an additional effect based on the unit's category. Insectoid - Spawn 3 Drones on the boosted unit's row. Beast - Boost that unit by 8 instead. Ogroid - Give all Ogroids in your hand 2 Armor.
1065.flavor: Professor Malaspina accidentally added an extra ingredient to the concoction—compound X.

1066.name: Fallen Rayla
1066.keywordsHTML: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability. Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger.
1066.ability:
Profit 3.
Tribute 3: Gain Veil.
Adrenaline 5: Whenever you pay a Tribute ability, boost self by that Tribute's cost.
1066.abilityHTML: Profit 3. Tribute 3: Gain Veil. Adrenaline 5: Whenever you pay a Tribute ability, boost self by that Tribute's cost.
1066.flavor: Slain by the arrows of those she had hunted. Or so many thought. The Salamandra had different plans for her.

1067.name: Salamander
1067.keywordsHTML: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability.
1067.ability:
Profit 1.
Deploy: Poison a unit. 
Tribute 9: Poison all units on the battlefield instead.
Increase the Profit by 1 for every allied Salamandra unit.
1067.abilityHTML: Profit 1. Deploy: Poison a unit. Tribute 9: Poison all units on the battlefield instead. Increase the Profit by 1 for every allied Salamandra unit.
1067.flavor: Despite their cute little faces, it's best to avoid petting them, as the salamander, when threatened, secretes a deadly toxin that boils the very skin it comes into contact with.

1068.name: Salamandra Hideout
1068.keywordsHTML: Resilience: Status that allows a unit to remain on the battlefield at the end of the round, then disappears.\nNote: Boost and Armor are not carried over to the next round. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it.
1068.ability:
Resilience.
Deploy: Spawn and play Failed Experiment, Salamandra Abomination, Salamandra Mage or Salamandra Lackey.
Order: Move Poison from an ally to another unit.
1068.abilityHTML: Resilience. Deploy: Spawn and play Failed Experiment, Salamandra Abomination, Salamandra Mage or Salamandra Lackey. Order: Move Poison from an ally to another unit.
1068.flavor: Those who go lurking in the sewers beneath Vizima better watch out, as there are things far worse than rats hidden amid the darkness of the city’s underbelly.

1069.name: Roland Bleinheim
1069.keywordsHTML: Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round.
1069.ability: Whenever a unit gains Poison, gain 2 Coins.
1069.abilityHTML: Whenever a unit gains Poison, gain 2 Coins.
1069.flavor: “How's my brother doing in the sewers, I wonder...” ⁠— Roland

1070.name: Gellert Bleinheim
1070.keywordsHTML: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
1070.ability:
Profit 2.
Fee 1: Poison an allied unit and boost it by 2.
Adrenaline 5: Cooldown: 1.
1070.abilityHTML: Profit 2. Fee 1: Poison an allied unit and boost it by 2. Adrenaline 5: Cooldown: 1.
1070.flavor: “How's my brother doing in the woods, I wonder...” ⁠— Gellert

1071.name: Salamandra Lackey
1071.keywordsHTML: Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round.
1071.ability: The first time you gain a Coin each turn, boost self by 1.
1071.abilityHTML: The first time you gain a Coin each turn, boost self by 1.
1071.flavor: Lackeys are expected to perform their first five jobs for no pay, demonstrating their passion for the gig.

1072.name: Salamandra Abomination
1072.keywordsHTML: Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability. Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger. Purify: Remove all statuses.
1072.ability:
Tribute 1: Poison self.
Whenever this unit is Poisoned, boost self by 2.
Adrenaline 6: At the end of your turn, Purify self.
1072.abilityHTML: Tribute 1: Poison self. Whenever this unit is Poisoned, boost self by 2. Adrenaline 6: At the end of your turn, Purify self.
1072.flavor: Salamandra’s scientists were so preoccupied with whether they could, they never once considered if they should.

1073.name: Salamandra Mage
1073.keywordsHTML: Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger.
1073.ability:
Tribute 4: Damage 3 adjacent enemy units by 2.
Whenever you pay a Tribute ability, gain 1 Coins.
Adrenaline 5: Gain 2 Coins instead.
1073.abilityHTML: Tribute 4: Damage 3 adjacent enemy units by 2. Whenever you pay a Tribute ability, gain 1 Coins. Adrenaline 5: Gain 2 Coins instead.
1073.flavor: Building a fire warms people for a day, but setting them on fire…

1074.name: Failed Experiment
1074.keywordsHTML: Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round. Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it.
1074.ability:
At the end of your turn, lose 1 Coin. If you have no Coins, damage self by 1 instead.
While Poisoned, disable this ability.
1074.abilityHTML: At the end of your turn, lose 1 Coin. If you have no Coins, damage self by 1 instead. While Poisoned, disable this ability.
1074.flavor: Even failed experiments can serve a purpose. How else would one be expected to push the boundaries of knowledge?

1075.name: Stolen Mutagens
1075.keywordsHTML: Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round. Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins.
1075.ability:
Pick a mutagen:

Red -  Damage an enemy unit by 4.
Blue -  Poison an allied unit and gain 5 Coins.
Green - Boost an allied unit by 4 and give it Veil.

If you control at least 2 Salamandra units, Profit 3.
1075.abilityHTML: Pick a mutagen: Red - Damage an enemy unit by 4. Blue - Poison an allied unit and gain 5 Coins. Green - Boost an allied unit by 4 and give it Veil. If you control at least 2 Salamandra units, Profit 3.
1075.flavor: Like organ harvesting—but far more lucrative.

1076.name: Hybrid
1076.keywordsHTML: Consume: Destroy a unit and boost self by its power. If target is in the graveyard, Banish it instead.
1076.ability: Whenever you Consume one or more units, boost self by 1.
1076.abilityHTML: Whenever you Consume one or more units, boost self by 1.
1076.flavor: When one head just isn’t enough.

1077.name: Saber-Tooth Tiger: Stealth
1077.ability: At the start of your turn, damage all enemy units that are alone on their row by 2 and transform self into Saber-Tooth Tiger.
1077.abilityHTML: At the start of your turn, damage all enemy units that are alone on their row by 2 and transform self into Saber-Tooth Tiger.
1077.flavor: The prized possession of a royal menagerie, until a commando of Scoia'tael assaulted the exhibition, released the beast, and set it upon its cruel masters. Since that day, it has acquired a selective taste for human flesh.

1078.name: Madoc
1078.keywordsHTML: Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played). Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Cataclysm: At the start of the owner's turn, split 3 damage randomly between units in this row.
1078.ability:
Whenever you play a Bomb card, Summon this card from your deck or graveyard to random allied row.
Order: Spawn Cataclysm for 1 turn on the opposite row, then destroy self.
1078.abilityHTML: Whenever you play a Bomb card, Summon this card from your deck or graveyard to random allied row. Order: Spawn Cataclysm for 1 turn on the opposite row, then destroy self.
1078.flavor: In a flash, Madoc pulled out a leathery orb with a fuse, ignited it with a snap of his fingers, and tossed it at the feet of the caterwauling behemoth.

1079.name: Anna Henrietta
1079.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
1079.ability: Deploy (Ranged): Replace your leader ability with a base copy of your opponent's leader ability.
1079.abilityHTML: Deploy (Ranged): Replace your leader ability with a base copy of your opponent's leader ability.
1079.flavor: As head of state, I must judge her fairly. But she is my sister, thus my heart bleeds for her…

1080.name: Emhyr var Emreis
1080.keyword: zeal, deploy, spying, order, seize, devotion
1080.keywordsHTML: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spying: Status with no additional effect. Can be used by other cards and abilities. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Seize: Move an enemy unit to the opposite row and give it Spying. If it already had Spying, remove Spying instead. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
1080.ability:
Zeal.
Deploy: Draw a card, then move a card from your hand to the bottom of your deck.
Whenever your opponent plays a unit, give it Spying.
Order: Seize a 1-power enemy unit with Spying.
Devotion: At the end of your turn, refresh this card's Order.
1080.abilityHTML: Zeal. Deploy: Draw a card, then move a card from your hand to the bottom of your deck. Whenever your opponent plays a unit, give it Spying. Order: Seize a 1-power enemy unit with Spying. Devotion: At the end of your turn, refresh this card's Order.
1080.flavor: They do not call me the Patient. Take care they do not call you the Headless.

1081.name: Crach an Craite
1081.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
1081.ability:
Deploy: Give 2 Armor to 3 Pirates or Ships in your hand.
Order: Damage a unit by 1.
Cooldown: 2
Whenever you play a Pirate or Ship next to Crach, damage it and the lowest power enemy unit by each others power.
1081.abilityHTML: Deploy: Give 2 Armor to 3 Pirates or Ships in your hand. Order: Damage a unit by 1. Cooldown: 2 Whenever you play a Pirate or Ship next to Crach, damage it and the lowest power enemy unit by each others power.
1081.flavor: Nilfgaardians call 'im Tirth ys Muire, the Wild Boar o' the Sea. Use 'im to scare their kiddies!

1082.name: Eist Tuirseach
1082.keyword: veteran, deploy, bloodthirst, discard, summon, devotion
1082.keywordsHTML: Veteran: At the start of the second and third round, increase the base power of this unit by 1. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Bloodthirst: Number of damaged enemy units required to trigger this ability. Discard: Move a card from your hand to the graveyard. Note: Related abilities are not triggered when discarding manually. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played). Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
1082.ability:
Veteran.
Deploy, Bloodthirst 3: Draw a card, then Discard a card.
Whenever you Discard a Skellige unit during your turn, Summon it from your graveyard to this row.
Counter: 2.
Devotion: Also works whenever a Skellige unit enters your graveyard during your turn.
1082.abilityHTML: Veteran. Deploy, Bloodthirst 3: Draw a card, then Discard a card. Whenever you Discard a Skellige unit during your turn, Summon it from your graveyard to this row. Counter: 2. Devotion: Also works whenever a Skellige unit enters your graveyard during your turn.
1082.flavor: Eist came to Cintra to help Crach an Craite win the hand of Princess Pavetta, yet wound up winning her mother's heart for himself.

1083.name: Brouver Hoog
1083.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power. Barricade: Trigger this ability if the unit has armor.
1083.ability:
Deploy: Gain 1 Armor for every Dwarf in your hand.
Barricade: At the end of your turn, boost all Dwarves with Armor on this row by 1.
1083.abilityHTML: Deploy: Gain 1 Armor for every Dwarf in your hand. Barricade: At the end of your turn, boost all Dwarves with Armor on this row by 1.
1083.flavor: That doddery dolt? Ye cannae even tell if he's alive or stuffed!

1084.name: Eldain
1084.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
1084.ability:
Deploy: Transform all your face-up Traps into Elven Deadeyes.
Devotion: Also transform your other artifacts.
1084.abilityHTML: Deploy: Transform all your face-up Traps into Elven Deadeyes. Devotion: Also transform your other artifacts.
1084.flavor: The king once dispatched an envoy to Eldain… despite my advice to the contrary. Found the envoy the next day, eyes gouged out, shaft of his white flag jammed down his throat.

1085.name: King Foltest
1085.keywordsHTML: Spawn: Add a card to the game. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
1085.ability:
The first time a bronze unit on your side of the battlefield is boosted each turn, Spawn a base copy of it at the bottom of your deck.
Devotion: Also boost the Spawned copy by 1.
At the end of your turn, boost the unit to the right by 1.
1085.abilityHTML: The first time a bronze unit on your side of the battlefield is boosted each turn, Spawn a base copy of it at the bottom of your deck. Devotion: Also boost the Spawned copy by 1. At the end of your turn, boost the unit to the right by 1.
1085.flavor: Don't need advisors and their schemes. I place my trust in my soldiers' blades.

1086.name: Queen Meve
1086.keywordsHTML: Inspired: Trigger this ability if this unit's current power is higher than its base power. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
1086.ability:
Inspired: At the end of your turn, lower the Counter by 1.
Counter: 3
When the Counter reaches 0, boost all allied units by 1 and reset the Counter.
Whenever this unit receives a boost, gain 1 Armor.
1086.abilityHTML: Inspired: At the end of your turn, lower the Counter by 1. Counter: 3 When the Counter reaches 0, boost all allied units by 1 and reset the Counter. Whenever this unit receives a boost, gain 1 Armor.
1086.flavor: We're at war, when rulers don't strive nor choose. When rulers grasp sword and shield and ride out to defend their subjects.

1087.name: Dettlaff van der Eretein
1087.keyword: deploy, spawn, blood_moon, order, bleeding, deathblow, cooldown
1087.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Blood Moon: At the start of the owner's turn, give a random unit in this row Bleeding (2). If the unit is already Bleeding, damage it by 2 instead. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor. Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
1087.ability:
Deploy: Spawn Blood Moon on an enemy row for 2 turns. Increase the duration by 1 for every adjacent Vampire.
Order: Damage an enemy unit with Bleeding by 1.
Deathblow: Spawn an Ekimmara on this row.
Cooldown: 1
1087.abilityHTML: Deploy: Spawn Blood Moon on an enemy row for 2 turns. Increase the duration by 1 for every adjacent Vampire. Order: Damage an enemy unit with Bleeding by 1. Deathblow: Spawn an Ekimmara on this row. Cooldown: 1
1087.flavor: He did not love like a man, but like an animal. Madly, deeply, unconditionally. Wildly.

1088.name: Unseen Elder
1088.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
1088.ability:
Deploy: Give Bleeding (4) to an enemy unit.
At the end of your turn, give Bleeding (2) to a random enemy unit without Bleeding.
Devotion: Bleeding on enemy units also triggers at the end of your turn.
1088.abilityHTML: Deploy: Give Bleeding (4) to an enemy unit. At the end of your turn, give Bleeding (2) to a random enemy unit without Bleeding. Devotion: Bleeding on enemy units also triggers at the end of your turn.
1088.flavor: No one, not even among the higher vampires, knows exactly how old the Unseen Elder is. They only know they should never, under any circumstances, defy his will.

1089.name: Cleaver
1089.keywordsHTML: Intimidate: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a Crime card. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins.
1089.ability:
Intimidate.
Deploy: Spawn and play Shakedown.
Increase this card's Intimidate by 1 for every adjacent Crownsplitter.
Fee 4: Spawn a Cleaver's Muscle on this row.
1089.abilityHTML: Intimidate. Deploy: Spawn and play Shakedown. Increase this card's Intimidate by 1 for every adjacent Crownsplitter. Fee 4: Spawn a Cleaver's Muscle on this row.
1089.flavor: Me hogs willnae go hungry th' day thanks to ye.

1090.name: Whoreson Junior
1090.keywordsHTML: Insanity: If you have insufficient Coins, damage this unit by its Fee amount, ignoring its Armor, to trigger its Fee ability.\nNote: Insanity cannot be used if it would destroy the unit and works only if damage is inflicted. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins.
1090.ability:
Insanity.
Deploy: Damage a boosted enemy unit by 6. Gain a Coin for every point of excess damage dealt.
Devotion: Damage an enemy unit instead.
Fee 3: Destroy an enemy unit with 3 power or less.
1090.abilityHTML: Insanity. Deploy: Damage a boosted enemy unit by 6. Gain a Coin for every point of excess damage dealt. Devotion: Damage an enemy unit instead. Fee 3: Destroy an enemy unit with 3 power or less.
1090.flavor: A war with Whoreson will see Novigrad's gutters run red with blood.

1091.name: Rience
1091.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
1091.ability:
Deploy: Look at the top 3 units in your deck. Move 1 to your graveyard, then destroy an enemy unit with power equal to that unit's power
Order: Set the power of a unit to match the number of cards in your deck.
1091.abilityHTML: Deploy: Look at the top 3 units in your deck. Move 1 to your graveyard, then destroy an enemy unit with power equal to that unit's power Order: Set the power of a unit to match the number of cards in your deck.
1091.flavor: “I, Rience, taught her pain. With these hands, with these fingers. And I promised her that should you fall into my hands, princess, I would also teach you pain. With these hands, with these fingers…” - Rience

1092.name: Dead Man's Tongue
1092.keywordsHTML: Banish: Remove from the game. Note: Does not count as being destroyed.
1092.ability:
Banish a card from your deck. If it was a bronze, Banish another bronze card from your deck.
Boost an allied unit by the combined provision cost of Banished cards.
1092.abilityHTML: Banish a card from your deck. If it was a bronze, Banish another bronze card from your deck. Boost an allied unit by the combined provision cost of Banished cards.
1092.flavor: They say the dead tell no tales. Truth is, they speak no lies.

1093.name: Blightmaker
1093.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
1093.ability:
Deploy: Move a card in your deck to the top of it. If it was a Mage, Spawn The Guardian in this row.
If it was a special card, Spawn and play a Cow Carcass.
1093.abilityHTML: Deploy: Move a card in your deck to the top of it. If it was a Mage, Spawn The Guardian in this row. If it was a special card, Spawn and play a Cow Carcass.
1093.flavor: In an attempt to manufacture a superior grapevine, the empire’s botanists stumbled upon the creation of a malignant alchemical, and thus was sown the seed of a scheme most sinister.

1094.name: Mage Assassin
1094.keywordsHTML: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).
1094.ability:
Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2.
If moved to the top of your deck during your turn, Summon self to a random allied row and damage a random enemy unit by 2.
